translated: If there were no foundation consciousness, it would be impossible for it to appropriate a life, it would be impossible for it to enter the first life, it would be impossible for it to enter a life clearly, it would be impossible for it to be a seed, it would be impossible for it to be karma, it would be impossible for it to be physical sensation,

analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho la mi srid pas so //

original: ci'i phyir gnas len pa mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas len pa mi rung zhe na /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni da ltar byung ba'i rkyen gyi rgyu las byung ba yin te /

original: ji skad du rnam par shes pa rnams ni dbang po dang / yul dang / yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher bstan pa lta bu ste /

original: de ni rgyu dang po'o //

original: gzhan yang @2b rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni /

original: de ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag la ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag la ni /

analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin par bsdus pa'i rigs gang yin pa de mi dmigs te /

analyzed: de ni rgyu gsum pa'o //

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni gnas nges pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag ni gnas nges pa las 'byung ste /

analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis zin par mi 'gyur bas mi rung ngo //

analyzed: zin par yang mi rung ste rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir te ;

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /

original: de ni rgyu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu lnga pa'o //

translated: Thus, because they arise from causes consisting of previous karma and present conditions, because they are virtuous or nonvirtuous, because their type is not perceived, because their location is not ascertained, and because the error of repeatedly grasping them would ensue, they are untenable.

original: ci'i phyir dang po 'jug cing 'byung ba mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dang po 'jug cing 'byung ba mi rung zhe na /

analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe /

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par bzhag la /
translated: In brief, the engagement of the foundation consciousness is presented in four ways.

original: ldog pa ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni rnam pa gcig gis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Its reversal is presented in one way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The presentation of engagement through its object, the presentation of engagement through its concomitants, the presentation of engagement through being the condition of one thing, and the presentation of engagement through its simultaneous entity.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni 'jug pa rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis ni 'jug pa rnam par gzhag la /
translated: These four present engagement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pas ni ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pas ni ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The presentation of the reversal of affliction presents its reversal.

original: de la dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of engagement through its object?

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug ste /
translated: In brief, the foundation consciousness engages through two kinds of objects.

original: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pas so //üîΩde la nang gi len @4a * //
analyzed: nang gi len pa rnam par rig pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa rnam par rig pas so // de la nang gi len @4a * //
translated: The internal appropriation is the representation of the sense faculties, and the external appropriation is the representation of the external world in all its variety.

original: pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang rten dang dbang po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags dang rten dang dbang po'i gzugs so //
translated: The internal appropriation is the sense faculties that are the basis of the latent impressions of attachment to the imagined reality.

original: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can gyi khams na'o //
translated: Moreover, this is in the realm of form.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa na ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do //üîΩde la phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa rnam par rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa na ni bag chags len pa kho nar zad do // de la phyi rol gyi snod rnam pa yongs su ma bcad pa rnam par rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: In the formless realm, there is only the appropriation of latent impressions.üîΩThe external appropriation is the representation of the external world in all its variety.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig rten dang snod kyi rgyun rnam par rig pa ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jig rten dang snod kyi rgyun rnam par rig pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the representation of the world and the external world in all its variety, based on the very same object of the store consciousness that is the internal appropriation.üîΩIt is like, for example, a burning lamp.

original: dper na mar me 'bar ba ni snying po dang snum gyi rgyus ni nang du 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na mar me 'bar ba ni snying po dang snum gyi rgyus ni nang du 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: The wick and the oil are the cause of the inner flame.

original: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa bzhin du nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa 'di la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni 'od 'byung bar byed pa bzhin du nang gi len pa'i dmigs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa 'di la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as light is emitted externally, so too should the internal objective support of appropriation and the external objective support be viewed in the same way as the store consciousness.

original: dmigs pa de ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su gcad par dka' ba'i phyir dra ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang yongs su gcad par dka' ba'i phyir dra ba yin no //
translated: This objective support is a net because even worldly experts find it difficult to discern.

original: dmigs pa de ni rtag tu yod pa yin te /üîΩlan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni rtag tu yod pa yin te / lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: This objective support is always present,

original: lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lan 'ga' gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: sometimes changing and sometimes not changing.

original: 'on kyang dang po pa'i len pa'i skad cig la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang dang po pa'i len pa'i skad cig la brten nas /
translated: However, based on the first moment of appropriation,

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes par rig pa ro gcig pas 'jug par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes par rig pa ro gcig pas 'jug par 'gyur ro ;
translated: consciousness operates with a single taste for as long as one lives.

original: / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni dmigs pa la skad cig pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni dmigs pa la skad cig pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: That store consciousness should be viewed as momentary with respect to its objective support,

original: skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rgyud kyis 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rgyud kyis 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: operating through a continuum of moments,

original: gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: not as a single entity.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams na ni rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa can du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams na ni rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa can du brjod par bya'o //
translated: That foundation consciousness is said to have a small object in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni rgyu chen por gyur ba'i dmigs pa can no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni rgyu chen por gyur ba'i dmigs pa can no //
translated: In the form realm it has a large object.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na ni rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa can no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na ni rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa can no //
translated: In the formless realm, in the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness, it has an immeasurable object.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa can no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa can no //
translated: In the sphere of nothingness, it has a subtle object.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched na ni rgyu shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa can du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched na ni rgyu shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa can du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, it should be seen to have a very subtle object.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis rnam par rig pa dang / phra ba rnam par rig pa dang / 'dra ba rnam par rig pa dang / skad cig pa rnam par @4b rig pa dang / rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis rnam par rig pa dang / phra ba rnam par rig pa dang / 'dra ba rnam par rig pa dang / skad cig pa rnam par @4b rig pa dang / rgyu chung ngu'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang /
translated: Thus, the two kinds of objects are the cognized object, the subtle cognized object, the similar cognized object, the momentary cognized object, the small-cause cognized object,

original: rgyu chen por gyur pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu chen por gyur pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu tshad med pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / rgyu shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dmigs pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the alayavij√±ana is engaged by the objective supports of the great elements, the objective supports of immeasurable elements, the objective supports of subtle elements, and the objective supports of extremely subtle elements.

original: de la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the explanation of engagement through association?

original: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pas na sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba lnga po yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pas na sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa kun tu 'gro ba lnga po yid la byed pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In this regard, the alayavij√±ana is associated with the five omnipresent mental factors: attention, contact, feeling, conceptualization, and volition.

original: chos de dag kyang rnam par smin par bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir phra ba dang / gtan du dmigs pa gcig la mtshungs par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang rnam par smin par bsdus pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir phra ba dang / gtan du dmigs pa gcig la mtshungs par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And they are single-pointed, because they always engage in a single object.

original: sems las byung ba de dag las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni gcig tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba de dag las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni gcig tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Among those mental factors, the feeling that is associated with the store consciousness is exclusively neither-pleasure-nor-pain and indeterminate.

original: de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the other mental factors that are different from it.

original: de ltar na sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin par rigs 'dra ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'jug pa phra ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa gcig la mtshungs par 'jug pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na sems las byung ba kun tu 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin par rigs 'dra ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'jug pa phra ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / dmigs pa gcig la mtshungs par 'jug pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: Thus, the foundation consciousness is to be understood as engaged through its associates, because it is associated with universal mental factors, with the five omnipresent mental factors, with the five factors that are results of evolution, with the five factors that are similar to it in kind, with the five factors that are subtle in their engagement, and with the five factors that engage in a single object.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is also to be understood as engaged through its associates, because it is associated with the factor that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant and with the indeterminate factors.

original: de la gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gcig gi rkyen nyid gcig yin pas 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of the foundation consciousness as a condition for a single factor?

original: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de sa bon gyi dngos po dang rten byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de sa bon gyi dngos po dang rten byed pas so //
translated: The foundation consciousness performs the function of condition for the active consciousnesses in two ways: as a seed and as a support.

original: de la sa bon gyi dngos @5a * //
analyzed: de la sa bon gyi dngos @5a * //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the seed of the active consciousnesses.

original: po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever active consciousnesses there are, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral, all arise from the seeds of the foundation consciousness.

original: de dag thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin no //üîΩde la rten byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas zin pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa yin no // de la rten byed pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas zin pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams la brten nas /
translated: The foundation consciousness is the support of the active consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag 'byung bar 'gyur gyi ma zin pa dag las ni ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag 'byung bar 'gyur gyi ma zin pa dag las ni ma yin //
translated: The five collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the material organs that are appropriated by the foundation consciousness, but not in dependence on those that are not appropriated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi gnas mig la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi gnas mig la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na /
translated: The five collections of consciousness have the eye, etc. as their bases. If the foundation consciousness exists, it is the basis of the mental faculty and mental consciousness.

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur gyi med ni na ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur gyi med ni na ma yin no //
translated: The five collections of consciousness have as their support the eye, etc., and in the same way, if the store consciousness exists, the mental faculty and the mental consciousness also exist, but not if it does not exist.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba byed de /
translated: The active forms of consciousness perform the function of condition for the store consciousness in two ways.

original: tshe 'di la sa bon yongs su brtas par byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma la de mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: tshe 'di la sa bon yongs su brtas par byed pa dang / tshe phyi ma la de mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa skyed par byed pas so //
translated: They nourish the seeds in this life and they generate the seeds that will be actualized in a future life.

original: de la tshe 'di la sa bon yongs su brtas par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di la sa bon yongs su brtas par byed pa ni /
translated: The nourishment of seeds in this life means that

analyzed: ji lta ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rang gi rten la rten de dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas bag chags sgo bar byed do //

analyzed: de la lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of the active consciousness in terms of simultaneous activity?

analyzed: kun gzhi @5b rnam par shes pa ni res 'ga' ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig kho na dang lhan cig tu 'jug ste /
translated: The foundation consciousness sometimes occurs simultaneously with only one of the active consciousnesses.

original: 'di lta ste yid dang ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste yid dang ngo //
translated: For example, it occurs simultaneously with the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / rlom pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid gang yin pa de ni sems yod pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs dag na yang dus rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / rlom pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid gang yin pa de ni sems yod pa dang / sems med pa'i gnas skabs dag na yang dus rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, the mind that is the apprehension of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the aspect of conceit always occur and function together with the store consciousness, even in the states of mindlessness.

original: da ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nga'o snyam pa dang / bdag go snyam du dmigs shing rlom pa'i rnam pa can yin no //
analyzed: da ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nga'o snyam pa dang / bdag go snyam du dmigs shing rlom pa'i rnam pa can yin no //
translated: Now, the store consciousness is the object of the conceit that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: res 'ga' ni yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
translated: Sometimes it occurs and functions together with the mental consciousness.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig dang gsum dang ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba gcig dang gsum dang ngo //
translated: Sometimes it occurs and functions together with one of the five consciousnesses, or with three.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba dang bzhi dang ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba dang bzhi dang ngo //
translated: Sometimes it occurs and functions together with two of the five consciousnesses, or with four.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po lhan cig 'byung ba dang bdun char gyi bar dag dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po lhan cig 'byung ba dang bdun char gyi bar dag dang / lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
translated: Sometimes, it occurs together with the five collections of consciousness, up to all seven.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni yid la brten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni yid la brten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This mental consciousness is called ‚Äúdependent on the mind.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gyi yid ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba mi 'grol la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi yid ma 'gags na rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba mi 'grol la /
translated: As long as the mind that is the causal condition is not stopped, the bondage of the representations is not liberated.

original: 'gags na ni de 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags na ni de 'grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But when it is stopped, then it is liberated.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa dang / rang gi yul la dmigs pa yin te /üîΩde la gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi yul la cig car ram /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa dang / rang gi yul la dmigs pa yin te / de la gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi yul la cig car ram /
translated: This mental consciousness is the apprehension of the objects of others and the apprehension of its own object.

original: cig car ma yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: cig car ma yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of the objects of others is the simultaneous or non-simultaneous apprehension of the objects of the five collections of consciousness.

original: rang gi yul la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa med par chos la dmigs nas 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi yul la dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi dmigs pa med par chos la dmigs nas 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of its own object is the occurrence of the mental consciousness without the object of the five collections of consciousness, apprehending a phenomenon.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang res 'ga' ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams dang 'dren mar 'jug ste /üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang res 'ga' ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams dang 'dren mar 'jug ste / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas /
translated: The store consciousness sometimes functions in combination with the feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain.

original: tshor ba gang dag yin pa de dag de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba gang dag yin pa de dag de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the feelings that occur in the active forms of consciousness arise in dependence on that store consciousness.

original: de la mi rnams dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kha cig gi nang na ni lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal yang @6a * //üîΩma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa de dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: de la mi rnams dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kha cig gi nang na ni lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba sdug bsngal yang @6a * // ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa de dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs kyi tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: Among humans, among the gods in the realm of desire, and among some animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings, the feelings that are innate to the store consciousness and the feelings that occur in the active forms of consciousness arise in combination, sometimes as pleasure, sometimes as pain, and sometimes as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /üîΩbde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The feelings that are innate to the store consciousness and the feelings that occur in the active forms of consciousness arise in combination, sometimes as pleasure, sometimes as pain, and sometimes as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de dag gi rgyun 'dren mar lhan cig tu 'byung zhing 'jug go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa de dag gi rgyun 'dren mar lhan cig tu 'byung zhing 'jug go //
translated: The feelings that are innate to the store consciousness and the feelings that occur in the active forms of consciousness arise in combination, sometimes as pleasure, sometimes as pain, and sometimes as neither pleasure nor pain.

original: sems can dmyal ba dag na ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dag na ni sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: In the hells, there is neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zil gyis mnan te /
translated: In the hells, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant sensation is overwhelmed by the unpleasant sensation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'ba' zhig ma 'dres pa de nyid dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyun 'ba' zhig ma 'dres pa de nyid dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
translated: It occurs and functions only in association with the stream of the unpleasant sensation alone.

original: de yang zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de yang zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba yin par blta'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand because it is overwhelmed.

original: sems can dmyal ba dag na sdug bsngal dang ci lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum gyis pa'i lha rnams la ni bde bar dang ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dag na sdug bsngal dang ci lta ba de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum gyis pa'i lha rnams la ni bde bar dang ngo //
translated: Just as in the hells, so in the third absorption, pleasant sensation is overwhelmed by unpleasant sensation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan cad srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag la ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan cad srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag la ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ngo //
translated: In the fourth absorption and above up to the summit of existence, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant sensation is overwhelmed by neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant sensation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
translated: Sometimes the storehouse consciousness arises and engages together with the mental factors that are associated with the active forms of consciousness, whether they are virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the storehouse consciousness also arises and engages together with the active forms of consciousness.

original: glo bur gyi tshor ba rnams dang / glo bur gyi chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
analyzed: glo bur gyi tshor ba rnams dang / glo bur gyi chos dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
translated: It also arises and engages together with the adventitious feelings and the adventitious virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral mental factors.

original: de ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de ni de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par ni mi brjod do //
translated: However, it is not said to be associated with them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa mi mtshungs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi mtshungs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they engage with dissimilar objects.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: For example,

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig dang lhan cig 'byung yang de ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang chos mtshungs pa 'gas tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig dang lhan cig 'byung yang de ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang chos mtshungs pa 'gas tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, although the eye consciousness arises together with the eye faculty, it is not associated with it. In the same way, one should understand that there is no contradiction in the way that the foundation consciousness and the active forms of consciousness operate together.

original: dper na sems las byung ba'i chos sems las byung ba nyid bye brag med pa rnams mtshan nyid sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa la 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sems las byung ba'i chos sems las byung ba nyid bye brag med pa rnams mtshan nyid sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gi dngos po 'jug pa la 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, although mental factors are not different from the mind in terms of being mental phenomena, they are not the same as the mind because they have different characteristics.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa la 'gal ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa la 'gal ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, there is no contradiction in the way that the foundation consciousness and the active forms of consciousness operate together.

original: 'di lta ste dper na chu'i @6b rgyun dang chu rlabs rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med pa dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor gsal ba dang / gzugs brnyan rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med par blta bar bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na chu'i @6b rgyun dang chu rlabs rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med pa dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor gsal ba dang / gzugs brnyan rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par 'gal ba med par blta bar bya'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, it should be seen that it is not contradictory that the consciousnesses that engage the ƒÅlaya consciousness are engaged by the same thing.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po gcig la res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa rigs gcig pa sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po gcig la res 'ga' ni gzugs kyi rnam pa rigs gcig pa sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed /
translated: For example, with regard to a single thing, sometimes the eye consciousness apprehends a single type of form that is not a variety.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Sometimes it apprehends many different types simultaneously.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the eye consciousness apprehends form,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra dag dang / sna'i rnam par shes pas dri dag dang / lce'i rnam par shes pas ro dag la yang de bzhin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pas sgra dag dang / sna'i rnam par shes pas dri dag dang / lce'i rnam par shes pas ro dag la yang de bzhin pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: The ear consciousness apprehends sounds, the nose consciousness apprehends smells, the tongue consciousness apprehends tastes, and the body consciousness apprehends tactile objects.

original: dper na lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i reg bya'i dngos po gcig la res 'ga' ni reg bya rigs gcig pa sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: dper na lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i reg bya'i dngos po gcig la res 'ga' ni reg bya rigs gcig pa sna tshogs ma yin pa 'dzin par byed la /
translated: For example, the body consciousness sometimes apprehends a single type of tactile object, and sometimes it apprehends many different types of tactile objects simultaneously.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pas kyang gcig dang sna tshogs du ma 'dzin pa la 'gal ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma cig car 'dzin par byed pa de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pas kyang gcig dang sna tshogs du ma 'dzin pa la 'gal ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the conceptual mental consciousness sometimes apprehends a single object and sometimes many different objects simultaneously. There is no contradiction in this.

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug ste /
translated: The mental consciousness that was explained earlier always occurs simultaneously with and arises together with the store consciousness.

original: de ni yang dag par ma bcom gyi bar du dus rtag pa kho nar lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'dra ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de ni yang dag par ma bcom gyi bar du dus rtag pa kho nar lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'dra ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: Until it is completely destroyed, it is always concomitant with the four afflictions that are similar in type to the innate nature: the affliction of the afflicted view of the self, the affliction of pride thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: bdag la chags pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / ma rig pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: the affliction of attachment to the self, and the affliction of ignorance.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang mnyam par zhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la dge ba la sogs pa dag la 'gal ba med par 'jug pa dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang mnyam par zhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa la dge ba la sogs pa dag la 'gal ba med par 'jug pa dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These four afflictions should be regarded as being obscured neutral states that operate without contradiction in both meditative equipoise and the post equipoise state, in relation to virtuous and other states.

original: de ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan @7a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan @7a * //
translated: Thus, the afflicted mind is concomitant with the five omnipresent mental factors.

original: cig gi dngos po dang / tshor ba dang lhan cig gi dngos po dang / dge ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig gi dngos pos kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cig gi dngos po dang / tshor ba dang lhan cig gi dngos po dang / dge ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig gi dngos pos kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the store consciousness is engaged by the simultaneous presence of the seeds, the simultaneous presence of the object, and the simultaneous presence of feeling, etc., and the simultaneous presence of virtue, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ldog pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: What is the determination of the cessation of the defilements?

original: mdor na kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: mdor na kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin no //
translated: In brief, the store consciousness is the root of all the defilements.

original: 'di ltar de ni sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is the root of the establishment of the world of sentient beings,

original: dbang po rten dang bcas pa rnams dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rten dang bcas pa rnams dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of the sense faculties together with their supports and of the active forms of consciousness.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also the root of the establishment of the world of the receptacle,

original: snod kyi 'jig rten skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of the world of the receptacle.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad ni gcig gi dbang gcig yin pa'i phyir sems can phan tshun 'jug pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad ni gcig gi dbang gcig yin pa'i phyir sems can phan tshun 'jug pa'i rtsa ba yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, since all sentient beings are the power of one, they are also the root of the engagement of sentient beings with each other.

original: 'di ltar de las gzhan pa'i sems can gyi mthong ba la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i sems can de dag ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las gzhan pa'i sems can gyi mthong ba la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i sems can de dag ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no sentient being whatsoever who does not experience the happiness and suffering of another sentient being through seeing and so on.

original: rnam grangs des na sems can gyi khams gang yin pa de ni gcig gi dbang gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na sems can gyi khams gang yin pa de ni gcig gi dbang gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this enumeration, the realm of sentient beings is the power of one.

original: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid ni sa bon thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dus na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid ni sa bon thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dus na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: Thus, because the foundation consciousness itself is the seed of all, it is the nature of the truth of suffering in the present and it generates the truth of suffering in the future.

original: da ltar gyi dus nyid ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa skyed par byed pa'ang yin no //üîΩde ltar na sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'grub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus nyid ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa skyed par byed pa'ang yin no // de ltar na sems can gyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin yin pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'grub par byed pa dang /
translated: The present time is also the producer of the truth of origination.üîΩThus, the foundation consciousness should be regarded as the root of all afflicted phenomena because it is the producer of the world of sentient beings, the producer of the world of the physical cosmos, the nature of the truth of suffering, and the producer of the future truth of suffering.

original: de ltar gyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'grub par byed pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'grub par byed pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: And it is the producer of the truth of origination in the present.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i @7b dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba bden pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i @7b dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba bden pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The foundation consciousness that holds the seeds of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation and conducive to penetrative insight is not the cause of the truth of origination.

original: thar pa la sogs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa la sogs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation and so on are incompatible with entry into the womb.

original: de byung na de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni ches 'od gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de byung na de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni ches 'od gsal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When that is present, the other roots of virtue that are mundane become very clear.

original: des na de dag rang gi sa bon yongs su bzung ba la ches mthu dang ldan pa dang sa bon yongs su brtas pas bsgrub pa la ches stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag rang gi sa bon yongs su bzung ba la ches mthu dang ldan pa dang sa bon yongs su brtas pas bsgrub pa la ches stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they become very powerful in maintaining their own seeds and very powerful in establishing seeds.

original: sa bon de las dge ba'i chos de dag kyang ches 'od gsal par 'grub pa dang / phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa ches sdug pa dang / ches 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon de las dge ba'i chos de dag kyang ches 'od gsal par 'grub pa dang / phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa ches sdug pa dang / ches 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those virtuous qualities are also established with even greater clarity from those seeds, and in the future, they are established with even greater beauty and even greater desirability.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa 'di la dgongs nas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa 'di la dgongs nas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also, intending the all-seeds store consciousness, taught the eye constituent, the form constituent, the eye consciousness constituent, up to the mind constituent, the entity constituent,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du gsungs te /
translated: and the mind consciousness constituent.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la khams sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la khams sna tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the store consciousness has various constituents.

original: mdo nyid las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la khams du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo nyid las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la khams du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the s≈´tra itself, because the store consciousness has many constituents.

original: ji ltar dbang po'i tshogs kyi dpe mdzad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po'i tshogs kyi dpe mdzad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as in the example of the collection of sense faculties.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni 'di ltar dge ba'i chos bsgoms pas rnam par ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni 'di ltar dge ba'i chos bsgoms pas rnam par ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the root of affliction, the store consciousness, should be understood to be eliminated in this way by cultivating virtuous dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa de yang so so'i skye bo sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas brtson par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa de yang so so'i skye bo sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pas brtson par byed pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the cultivation of virtuous dharmas is the effort of the mental attention that focuses on the engaging consciousness in order to stabilize the mind of an ordinary person.

original: de'i dang por bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bsgom ste /
analyzed: de'i dang por bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir bsgom ste /
translated: That is cultivated in order to enter into the realization of the truths,

original: bden pa ma mthong ba bden pa rnams la mig ma thob pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba bden pa rnams la mig ma thob pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa yang rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who has not seen the truths and has not obtained the eye of the truths is not able to realize the foundation consciousness that contains all seeds.

original: de de ltar zhugs shing nyan thos kyi yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs sam /
analyzed: de de ltar zhugs shing nyan thos kyi yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs sam /
translated: Having entered that, one enters the faultless reality of the ≈õrƒÅvakas

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs te chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byed pa na /üîΩkun gzhi @8a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs te chos thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings rtogs par byed pa na / kun gzhi @8a * //
translated: or the faultless reality of the bodhisattva, and when one realizes the dharmadhƒÅtu of all dharmas,

original: rnam par shes pa yang rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang rtogs par byed de /
translated: one also realizes the foundation consciousness.

original: der kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la yang dag par 'dus par blta zhing /
analyzed: der kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la yang dag par 'dus par blta zhing /
translated: There, one should see the complete inclusion of all the afflictions.

original: de nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / nang gi gnas ngan len gyi 'ching bas bdag nyid bcings pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de nang gi so so'i bdag nyid la phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / nang gi gnas ngan len gyi 'ching bas bdag nyid bcings pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: Then, one should realize that one is bound by the bonds of external signs and the bonds of internal negative tendencies.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rnam par spros par bsdus pa de dag thams cad kyi khams pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi rnam par spros par bsdus pa de dag thams cad kyi khams pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is the element of all those elaborations of the formations.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gcig tu sdud pa dang / gcig tu spungs pa dang / gcig tu sogs par byed de ;
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gcig tu sdud pa dang / gcig tu spungs pa dang / gcig tu sogs par byed de ;
translated: Therefore, it is the one that gathers, the one that accumulates, and the one that collects the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: gcig tu bsags nas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pas kun tu brten cing goms par byas pa'i rgyus gnas 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: gcig tu bsags nas de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes pas kun tu brten cing goms par byas pa'i rgyus gnas 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: Having gathered it into one, by the cause of constantly cultivating the consciousness that focuses on suchness, one causes the transformation of the basis.

original: gnas 'gyur ma thag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa spangs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas 'gyur ma thag tu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa spangs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Immediately after the transformation of the basis, one should say that the ƒÅlaya consciousness is abandoned.

original: de spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be said that all defilements are abandoned because that is abandoned.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i gnas ni /
translated: The basis of that store consciousness

original: gnyen po dang / dgra bos bsgyur bar rig par bya'o //üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyen po dang / dgra bos bsgyur bar rig par bya'o // kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / len pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: should be understood as transformed by the antidote and by the enemy.üîΩThe store consciousness is impermanent and subject to reversal,

original: gnas gyur pa ni rtag pa dang len pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni rtag pa dang len pa med pa yin te /
translated: but the transformation of the support is permanent and not subject to reversal.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i lam gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i lam gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is transformed by the path that has reality for its object.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa yin la gnas gyur pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad dang gtan bral ba yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ngan len dang ldan pa yin la gnas gyur pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad dang gtan bral ba yin no //
translated: The store consciousness is associated with the propensities, but the transformation of the support is completely free of all propensities.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang lam gyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: The store consciousness is the cause of the arising of the passions and is not the cause of the arising of the path.

original: gnas gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / lam du 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / lam du 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The transformation of the consciousnesses is not the cause of the engagement of the afflictions, but it is the cause of the engagement of the path.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang / skyed pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa dang / skyed pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of abiding and not the cause of generation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang mi byed la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams la dbang mi byed la /
translated: The foundation consciousness does not control virtuous and neutral phenomena.

original: gnas gyur pa ni dge ba dang lung dus bstan pa'i chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni dge ba dang lung dus bstan pa'i chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: The transformation controls all virtuous and neutral phenomena.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni de spangs ma thag tu len pa rnam pa gnyis spong ba dang / sprul pa lta bu'i lus kun tu gnas pa @8b ste ;
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i spangs pa'i mtshan nyid ni de spangs ma thag tu len pa rnam pa gnyis spong ba dang / sprul pa lta bu'i lus kun tu gnas pa @8b ste ;
translated: The characteristics of the abandonment of that foundation consciousness are that immediately after it is abandoned, the two kinds of appropriating consciousnesses are abandoned and the body is like a magical creation.

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal yang 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the cause of the arising of suffering in the future is abandoned.

original: phyi ma la yang 'byung bar byed pa'i len pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing srog gi rkyen du gyur pa tsam kun tu gnas so //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang 'byung bar byed pa'i len pa spong ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshe 'di'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad spong ba dang / gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral zhing srog gi rkyen du gyur pa tsam kun tu gnas so //
translated: The second is the elimination of the appropriation that produces the next life. The third is the elimination of all the negative reflex actions of the defilements in this life, because all the causes of the defilements have been eliminated. The fourth is the mere remaining of the life faculty, which is devoid of all negative reflex actions.

original: de yod na lus kyi mtha' pa dang / srog gi mthar pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed de /
analyzed: de yod na lus kyi mtha' pa dang / srog gi mthar pa'i tshor ba myong bar byed de /
translated: When that exists, one experiences the sensation of the end of the body and the end of life.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang 'di na de'i tshor ba thams cad de tsam gyis na yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang 'di na de'i tshor ba thams cad de tsam gyis na yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes rgya cher ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, a s≈´tra also says, ‚ÄúHere, all his sensations will be exhausted.‚Äù

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rtog pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gyur pa rnam par gzhag pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jug pa dang / rtog pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yid la byed pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas gyur pa rnam par gzhag pas kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the afflictions of the store consciousness should be understood as eliminated by the establishment of the root of the lifecycle, by the establishment of its entry, by the establishment of its conception, by the establishment of its meditation, by the establishment of its attention, and by the establishment of its transformation.

original: de ltar na 'di ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul yang dag pa yin te /
translated: This is the correct method of establishing mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji skad bstan pa'i tshul 'dis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khams gsum pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa thams cad ji skad bstan pa'i tshul 'dis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba'i tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All the afflictions and all the purities of all the minds, thoughts, and forms of consciousness in the three realms should be understood by this method as it has been taught.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i tshul gzhan yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa'i tshul gzhan yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i rim pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The other modes of mind, thought, and consciousness are taught for the sake of the stages of disciples,

original: 'di lta ste gdul ba byis pa'i shes rab can gyi dbang du byas nas thabs sla bas 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gdul ba byis pa'i shes rab can gyi dbang du byas nas thabs sla bas 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro // gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan la /
translated: because they are easy methods for engaging the minds of disciples with inferior wisdom.üîΩDo those who possess foundation consciousness also possess the active forms of consciousness?

original: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang yang ldan pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or do those who possess the active forms of consciousness also possess foundation consciousness?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni gnyid log pa sems med pa dang / brgyal bar gyur pa sems med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs @9a * //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni gnyid log pa sems med pa dang / brgyal bar gyur pa sems med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs @9a * //
translated: The consciousness that is not associated with foundation consciousness is the mindless state of sleep, the mindless state of fainting, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: pa dang ; 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'o //üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: pa dang ; 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'o // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan la /
translated: Those who possess foundation consciousness but not the active forms of consciousness are those who are asleep and without mind, those who are unconscious, those who have entered the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation, and those born among the beings devoid of discernment.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs na dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Those who possess the active forms of consciousness but not foundation consciousness are arhats, pratyekabuddhas, irreversible bodhisattvas, and tathagatas when they are in a state of mind.

original: gnyi ga dang ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs de las gzhan pa dag na'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang ldan pa ni sems yod pa'i gnas skabs de las gzhan pa dag na'o //
translated: Those who possess both are in states other than those.

original: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings na'o //
translated: Those not endowed with either are the arhat, pratyekabuddha, irreversible bodhisattva, tathagata, and the element of nirvana without remainder.

original: gang gi phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi chos thams cad ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi chos thams cad ngo bo nyid so sor nges pa ni /
translated: Since all internal and external phenomena are individually ascertained in their own natures,

original: so so rang rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: so so rang rang gi mtshan nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin na /
translated: they are established in their own individual characteristics.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad po dag las rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ni ngo bo nyid las rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad po dag las rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po dag ni ngo bo nyid las rnam par gzhag la /
translated: If that is so, why are the six consciousness elements established by nature,

original: de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs las rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs las rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: while the other elements are established by location, focal object, and concomitant factors?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po gang yin pa 'di dag ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo de dang de dag 'das pa dang / skad cig de dang de dag 'das pa dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam de dang de dag 'das nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug po gang yin pa 'di dag ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo de dang de dag 'das pa dang / skad cig de dang de dag 'das pa dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam de dang de dag 'das nas /
translated: The six elements of consciousness, having passed away day and night, in those moments, in those seconds, in those minutes,

original: rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag la brten te /
analyzed: rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag la brten te /
translated: in dependence on those causes and conditions,

original: mig la sogs pa gnas rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba grogs rnams kyis rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs dag 'byung zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gnas rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa rnams dang / sems las byung ba grogs rnams kyis rnam pa du ma rnam pa mang po sna tshogs dag 'byung zhing /
translated: arise in many different ways, in many different forms, in many different varieties, through the bases such as the eyes, through the objects such as forms, and through the mental factors such as the mind.

original: gnas gang dang gang nas 'byung ba de dang de'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: gnas gang dang gang nas 'byung ba de dang de'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: And they are named after whatever basis they arise from.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na me ni rgyu gang dang gang kho na la brten te 'bar ba de dang de'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na me ni rgyu gang dang gang kho na la brten te 'bar ba de dang de'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: fire is counted as whatever it burns in dependence on.

original: rtsva dag dang shing dag dang / lcib dag dang / phub ma dag dang / sbur ma dag la brten te 'bar ba'i me ni rtsva'i me zhes bya ba nas /üîΩrgyas par sbur ma'i me zhes bya ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs rnams la brten te /
analyzed: rtsva dag dang shing dag dang / lcib dag dang / phub ma dag dang / sbur ma dag la brten te 'bar ba'i me ni rtsva'i me zhes bya ba nas / rgyas par sbur ma'i me zhes bya ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du mig dang gzugs rnams la brten te /
translated: Fire that depends on grass, wood, chaff, husks, and chaff dust is called the fire of grass,üîΩand so on up to the fire of chaff dust.üîΩIn the same way, consciousness that arises in dependence on the eye and forms

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni mig gi rnam par @9b shes pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ni mig gi rnam par @9b shes pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ste /
translated: is called eye consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rgyas par yid dang chos kyi bar la brten pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas par yid dang chos kyi bar la brten pa ni /
translated: In the same way, consciousness that arises in dependence on the mental faculty and mental objects

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: is called mental consciousness.

original: de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams ni dang po ngo bo nyid gang kho nas byung bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho na dang 'dra bar 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas gtan du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams ni dang po ngo bo nyid gang kho nas byung bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid de kho na dang 'dra bar 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas gtan du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other elements, such as the eye, arise from their own seeds and continue in a series that is similar to them.

original: rnam par shes pa rigs gcig pa ni rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag la brten te /üîΩrnam pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rigs gcig pa ni rgyu de dag dang rkyen de dag la brten te / rnam pa tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'byung bas de'i phyir /
translated: The consciousness element is established as a single type, because it arises as a different aspect in dependence on those causes and conditions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ni ngo bo nyid kho na las rnam par bzhag la de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs las rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams ni ngo bo nyid kho na las rnam par bzhag la de las gzhan pa'i khams rnams ni gnas dang dmigs pa dang grogs las rnam par gzhag go /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness elements are established as a single type by their intrinsic natures, while the other elements are established by their locations, focal objects, and companions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs yongs su shes par bya ba las brtsams te /
translated: The S≈´tra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma states:

original: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pas rnam pa dus sems yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pas rnam pa dus sems yongs su shes par bya zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, when a monk who is engaged in purifying his mind understands the mind in all its aspects, he will abandon the afflictions of desire, anger, and ignorance that arise from the mind.‚Äù

original: mdor bsdu na rnam par gsum gyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam par gsum gyis te /
translated: In brief, the mind is understood in three ways:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun tu dga' ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun tu dga' ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi nyes dmigs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par bzlog pa'i thabs kyis so //
translated: through delight in the afflictions, through the faults of the afflictions, and through the means of countering the afflictions.

original: ji ltar na dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa /
translated: How is it that a monk who has entered into the purification of mindüîΩ

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las sems yongs su shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las sems yongs su shes par byed ce na /
translated: How does a monk who has entered into the purification of his mind understand the mind that delights in the afflictions?

original: 'di na dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Here a monk who has entered into the purification of his mind thinks as follows:

original: bdag gi sems 'di ni yun ring po nas kun nas nyon mongs pa la mngon par dga' ba ste /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' bas yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid las rnam par bslang ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems 'di ni yun ring po nas kun nas nyon mongs pa la mngon par dga' ba ste / kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' bas yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid las rnam par bslang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFor a long time my mind has delighted in the afflictions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la nges par sbyor bar byed pa na /üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la des par mi gnas shing mi dga' bar myur ba myur ba kho nar kun tu gyur cing /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la nges par sbyor bar byed pa na / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la des par mi gnas shing mi dga' bar myur ba myur ba kho nar kun tu gyur cing /
translated: Because of delighting in the afflictions, it is lifted up from being associated with desire and is definitely joined to being free from desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa kho na la 'jug par byed /üîΩrnam par 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa kho na la 'jug par byed / rnam par 'gro bar byed /
translated: But when it is not firmly established in being free from desire and does not delight in that, it quickly turns around and enters into being associated with desire.

original: rjes su rgyug par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su rgyug par byed do //
translated: It moves toward that and runs after it.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid kyi ji lta ba @10a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid kyi ji lta ba @10a * //
translated: Just as it is for those who are desirous,

original: bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa nyid dang / gti mug dang bcas pa nyid dang / zhum pa nyid dang / rgod pa nyid dang / nye bar ma zhi ba nyid dang / rnam par g-yengs pa nyid kyi bar yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa nyid dang / gti mug dang bcas pa nyid dang / zhum pa nyid dang / rgod pa nyid dang / nye bar ma zhi ba nyid dang / rnam par g-yengs pa nyid kyi bar yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so it is for those who are hateful, ignorant, timid, wild, and those who are not at peace, up to those who are distracted.

original: bag med par gnas pa las rnam par bslang nas /
analyzed: bag med par gnas pa las rnam par bslang nas /
translated: When they are roused from their heedless state,

original: rgyas par dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa'i bar la nges par sbyor bar byed pa na /
analyzed: rgyas par dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa'i bar la nges par sbyor bar byed pa na /
translated: and are definitely made to cultivate virtuous qualities,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la nges par mi gnas shing /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la nges par mi gnas shing /
translated: they do not remain in the constant cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: mi dga' bar myur ba myur ba kho nar kun tu gyur cing /üîΩbag med pa la kun tu dga' ba'i bar kho na la 'jug par byed /üîΩrnam par 'gro bar byed /
analyzed: mi dga' bar myur ba myur ba kho nar kun tu gyur cing / bag med pa la kun tu dga' ba'i bar kho na la 'jug par byed / rnam par 'gro bar byed /
translated: They quickly become unhappy

original: rjes su rgyug par byed do snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rjes su rgyug par byed do snyam du sems te /
translated: and engage in, proceed with, and pursueüîΩnothing but the delight of heedlessness.

original: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las sems yongs su shes par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las sems yongs su shes par byed do //
translated: The monk who is engaged in purifying the mind understands the mind in this way, as delighting in the afflictions.

original: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pas de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las rang gi sems yongs su shes par byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pas de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba las rang gi sems yongs su shes par byas nas /
translated: The monk who is engaged in purifying the mind, having understood his own mind in this way, as delighting in the afflictions,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de nyid nyes dmigs las 'di ltar yongs su shes par byed do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems de nyid nyes dmigs las 'di ltar yongs su shes par byed do //
translated: understands the disadvantages of that very afflicted mind in this way:

original: bdag gi 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan dag la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dang tshe 'di tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan dag la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dang tshe 'di tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúMy mind that is accompanied by passion engages in what is harmful to myself, what is harmful to others, and what is harmful to both; it produces what is blameworthy in this life and in the next life.

original: de dang de 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye ba'i rkyen yang yin te /
analyzed: de dang de 'byung ba'i sems las byung ba sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba skye ba'i rkyen yang yin te /
translated: It is also the condition for the arising of the mental factors of suffering and mental dissatisfaction that arise from that and that.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du bag med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bar yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes yongs su shes par byed cing /
