analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin du bag med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bar yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes yongs su shes par byed cing /
translated: Just as it is with attachment, so it is with delighting in carelessness.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / bag med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bar gyi sems 'di ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems dang / bag med pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bar gyi sems 'di ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThis mind that is attached and this mind that delights in carelessness are associated with problems.

original: yams kyi nad dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang bcas pa dang / 'khrug pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam @10b du sems so //
analyzed: yams kyi nad dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / 'go ba'i nad dang bcas pa dang / 'khrug pa dang bcas pa yin no snyam @10b du sems so //
translated: They are associated with epidemics, associated with harm, associated with contagious diseases, and associated with conflict.‚Äù

original: des de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can de nyes dmigs las yongs su shes par byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa las 'di ltar yongs su shes par byed de /
analyzed: des de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can de nyes dmigs las yongs su shes par byas nas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa las 'di ltar yongs su shes par byed de /
translated: Having understood the faults of his own defiled mind in this way, he becomes skilled in reversing defilement.

original: bdag ni de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yams kyi nad dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yams kyi nad dang bcas pa /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI will not come under the influence of this defiled mind of mine, which is full of faults, like a contagious disease,

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: harmful,

original: 'go ba'i nad dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad dang bcas pa /
translated: like a chronic disease,

original: 'khrug pa dang bcas pa 'di lta bu 'di'i dbang du 'gyur bar mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'khrug pa dang bcas pa 'di lta bu 'di'i dbang du 'gyur bar mi bya'i /
translated: and like a disturbance.üîΩI will instead control my own mind.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems nyid la dbang bsgyur bar bya'o zhes rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur bar bya ba dang / sems kyi dbang gis 'gyur bar mi bya bar rig nas /
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid la dbang bsgyur bar bya'o zhes rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur bar bya ba dang / sems kyi dbang gis 'gyur bar mi bya bar rig nas /
translated: Having understood that he should control his own mind and not be controlled by it,

original: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags te /
analyzed: so sor brtags shing so sor brtags te /
translated: he should examine and examine his mind.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems de 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid las rnam par bzlog nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems de 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid las rnam par bzlog nas /
translated: He should reverse his defiled mind from its defiled state.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la 'jog par byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid la 'jog par byed /
translated: He establishes them in freedom from attachment,

original: dga' bar byed cing /
analyzed: dga' bar byed cing /
translated: he delights them,

original: de la de'i phan yon nye bar ston par yang byed do //
analyzed: de la de'i phan yon nye bar ston par yang byed do //
translated: and he shows them the benefits of that.

original: de bzhin du bag med par gnas pa'i bar las rnam par bzlog nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bag med par gnas pa'i bar las rnam par bzlog nas /
translated: In the same way, he turns them away from dwelling in carelessness,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la 'jog par byed /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la 'jog par byed /
translated: he establishes them in always cultivating wholesome states,

original: dga' bar byed cing de la de'i phan yon nye bar ston par yang byed do //üîΩde ltar zhugs shing de la mang du gnas pa de la de'i sems sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba yongs su smad pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: dga' bar byed cing de la de'i phan yon nye bar ston par yang byed do // de ltar zhugs shing de la mang du gnas pa de la de'i sems sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun tu dga' ba yongs su smad pa gang yin pa de /
translated: he delights them, and he shows them the benefits of that.

original: so sor brtag mi dgos par dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la rang nyid mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod de /
analyzed: so sor brtag mi dgos par dge ba'i chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa la rang nyid mngon par dga' bar 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod de /
translated: In that way, when they have entered that and frequently abide in that, then without needing to reflect, they themselves delight in always cultivating wholesome states,

original: de'i skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skabs kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that time and that opportunity come for them.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun du dga' ba nyid la brten te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong sems rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa de ltar rang gi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa la kun du dga' ba nyid la brten te /
translated: Because the monk who is engaged in purifying the mind, in this way, on the basis of delighting in the afflictions of his own mind,

original: dpe med par 'gyur ba nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa ni /üîΩde ltar nyes dmigs las kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la yang mkhas par gyur la /
analyzed: dpe med par 'gyur ba nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa ni / de ltar nyes dmigs las kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la yang mkhas par gyur la /
translated: he will understand, just as it is, the state of being without example.üîΩIn this way, he becomes skilled in the afflictions that arise from faults.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems rnam par ldog pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na dge slong sems @11a * //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems rnam par ldog pa la yang mkhas par 'gyur ro // de ltar na dge slong sems @11a * //
translated: In this way, he becomes skilled in the cessation of the afflictions of the mind.

original: rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par bya ba la zhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, the monk who is engaged in purifying the mindüîΩquickly attains the unsurpassed purification of the mind,

original: zag pa rnams zad pas myur ba kho nar sems rnam par dag pa bla na med pa rjes su 'thob bo //
analyzed: zag pa rnams zad pas myur ba kho nar sems rnam par dag pa bla na med pa rjes su 'thob bo //
translated: through the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: sems la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs dang / sems rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: sems la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs dang / sems rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There are other enumerations of skill in the mind and skill in the cessation of the mind.

original: sems la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid las brtsams te rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid las brtsams te rig par bya'o //
translated: The categories of skill in mind should be understood in terms of the imagined nature.

original: sems rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las brtsams te rig par bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: sems rnam par ldog pa la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid las brtsams te rig par bya'o / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: The categories of skill in turning the mind away from the mind should be understood in terms of the relative nature.

original: dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa'i phan yon ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa'i phan yon ni gnyis te /
translated: The benefits of thoroughly purifying the mind are two:

original: 'bras bu'i dus na bde ba la reg pa nyid dang / rgyu'i dus na dbang bsgyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na bde ba la reg pa nyid dang / rgyu'i dus na dbang bsgyur ba nyid do //
translated: at the time of the result, one experiences bliss, and at the time of the cause, one has mastery.

original: sems rnyog pa can du 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sems rnyog pa can du 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The faults of a muddled mind are three:

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i nyes pa dang / bag la nyal gyi nyes pa dang / kun nas dkris pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i nyes pa dang / bag la nyal gyi nyes pa dang / kun nas dkris pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: the fault of improper attention, the fault of latent propensities, and the fault of entanglements.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kho na la legs par rab tu tshul bzhin du so sor brtag par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kho na la legs par rab tu tshul bzhin du so sor brtag par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag las lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In the foundations of mindfulness, he said, ‚ÄúYou should abide observing the body in the body, and so on, up toüîΩyou should abide observing phenomena in phenomena.‚Äù

original: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention behind those statements?

original: smras pa / der ni sems yongs su brtag pa kho na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / der ni sems yongs su brtag pa kho na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhis yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúIn those statements, the thorough investigation of mind alone is taught through the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: sems kyi len pa yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi myong ba yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rig pa yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi len pa yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi myong ba yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi rnam par rig pa yongs su brtag pa dang / sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The thorough investigation of the appropriation of mind, the thorough investigation of the experience of mind, the thorough investigation of the cognition of mind, and the thorough investigation of the afflicted mind and the purified mind.

original: de ltar na len pa dang myong ba dang / dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam pa byang ba dang bzhis sems kho na yongs su brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na len pa dang myong ba dang / dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam pa byang ba dang bzhis sems kho na yongs su brtag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, mind alone is fully investigated by four categories: appropriator, experiencer, cognizer of objects, and afflicted and purified.üîΩThe benefits of the mind being well cultivated by virtue are two.

original: dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa'i phan yon ni gnyis te zhes bya bas ni mdo las ngas ni 'di lta ste sems ni @11b ma bsgoms na mi mnyen zhing las su mi rung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge bas sems yongs su bsgos pa'i phan yon ni gnyis te zhes bya bas ni mdo las ngas ni 'di lta ste sems ni @11b ma bsgoms na mi mnyen zhing las su mi rung bar 'gyur la /
translated: This explains the meaning of a sutra that states:

original: bsgoms na mnyen zhing las su rung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gcig kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa de'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms na mnyen zhing las su rung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos gcig kyang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa de'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: I do not see any phenomenon that is not cultivated, that is not pliable and not serviceable,üîΩbut when cultivated, it becomes pliable and serviceable.üîΩThe faults of a disturbed mind are three.

original: sems rnyog pa can du 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo las lhung bzed dang / me long dang / chu'i rdzing gi dpe gsungs pa dag dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems rnyog pa can du 'gyur ba'i nyes pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo las lhung bzed dang / me long dang / chu'i rdzing gi dpe gsungs pa dag dang ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: This explains the meaning of a sutra that states:

original: dge slong gnas pa gsum po /
analyzed: dge slong gnas pa gsum po /
translated: The three abodes of a monk are

original: rnam par thar pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'dren par byed pa'i chos la gnas pa ni sgrub pa rnam pa drug gis ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa yin te /üîΩrgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa dang / legs par bzung zhing bsams pa la bsgrub pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa bsgrub pa dang ; de la ro myong bar mi byed cing bden pa rab tu 'byed pa bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'dren par byed pa'i chos la gnas pa ni sgrub pa rnam pa drug gis ston pa'i bstan pa bzhin byed pa yin te / rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa dang / legs par bzung zhing bsams pa la bsgrub pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa bsgrub pa dang ; de la ro myong bar mi byed cing bden pa rab tu 'byed pa bsgrub pa dang /
translated: One who is established in liberation, established in the door of liberation, and established in the teaching that leads to the door of liberation, practices in accordance with the teaching of the Master through six kinds of practice.

original: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par bsgrub pa dang / dad pas byin pa legs par yongs su longs spyod pa'i bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: de la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par bsgrub pa dang / dad pas byin pa legs par yongs su longs spyod pa'i bsgrub pas so //
translated: The six kinds of practice are: practice of uninterrupted application, practice of the roots of wholesomeness that arise from meditation, practice of the discernment of the truths without experiencing the taste of those roots of wholesomeness, practice without conceit in those roots of wholesomeness, practice of the application of the four right efforts, and practice of the application of the four supports for spiritual power.

original: sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Generosity is twofold:

original: len pa po'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: len pa po'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: the generosity of the recipient and the generosity of the giver.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni gnyis te /
translated: The result of generosity is twofold:

original: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa longs spyod la mos pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po nyid dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa longs spyod la mos pa'o //
translated: Great enjoyment and the enjoyment of its natural outcome.üîΩThe monk who is established in the three abodes is the one who is established in liberation, as stated in a sutra:

original: dge slong gnas pa gsum la gnas pa zhes bya ba la 'dir rnam par thar pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gnas pa gsum la gnas pa zhes bya ba la 'dir rnam par thar pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is established in the attainment of the realm of nirvana.‚Äù

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
translated: The one who is established in the door of liberation is the one who is established in the door of liberation, as stated in a sutra:

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dbyings la'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i dbyings la'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the realm of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.‚Äù

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'dren par byed pa'i chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las ;
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo 'dren par byed pa'i chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las ;
translated: The one who is established in the factors that induce the door of liberation is the one who is established in the factors that induce the door of liberation, as stated in a sutra:

original: skyo ba dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe cultivates the mental attention that is accompanied by disgust.‚Äù

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnam pa drug gi mdo las btang ba med pa'i bsam gtan pa /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgrub pa rnam pa drug gi mdo las btang ba med pa'i bsam gtan pa /
translated: The one who is established in the uninterrupted accomplishment is the one who is established in the uninterrupted accomplishment, as stated in a sutra:

original: lhag mthong dang ldan pa /
analyzed: lhag mthong dang ldan pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is absorbed in meditation without distraction, who is endowed with insight,

original: khyim gyi stong pa rgyas par byed pa /
analyzed: khyim gyi stong pa rgyas par byed pa /
translated: 1. He fills the house with emptiness.

original: @12a * // bdag gi don gyi rnal 'byor la brtson pa /
analyzed: @12a * // bdag gi don gyi rnal 'byor la brtson pa /
translated: 2. He is diligent in the yoga of his own aim.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis ma smad pa /
translated: 3. He is not despised by his companions in the celibate life who are skilled.üîΩ4. He enjoys the alms of the country as if they were the fruit of cultivation.

original: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyom sa 'bras bu yod par longs spyod pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de dag gi don yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyom sa 'bras bu yod par longs spyod pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de dag gi don yongs su bstan to //
translated: The meaning of these four phrases is taught in the sutra.

original: sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Giving is of two kinds:

original: len pa po'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don /
analyzed: len pa po'i sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa po'i sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi don /
translated: the giving of the recipient and the giving of the giver.

original: mdo las gal te sems can 'di dag gis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin pa kun 'ged pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu shes par gyur na ni /
analyzed: mdo las gal te sems can 'di dag gis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu dang / sbyin pa kun 'ged pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu shes par gyur na ni /
translated: The meaning of these phrases is taught in the sutra: If these sentient beings knew the result of giving and the result of the evolution of giving,

original: da ltar khams phyi ma khams tha ma gang yin pa de las kyang ma byin zhing ma bgos par za bar mi byed do zhes sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa kun 'ged pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu yod pa tha dad par gsungs par ston to //
analyzed: da ltar khams phyi ma khams tha ma gang yin pa de las kyang ma byin zhing ma bgos par za bar mi byed do zhes sbyin pa dang / sbyin pa kun 'ged pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu yod pa tha dad par gsungs par ston to //
translated: Thus he teaches that the results of giving and sharing are different.

original: 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'thad pas bsgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
translated: The reasonings that prove this

original: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis med cing yod pa ma yin pa kho na las 'byung ngo zhes khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang yin /
analyzed: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis med cing yod pa ma yin pa kho na las 'byung ngo zhes khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa gang yin /
translated: What is the reasoning that proves that future formations arise from what is nonexistent and non-apprehensible?

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur na de 'pho zhing 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na las 'byung bar 'gyur na de 'pho zhing 'byung ste /
translated: If future phenomena were to arise only from what exists, then they would arise through transformation.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi yul nas da ltar gyi dus kyi yul du 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi yul nas da ltar gyi dus kyi yul du 'pho zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Would they arise through transformation from the object of the future to the object of the present?

original: 'chi 'pho dang 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang 'byung ste /
translated: They would arise through death and rebirth.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas shi 'phos nas da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas shi 'phos nas da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: having died and transmigrated from the future to the present?üîΩOr does it arise in dependence, but not in the future, but in the present,üîΩhaving remained as it was in the future, and having arisen in the present,

original: brten nas 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa na de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar gnas la de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: brten nas 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa na de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur bar gnas la de la brten te gzhan kho na zhig da ltar gyi dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: but having become something else in dependence on that?üîΩOr does it arise with karma,

original: las dang bcas par 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par gyur pa las /
analyzed: las dang bcas par 'byung ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus na las mi byed par gyur pa las /
translated: having become something that does not perform karma in the future,

original: da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su las byed pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: but having become something that performs karma in the present?

original: mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ste ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid rdzogs par 'byung ste ;
translated: Or does it arise with complete characteristics,üîΩhaving become something that does not have complete characteristics in the future,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na mtshan nyid ma rdzogs par gyur pa las da ltar gyi dus su mtshan nyid rdzogs pa zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: but having become something that has complete characteristics in the present?

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar 'byung ste /
translated: Or does it arise with different characteristics,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi @12b mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang / 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi @12b mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar gyur la /
translated: having become something with different characteristics from the entity in the future and the entity of the effect in the future?

original: da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su da ltar gyi dngos po dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the present entity and the future entity were to arise in the present, they would have the same characteristics.

original: yod pa de'i 'byung ba ni rnam pa drug po de dag thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa de'i 'byung ba ni rnam pa drug po de dag thams cad kyis mi rung ngo //
translated: The arising of an existent entity is not tenable in any of these six ways.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause for that which does not exist in a place and does not exist in a direction, there is no transference from one place to another place, and because for that which is not born and does not occur, there is no death and transference.

original: yul na mi gnas pa dang / phyogs na mi gnas pa la ni yul nas yul gzhan du 'pho ba med pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba la ni 'chi 'pho yang med pa'i phyir dang / de la brten te 'byung na de gzhan kho na zhig byung bar zad kyi ma 'ongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa dang / phyogs na mi gnas pa la ni yul nas yul gzhan du 'pho ba med pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba la ni 'chi 'pho yang med pa'i phyir dang / de la brten te 'byung na de gzhan kho na zhig byung bar zad kyi ma 'ongs pa ma yin la /
translated: If it arises in dependence on that, then it is just that other thing that arises, not the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa de yang ma byung ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad don dam par g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i las mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa de yang ma byung ba'i phyir dang / chos thams cad don dam par g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i las mi dmigs te /
translated: And because that future does not occur, and because all phenomena are ultimately without movement, an action that is different from its characteristics is not observed.

original: mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig la 'dogs pa kho nar zad pa dang / gzhan pa nyid yin na yang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis mtshan nyid mtshungs pas yod par 'dra ba bzhin du /üîΩde ltar 'ba' zhig las dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i byed rgyu yang mi dmigs pa dang / las kyang ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tsam 'ba' zhig la 'dogs pa kho nar zad pa dang / gzhan pa nyid yin na yang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba gnyis mtshan nyid mtshungs pas yod par 'dra ba bzhin du / de ltar 'ba' zhig las dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i byed rgyu yang mi dmigs pa dang / las kyang ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang /
translated: If they are different, then since the characteristics of the future and present are similar, they would be similar in existing.üîΩThus, the activity of the agent is not observed, and the activity would arise from that which has not yet occurred.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn has stated well: ‚ÄúAll formations are impermanent and unstable.‚Äù

original: mi brtan pa yin no zhes legs par gsungs pa dang / legs par brjod pa gang yin pa de la yang 'du byed kyi las ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mi brtan pa yin no zhes legs par gsungs pa dang / legs par brjod pa gang yin pa de la yang 'du byed kyi las ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: That which is well stated is as follows: The activity of formations is impermanence.

original: 'du byed rnams ni don las rtag pa nyid yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa nyid kyis shin tu gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa yin par 'dra ba las /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni don las rtag pa nyid yin no zhes yongs su bstan pa nyid kyis shin tu gnod pa byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa yin par 'dra ba las /
translated: and the statement that formations are permanent in terms of their meaning is utterly undermined.

original: gal te mtshan nyid la cha tha dad pa yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid la cha tha dad pa yod par gyur na /
translated: If the characteristic were to have different parts,üîΩwhy would the characteristic not have different parts?üîΩAnd if the characteristic that did not previously exist arose, why would the basis of the characteristic not arise from what did not previously exist?

original: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid cha tha dad par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid cha tha dad pa ma byung ba las byung na ni mtshan gzhi cha tha dad pa yang ci'i phyir ma byung ba las byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yang gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid las gud na mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan nyid cha tha dad par 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid cha tha dad pa ma byung ba las byung na ni mtshan gzhi cha tha dad pa yang ci'i phyir ma byung ba las byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yang gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid las gud na mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: And future things are not observed to be different from the characteristics of formations such as form.

original: 'bras bu ma 'ongs shing med pa yang 'bras bu da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'thad pas @13a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma 'ongs shing med pa yang 'bras bu da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // 'thad pas @13a * //
translated: And because a future and nonexistent effect is a present effect.üîΩThe reasoning of tenability

original: sgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rigs pa las brtsams te /
translated: is as follows.

original: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis med cing /üîΩyod pa ma yin pa ma byung ba las 'byung bar khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa ni de yin te /
analyzed: gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i chos 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid kyis med cing / yod pa ma yin pa ma byung ba las 'byung bar khong du chud par bya ba 'di la rigs pa brjod pa ni de yin te /
translated: The reason why future formations do not exist by the intrinsic identity of formations is thatüîΩthey are not yet arisen from what has not yet come into existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ji lta ba de bzhin du 'das pa yang med par rigs pa brjod pa 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ji lta ba de bzhin du 'das pa yang med par rigs pa brjod pa 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as the future is explained, so the past should be understood as appropriate by this very explanation of the reason.

original: de las 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de las 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are past formations?

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis dngos po las zhigs shing rab tu nyams par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis dngos po las zhigs shing rab tu nyams par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are the intrinsic identity of the disintegration and complete destruction of things.

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are present formations?

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las ma zhigs shing ma nyams par skye ba tsam gyi dus na gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po las ma zhigs shing ma nyams par skye ba tsam gyi dus na gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are the intrinsic identity of the mere arising of things that have not disintegrated or been destroyed.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are future formations?

original: rgyu ni yod cing med pa ma yin la rang gi mtshan nyid ma byung zhing bdag nyid ma thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni yod cing med pa ma yin la rang gi mtshan nyid ma byung zhing bdag nyid ma thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause exists and is not nonexistent, but it has not yet produced its own effect and has not yet attained its own nature.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed rnams yod pa ma yin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: If future formations were to arise from what does not exist,

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: why do sky-flowers, the son of a barren woman, the horns of a donkey, and so on not arise?

original: 'di ltar de dag la ni 'byung ba'i rgyu med kyi 'du byed thams cad la ni 'byung ba'i rgyu so sor nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la ni 'byung ba'i rgyu med kyi 'du byed thams cad la ni 'byung ba'i rgyu so sor nges pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have no cause for arising, but all formations have a cause for arising that is determined individually.

original: gal te 'du byed thams cad la 'byung ba'i rgyu so sor nges pa yod pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed thams cad la 'byung ba'i rgyu so sor nges pa yod pa kho na yin na /
translated: If it is only the case that all formations have a cause for arising that is determined individually,

original: ci'i phyir 'du byed thams cad cig car mgo mnyam kho nar 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du byed thams cad cig car mgo mnyam kho nar 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why do not all formations arise simultaneously and in unison?

original: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu yod kyang 'byung ba'i rkyen la ltos na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu yod kyang 'byung ba'i rkyen la ltos na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Although formations have a cause, they arise in dependence on conditions for arising.

original: 'du byed gang dang gang gi 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i 'du byed de dang de'i rgyu ni 'du byed de dang de mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: 'du byed gang dang gang gi 'byung ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i 'du byed de dang de'i rgyu ni 'du byed de dang de mngon par 'grub par byed de /
translated: When the conditions for the arising of a certain formation are present, that formation arises.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la rgyu yod du zin kyang cig car mgo mnyam du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la rgyu yod du zin kyang cig car mgo mnyam du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though formations have a cause, they do not all arise simultaneously.

original: de la 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu ni gang dang / rkyen ni gang zhe na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba'i rkyen ni bzhi po 'di dag yin par gsungs te rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / @13b dmigs pa'i rkyen dang /üîΩbdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu ni gang dang / rkyen ni gang zhe na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba'i rkyen ni bzhi po 'di dag yin par gsungs te rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / @13b dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: What is the cause and what is the condition of formations? The Lord has said that there are four conditions for the arising of formations: the causal condition, the homogeneous immediate condition, the condition qua object, and the dominant condition.üîΩWhat is the causal condition?

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu yang yin rkyen yang yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu yang yin rkyen yang yin no //
translated: The causal condition is both a cause and a condition.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gsum po dag ni rkyen kho na yin te rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gsum po dag ni rkyen kho na yin te rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The other three conditions are only conditions, not causes.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the causal condition?

original: dbang po gzugs can rten dang bcas pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis ni mdor na sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdbang po gzugs can dang ldan pa ni /

translated: The material faculties together with their supports and the consciousnesses are, in brief, called the seed of all.üîΩThe material faculties are the seeds of the material faculties and of the other material things, and they are the seeds of all mental things, the mind and mental qualities.üîΩThe consciousness is the seed of all the consciousnesses and of the other non-material things, and of the material faculties.

original: dbang po gzugs can de dag dang / de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can rnams kyi sa bon kyang yin la sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad kho na'i sa bon kyang yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can de dag dang / de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can rnams kyi sa bon kyang yin la sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad kho na'i sa bon kyang yin no //
translated: The material faculties are the seeds of the material faculties and of the other material things, and they are the seeds of all mental things, the mind and mental qualities.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa rnam pa thams cad po de'i sa bon yang yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par shes pa rnam pa thams cad po de'i sa bon yang yin la /

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi sa bon yang yin no //üîΩ'byung ba chen po'i gzugs ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi sa bon yang yin no //üîΩ'byung ba chen po'i gzugs ma gtogs pa /
translated: The material faculties are the seeds of the material faculties and of the other material things, and they are the seeds of all mental things, the mind and mental qualities.üîΩThe consciousness is the seed of all the consciousnesses and of the other non-material things, and of the material faculties.üîΩThe material faculties are the seeds of the material faculties and of the other material things, and they are the seeds of all mental things, the mind and mental qualities.üîΩThe consciousness is the seed of all the consciousnesses and of the other non-material things, and of the material faculties.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can rnams ni rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos gzugs can rnams ni rang gi sa bon dang ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other material dharmas are only endowed with the nature of their own seeds.

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i sa bon dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi sa bon dang ngo //

original: de ltar na ji skad yongs su bsgrags pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: de ltar na ji skad yongs su bsgrags pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: Thus, in regard to the dharmas that are well known,

analyzed: de ltar sa bon gyi rgyu dang ldan pa ci rigs par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: the endowment with the causal seeds is established in the appropriate way. This is called the causal condition.

original: gal te dbang po gzugs can rang gi 'byung ba chen po dang bcas pa dag /
analyzed: gal te dbang po gzugs can rang gi 'byung ba chen po dang bcas pa dag /
translated: If the material sense faculties, together with their own great elements,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin du zin na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin du zin na /
translated: were not endowed with the seeds of the mind and mental factors,

original: 'di na 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung sde /
analyzed: 'di na 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa phyis yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung sde /

analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po gzugs can sems dang sems las byung ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa la brten te 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that consciousness arises in dependence on the physical sense faculties and the seeds of mind and mental factors.

analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin du zin na / so so'i skye @14a * //

analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa de la brten nas de'i gzugs 'byung bar rig par bya'o //

analyzed: yang dag par bcom pa ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de la sa bon nyams pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The degeneration of seeds should be understood in brief as threefold:

analyzed: yongs su spong bas nyams pa dang / sun 'byin pas nyams pa dang / zhi gnas kyis nyams pa'o //
translated: degeneration through complete rejection, degeneration through refutation, and degeneration through serenity.

original: lan mang du byed de /
analyzed: lan mang du byed de /

analyzed: de kun du bsten pa'i rgyu dang / bsgoms pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus 'dod pa'i longs spyod kyi yongs su spyod pa la sems mi 'jug mi dga' kun du mi gnas mos par mi byed cing de'i dbang dang / de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed par yang mi byed de /

original: de ni yongs su spong bas nyams pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de ni yongs su spong bas nyams pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: This is called ‚Äúdegeneration through complete abandonment.‚Äù

original: / sun 'byin pas nyams pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / sun 'byin pas nyams pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is degeneration through disgust?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la las nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la las nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes sam /
translated: Here someone, through the perception of danger,

analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes sam / rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes sam /
translated: the perception of foulness,üîΩthe perception of a bloated corpse, and so on,

translated: What is degeneration through tranquility?üîΩHere someone, through the mundane path,üîΩattains freedom from attachment to the desire realm,

analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par byed cing /

analyzed: zhi gnas kyis nye bar bstan pa'i sems kyi rgyu dang ldan pa de'i sems 'dod pa dag gam /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: The virtuous and neutral seeds of the noble ≈õrƒÅvaka who has not yet attained nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder are destroyed because the seeds of affliction are destroyed.

analyzed: gal te yid dngos po med pa kho na zhig la dmigs na ni de la bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa dang / legs par brjod pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: If the mind only focuses on a nonexistent object, then how could the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs statement and assertion that

analyzed: yid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i don gang yin pa 'dzin par byed de /

analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gdags par mdzad nas / yid dang chos rnams la brten te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, having designated the Dharma,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par gsungs pa dang / legs par brjod pa ji skad du nang ngam phyi rol lam /

analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su rtog pa rnams la de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa dang po yin no //

analyzed: yang gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya de lta de ltar byung ba rnams dang / yongs su gyur pa rnams dang / kun tu zhugs pa rnams la zas dang skom dang bzhon pa dang gos dang / rgyan dang khang khyim dang dmag dang nags tshal @17b la sogs pa 'dogs par byed pa'i zas dang skom la sogs pa de dag gzugs la sogs pa las gud na cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Also, food and drink and so on, such as food and drink, vehicles, clothing, ornaments, houses, armies, forests, and so on, that are imputed to forms, smells, tastes, and tangible objects that arise in such and such a way, that are transformed, and that are fully engaged, do not exist in the least apart from forms and so on.

original: 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin /

original: mod kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su rtog pa rnams la /
analyzed: mod kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su rtog pa rnams la /
translated: However, for those who conceive of intrinsic characteristics,

analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that consciousness that observes that does not arise.

original: de ltar na 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa gnyis pa yin no //

analyzed: yang na thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'i log par lta ba ji skad du sbyin pa med do ;

analyzed: /'dod pa med do //

analyzed: mchod sbyin med do zhes rgya cher sngar bstan pa lta bu gang yin pa de la /
translated: no offerings.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dod pa dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa med pa'i med pa nyid gang yin pa de yang dag par yod pa nyid yin na ni des na skyes bu gang zag de lta bur lta ba de yang log par lta bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa dang mchod sbyin la sogs pa med pa'i med pa nyid gang yin pa de yang dag par yod pa nyid yin na ni des na skyes bu gang zag de lta bur lta ba de yang log par lta bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the nonexistence that is the nonexistence of generosity, sacrifice, and so on were to exist, then the person who views things in this way would not have a wrong view.

original: 'di ltar de ni yang dag par lta ba dang / yang dag par smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni yang dag par lta ba dang / yang dag par smra bar 'gyur ro //

original: ci ste med na ni log par lta ba rnams kyi de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci ste med na ni log par lta ba rnams kyi de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'byung ste /

analyzed: de ltar na de ni rigs pa brjod pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third statement of reasoning.

original: yang 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam ther zug pa nyid med de 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam ther zug nyid de'i med pa nyid de gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas kyis bsdus paüîΩyang ma yin /
analyzed: yang 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam ther zug pa nyid med de 'du byed thams cad la rtag pa nyid dam brtan pa nyid dam ther zug nyid de'i med pa nyid de gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin /
translated: The nonexistence of permanence, stability, and eternality in all formations is not included in the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor is it included in the unconditioned.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su rtog pa rnams la /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su rtog pa rnams la /
translated: However, in terms of the general characteristics of formations,

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that the consciousness that observes them does not arise.

analyzed: gal te de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'byung na ni ;

analyzed: brtan pa nyid dam /

original: grol ba med na ni len pa med par yongs su 'da' bar yang mi 'gyur bas /üîΩde lta na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni gtan du rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grol ba med na ni len pa med par yongs su 'da' bar yang mi 'gyur bas / de lta na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni gtan du rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ba zhig na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no liberation, there would be no complete nirvana without grasping.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the afflictions of sentient beings would be forever connected to them, but they are not.

original: 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa bzhi pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa bzhi pa yin no ;
translated: This is the fourth statement of reasoning.

original: / yang 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi 'byung ba nyid kyang re zhig med na 'jig pa yod par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: / yang 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi 'byung ba nyid kyang re zhig med na 'jig pa yod par lta ga la 'gyur /

original: yang 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'byung ba dang / 'jig par rjes su lta zhing mi gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams la 'byung ba dang / 'jig par rjes su lta zhing mi gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, noble ≈õrƒÅvakas do not observe future formations as occurring and as being destroyed, and they do not remain.

analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni rigs pa brjod pa lnga pa yin no //

analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa la dmigs pa ni yod pa kho nar khong du chud par bya ste /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa la dmigs pa rab tu 'grub pa'i rigs pa brjod pa ni de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang yod par rig par bya'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis las 'das pa ni yod de gal te las 'das pa med du zin na 'di na la las gnod pa dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa med pa'i tshor ba myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /

translated: What is the intention of the BhagavƒÅn when he says, ‚ÄúPast karma exists, because if past karma did not exist, then one would not experience painful or pleasant feelings that are related to it‚Äù?

original: 'das pa'i tshe rabs rnams su las dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed cing 'gags pas phyi ma la 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa mngon par 'grub par de'i sa bon gyis 'du byed kyi rgyun phyi ma phyi ma yongs su bzung zhing yongs su bsgos
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshe rabs rnams su las dge ba dang mi dge ba bskyed cing 'gags pas phyi ma la 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa mngon par 'grub par de'i sa bon gyis 'du byed kyi rgyun phyi ma phyi ma yongs su bzung zhing yongs su bsgos
translated: In past lives, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma were produced and ceased, and the seeds of that karma fully grasped and fully cultivated the continuum of karmic formations, which will result in the actualization of the desired and undesired fruits in the future.üîΩ

analyzed: pa las dgongs nas / bcom ldan 'das kyis las 'das pa yod do /
translated: Since virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is generated and ceases in past lives, the seeds of that karma fully grasp and fully cultivate the continuum of karmic action, which is the cause for the actualization of the desired and undesired results in the future.

original: zhes yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: zhes yongs su bstan te /
translated: With that in mind, the Bhagavat taught, ‚ÄúPast karma exists.‚Äù

original: de ltar mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba gang dag dbang phyug dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang rang bzhin dang skyes bu gzhan la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba gang dag dbang phyug dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang rang bzhin dang skyes bu gzhan la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus those who propound that things arise from a nonconcordant cause, such as ƒ™shvara, Indra, BrahmƒÅ, SvabhƒÅva, Puru·π£a, and so on,

original: sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byung bar lta zhing yongs su ston pa dag gi lugs dgag pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyu med par smra ba gang dag sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'byung ba rgyu med par lta zhing yongs su ston pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi lugs dgag pa'i don gyi dbang gnyis gzigs pas yongs su bstan @18b to ;
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byung bar lta zhing yongs su ston pa dag gi lugs dgag pa dang / thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyu med par smra ba gang dag sems can rnams kyi dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'byung ba rgyu med par lta zhing yongs su ston pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi lugs dgag pa'i don gyi dbang gnyis gzigs pas yongs su bstan @18b to ;
translated: The two perspectives are taught in order to refute the systems of those who view and teach that the virtue and nonvirtue of sentient beings arise from a self and the systems of those who view and teach that the virtue and nonvirtue of sentient beings arise without any cause.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed 'das pa rnams ni yod de /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'du byed 'das pa rnams ni yod de /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúPast formations exist.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la mi lta bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la mi lta bar gnas so //
translated: The learned noble ≈õrƒÅvaka abides without viewing them.

original: 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang yod de /
translated: Future formations exist.üîΩThe learned noble ≈õrƒÅvaka abides without delighting in them.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la mngon par mi dga' bar gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la mngon par mi dga' bar gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of that statement?

original: 'du byed 'das pa rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa las yod la /
analyzed: 'du byed 'das pa rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa las yod la /
translated: Past formations exist in terms of the generation of results.

analyzed: 'du byed ma 'ongs pa rnams ni rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa las yod do //
translated: Future formations exist in terms of the possession of causes.

original: 'di ltar da ltar gyi 'du byed rnams ni mtshan nyid gsum gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar gyi 'du byed rnams ni mtshan nyid gsum gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Thus present formations are distinguished by three characteristics:

original: 'das pa rnams kyi 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams kyi 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos po dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
translated: the state of result of past formations, the state of cause of future formations, and the uninterrupted continuity of their own characteristics.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis de yang gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa kho nar 'gyur na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de med do zhes mi bstan pa zhig na /

translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIf that past and future were to exist only in the state of possessing the characteristics of formations, then the states of past and future would not exist.‚Äù

original: yongs su bstan pas na chos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa de bzhin du da ltar byung ba yang med do zhes mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa de spang bar bya ba'i don gyi dbang de gnyis gzigs pas yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su bstan pas na chos 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams la rdzas su mngon par zhen pa spang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa de bzhin du da ltar byung ba yang med do zhes mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa de spang bar bya ba'i don gyi dbang de gnyis gzigs pas yongs su bstan to //
translated: The past and future dharmas are taught in order to abandon attachment to substance, and in order to abandon the attachment of those who think that just as the past and future do not exist, so also the present does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khams 'das pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khams 'das pa yang yod de /
translated: The Lord has said, ‚ÄúThe past element exists,

original: khams ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /üîΩsa bon gyi rgyun byung ba 'bras bu bskyed zin pa ni khams 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na / sa bon gyi rgyun byung ba 'bras bu bskyed zin pa ni khams 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the future element exists.‚Äù What is the intention in that statement?üîΩThe past element is the already arisen seed continuum that has already produced its effect.

original: sa bon gyi rgyun 'byung ba 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni khams ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyun 'byung ba 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni khams ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The future element is the seed continuum that has not yet arisen and has not yet produced its effect.

original: da ltar gyi sa bon gyi rgyun 'bras bu ma bskyed pa nyid ni khams da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi sa bon gyi rgyun 'bras bu ma bskyed pa nyid ni khams da ltar byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The present continuum of seeds that has not yet produced its effect is called the present element.

original: 'di la dgongs pa ni de yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa ni de yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is the intended meaning, and it should be understood in this way.

original: dge slong sa bon gyi rgyun la mkhas pa ni chos tshad med pa bdag nyid sna tshogs can de dang de dag gi khams la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //üîΩci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams las skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag @19a * //
analyzed: dge slong sa bon gyi rgyun la mkhas pa ni chos tshad med pa bdag nyid sna tshogs can de dang de dag gi khams la mkhas pa zhes bya'o // ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams las skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag @19a * //
translated: The monk who is skilled in the continuum of seeds is said to be skilled in the elements of those various immeasurable phenomena.

original: rdzas gzhan du yod pa ma yin par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du yod pa ma yin par khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one understand that arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence do not exist as real entities apart from such conditioned phenomena as form?

original: re zhig 'du byed ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi yod pa nyid bkag pas skye ba'i rdzas su yod pa nyid kyang bkag pa kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'du byed ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi yod pa nyid bkag pas skye ba'i rdzas su yod pa nyid kyang bkag pa kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: First, since the existence of future conditioned phenomena themselves is refuted, the real existence of arising is also refuted.

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni med pa yin pas ji ltar gzhan skyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba ni med pa yin pas ji ltar gzhan skyed par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, since future arising does not exist, how could it generate another?

original: da ltar gyi skye bas ni da ltar gyi 'du byed skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi skye bas ni da ltar gyi 'du byed skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present birth is not able to generate the present formative forces.

original: gzhan yang skye ba zhes bya ba de'i rnam grangs ni mtshan nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba zhes bya ba de'i rnam grangs ni mtshan nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the synonyms of birth are the characteristics of the formative forces, namely:

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba dang 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba de dag yin na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mngon par 'grub pa dang / skye ba dang 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba de dag yin na /
translated: their establishment, birth and origination.

original: rnam grangs de dag las ma gtogs pa mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan pa ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs de dag las ma gtogs pa mtshan nyid bstan pa gzhan pa ni mi dmigs so //
translated: But apart from these synonyms, no other characteristic of the formative forces is discerned.

original: ji ltar 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni mkhas pa mdzangs pas brjod par rigs pa'i tshul ma yin no //üîΩgang 'di skad ces 'di ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba skye'o zhes zer ba des ni don gyis na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni mkhas pa mdzangs pas brjod par rigs pa'i tshul ma yin no // gang 'di skad ces 'di ltar 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba skye'o zhes zer ba des ni don gyis na /
translated: It is not the way of the wise and the learned to say that the present formative forces originate.üîΩBut when it is said that the birth of the formative forces is born, in fact,

original: ji ltar 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid yongs su bstan par zad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid yongs su bstan par zad do //
translated: this is just an indication that the present formative forces originate.

original: gzhan yang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu so sor nges pa dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyu so sor nges pa dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad la /
translated: Moreover, all phenomena are endowed with the individual certainty of their own seed cause.

original: skyed par byed pa'i skye ba gzhan brtags pas kyang ci zhig bya /üîΩgzhan yang skye ba 'du byed rnams kyi mngon par 'grub pa tsam zhig gam /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i skye ba gzhan brtags pas kyang ci zhig bya / gzhan yang skye ba 'du byed rnams kyi mngon par 'grub pa tsam zhig gam /
translated: Moreover, what is the point of positing another arising that generates all phenomena that possess the individual, distinct seeds of their causes?üîΩMoreover, is arising the mere establishment of compounded phenomena?

original: 'on te mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba zhig yin /
translated: Or is it the cause of their establishment?

original: re zhig gal te mngon par 'grub pa tsam zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te mngon par 'grub pa tsam zhig yin na ni /
translated: First, if it is the mere establishment of compounded phenomena,

original: skye ba 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba 'du byed rnams mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin te /
translated: then arising would not cause the establishment of compounded phenomena.

original: skye ba yod na mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba yod na mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It would not be tenable to say, ‚ÄúIf arising exists, establishment occurs.‚Äù

original: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang tshul de nyid kyis ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang tshul de nyid kyis ci rigs par rig par bya ste /
translated: Just as with arising, so also with aging, enduring, and impermanence, one should understand in the appropriate manner.

original: de lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa yang 'du byed rnams la brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa yang 'du byed rnams la brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that arising and so on are also imputedly existent in relation to formations.

original: de la rgyu yod na rang gi @19b mtshan nyid sngon ma byung ba 'grub pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu yod na rang gi @19b mtshan nyid sngon ma byung ba 'grub pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of a specific characteristic that did not exist previously when its cause exists is called the ‚Äúarising‚Äù of formations.

original: snga ma las phyi ma gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma las phyi ma gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni 'du byed rnams kyi rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the subsequent moment into something else from the prior moment is called the ‚Äúaging‚Äù of formations.

original: skye ba'i dus tsam la gnas pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i dus tsam la gnas pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mere enduring of the moment of arising is called the ‚Äúenduring‚Äù of formations.

original: de lta bas na skye ba'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig pa'i skad cig ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'jig pa'i skad cig ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the moment of destruction that occurs after the moment of arising is called the ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù of formations.

original: gal te 'dus byas la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa 'di dag dmigs na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang gsum kho na gsungs she na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi po skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa 'di dag dmigs na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid dang gsum kho na gsungs she na /
translated: If the four characteristics of conditioned states are observed in conditioned states, why did the Lord declare only three characteristics, namely, arising, enduring, and being destroyed?

original: 'du byed rnams ni dus gsum gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni dus gsum gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /

original: des na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur bas /üîΩde'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te 'byung ba yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par gsungs so //

translated: Therefore, since they will arise in the future from what has not yet occurred,üîΩthe Lord declared arising to be a characteristic of conditioned states in dependence on the future time.

original: byung ba rnams 'das pa'i dus su zhigs par gyur pas de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa'i dus la brten te zhigs pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin par gsungs so //
