analyzed: de la spyi cer du gyur pa dang / mgo skya ba la sogs pa rgyas par ji skad mdo las gsungs pa lta bu dag gis lus yongs su gyur pa ni lus rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the body through the general process of aging, the whitening of hair, and so on, as described in detail in the sutras, is called aging of the body.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i sems yongs su gyur nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa'i don rnams la re ba dang ldan pa'i sems yongs su gyur pa ni re ba 'bras bu med par gyur pa de ni sems rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems yongs su gyur nas sdug bsngal ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i sems yongs su gyur nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa'i don rnams la re ba dang ldan pa'i sems yongs su gyur pa ni re ba 'bras bu med par gyur pa de ni sems rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The transformation of a mind associated with the feeling of pleasure into a mind associated with the feeling of pain, the transformation of a virtuous mind into a defiled mind, and the transformation of a mind that is hopeful about the objects of desire into a mind that is hopeless about the objects of desire is called the aging of the mind.

original: nyin mtshan de dang de dag 'das pa dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam de dang de dag 'das pas tshe 'gribs pa'i rim gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su zad par gyur pa ni tshe rga ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: nyin mtshan de dang de dag 'das pa dang skad cig dang thang cig dang yud tsam de dang de dag 'das pas tshe 'gribs pa'i rim gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su zad par gyur pa ni tshe rga ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: The gradual decrease of life through the passing of days and nights, moments and seconds, is called the aging of life.

original: / dbang phyug gi bdag po phun sum tshogs pa thams cad nyams pa dang / nad med pa dang / kha dog dang / stobs dang / brtas pa la sogs pa rnam par gyur pa ni 'gyur ba rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / dbang phyug gi bdag po phun sum tshogs pa thams cad nyams pa dang / nad med pa dang / kha dog dang / stobs dang / brtas pa la sogs pa rnam par gyur pa ni 'gyur ba rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The change of the master of power, the loss of all that is excellent, the change of health, complexion, strength, firmness, etc. is called the change of aging.

original: bde 'gror skyes shing legs par 'byor pa'i lus dag las shi 'phos nas ngan 'gro ngan pa'i ris rnams su lus mngon par 'grub pa ni lus 'gyur ba rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror skyes shing legs par 'byor pa'i lus dag las shi 'phos nas ngan 'gro ngan pa'i ris rnams su lus mngon par 'grub pa ni lus 'gyur ba rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of a body in an evil destiny, in an inferior class, after having been born in a good destiny and having had a good body, is called the change of aging of the body.

original: gang la brten nas rga ba'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rga ba gcig pa yang yod de 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig skad cig la gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i rga ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang la brten nas rga ba'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa de dag thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rga ba gcig pa yang yod de 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig skad cig la gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i rga ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: There is also a single aging which is the basis for all the aspects of aging as they have been presented, namely, the aging which is the moment-by-moment change of the formations.

original: gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa du ma yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa du ma yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The differentiation of duration should be understood in many ways.

original: 'di lta ste skad cig gnas pa dang / rgyun gnas pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pas gnas pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa dang / lugs gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste skad cig gnas pa dang / rgyun gnas pa dang / rkyen dang 'brel pas gnas pa dang / rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa dang / lugs gnas pa'o //
translated: They are: momentary duration, continuous duration, duration through the connection with conditions, duration without distraction, and natural duration.

original: @21b de la 'du byed 'byung ba skye ba'i dus tsam la gnas pa ni skad cig gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @21b de la 'du byed 'byung ba skye ba'i dus tsam la gnas pa ni skad cig gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mere occurrence of the arising of formations is called momentary duration.

original: de dang der mngon par 'grub pa'i lus de dang de dag zas de dang de la brten nas tshe ji srid par gnas pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten rnams bskal pa chen po'i mthar thug par gnas pa ni rgyun gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par 'grub pa'i lus de dang de dag zas de dang de la brten nas tshe ji srid par gnas pa dang / phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten rnams bskal pa chen po'i mthar thug par gnas pa ni rgyun gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The duration of the body that is being actualized in this or that place, in dependence on this or that nutriment, for as long as life lasts, and the duration of the external world of the physical environment, until the end of the eon, is called continuous duration.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rang rang gi rkyen nye bar gnas na re zhig gnas pa ni rkyen dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams rang rang gi rkyen nye bar gnas na re zhig gnas pa ni rkyen dang /
translated: The duration of feelings of pleasure, pain, and neither pleasure nor pain, and of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral phenomena, for as long as they remain in dependence on their own conditions, is called duration through the connection with conditions.

original: 'brel bas gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel bas gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúabiding in connection‚Äù because it is the basis for the arising of the path of insight.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa ni rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa ni rnam par mi g-yeng bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The actualization of the concentration of one whose mind is in equipoise is called ‚Äúabiding without distraction.‚Äù

original: yul gzhan du grong dang grol rdal dang yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams dang / rgyal po bzhugs sa dang ; bskos pa 'du ba'i sa dang / bzo sbyangs kyi gnas rnams dang / lag rub byed pa dag dang / 'khor rnams la spyod tshul rnying pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni lugs gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du grong dang grol rdal dang yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor rnams dang / rgyal po bzhugs sa dang ; bskos pa 'du ba'i sa dang / bzo sbyangs kyi gnas rnams dang / lag rub byed pa dag dang / 'khor rnams la spyod tshul rnying pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ni lugs gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The continuation of the old customs of the villages, towns, cities, royal palaces, the king‚Äôs dwelling places, the places where the ministers assemble, the places where the artisans work, the places where the people gather, and the retinue is called ‚Äúthe continuation of the system.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa du ma yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yang rnam pa du ma yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The classification of impermanence should be understood as having many varieties.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / byung zin pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang / byung zin pa'i mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: the impermanence of destruction, the impermanence of birth, the impermanence of change, the impermanence of separation, the impermanence of arising, and the impermanence of what has arisen.

original: de la 'du byed skyes pa rnams 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed skyes pa rnams 'jig pa ni 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The destruction of arisen formations is called the impermanence of destruction.

original: 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba ni skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las 'byung ba ni skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The arising of formations from what does not exist is called the impermanence of birth.

original: 'du byed 'dod pa de  ltar gyi dus su mi 'dra ba 'byung ba mngon du gyur pa thams cad ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'dod pa de  ltar gyi dus su mi 'dra ba 'byung ba mngon du gyur pa thams cad ni 'du byed rnams kyi 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: All the changes that occur in formations as they pass from one state to another are called the impermanence of change.

original: yo byad sdug pa ma gyur pa rnams dang bral zhing de la dbang nyams pa ni 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad sdug pa ma gyur pa rnams dang bral zhing de la dbang nyams pa ni 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The loss of control over pleasant things that have not been used up and the separation from them is called the impermanence of separation.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //üîΩde ltar gyi dus na mngon du 'gyur ba ni byung zin pa'i @22a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o // de ltar gyi dus na mngon du 'gyur ba ni byung zin pa'i @22a * //
translated: The impermanence of the present is the manifestation of these four kinds of impermanence in the present.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The impermanence of the past is the impermanence that has already occurred.

original: de la 'dod pa las longs spyod pa bag med par gyur ba rnams ni 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang phrad de /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa las longs spyod pa bag med par gyur ba rnams ni 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang 'bral ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang phrad de /
translated: Those who enjoy the pleasures of desire without restraint encounter the impermanence of change and the impermanence of separation.

original: yid la byed pa na rgyas par mya ngan byed sgyid lug par byed kyang 'du byed rnams la skyo bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa na rgyas par mya ngan byed sgyid lug par byed kyang 'du byed rnams la skyo bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When they reflect on this, they grieve and despair, but they do not become disgusted with the formations.

original: gzhan mu stegs can dag ni mi rtag pa nyid de dag nyid shas cher yid la byed pa na skyo zhing 'dod pa las dben pa tsam la brten kyang 'du byed rnams kyi phyogs 'ga' las skyo bar 'gyur gyi gtan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag ni mi rtag pa nyid de dag nyid shas cher yid la byed pa na skyo zhing 'dod pa las dben pa tsam la brten kyang 'du byed rnams kyi phyogs 'ga' las skyo bar 'gyur gyi gtan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-Buddhists, who reflect on these kinds of impermanence, become disgusted with them and turn away from desire, but they do not become disgusted with any aspect of the formations and do not turn away from them completely.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos ni mi rtag pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yid la byed cing 'du byed rnams las gtan skyo ba dang rnam par grol ba'i bar du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos ni mi rtag pa nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs par yid la byed cing 'du byed rnams las gtan skyo ba dang rnam par grol ba'i bar du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble ≈õrƒÅvakas bring to mind the impermanence of all conditioned things, and they become disgusted with conditioned things and are liberated.

original: 'thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'thob pa dang rnyed pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is acquisition?

original: mdor bsdu na 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing sa bon yongs su brtas pa ni 'thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis yongs su zin cing sa bon yongs su brtas pa ni 'thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, acquisition is the possession of the conditions for the arising of a dharma and the growth of its seed.

original: rnam grangs des na 'thob pa yang btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na 'thob pa yang btags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this method, one should understand that acquisition is a nominal existent.

original: gal te 'thob pa rdzas su yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'thob pa rdzas su yod par gyur na /
translated: If acquisition were a substantial existent,

original: de 'du byed rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: de 'du byed rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu 'am /
translated: it would be the cause for the arising of conditioned dharmas,

original: yang na chos dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yang na chos dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur 'gyur grang na /
translated: or it would be the cause for not being separated from dharmas.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur na ni /
translated: If it were the cause for the arising of conditioned dharmas,

original: des na ji srid du chos de thob par ma gyur pa'i snga rol na de'i 'byung ba'i rgyu thob pa yang med pas nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ji srid du chos de thob par ma gyur pa'i snga rol na de'i 'byung ba'i rgyu thob pa yang med pas nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, prior to the attainment of a dharma, there is no cause for its arising, because attainment does not exist. Thus, it would never arise.

original: de lta na de gtan mi 'thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de gtan mi 'thob pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would never be attained.

original: gal te chos dang mi 'bral ba'i rgyur 'gyur na ni des na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyis thob pa mgo mnyam du yod pa'i /
analyzed: gal te chos dang mi 'bral ba'i rgyur 'gyur na ni des na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyis thob pa mgo mnyam du yod pa'i /
translated: If attainment were the cause of non-separation from a dharma, then all dharmas‚Äîwholesome, unwholesome, and neutral‚Äîwould have attainment existing simultaneously with them.

original: mi mthun pa de dag kyang mgo mnyam du kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa de dag kyang mgo mnyam du kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: And those that are incompatible would also arise simultaneously.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, neither is correct.

original: chos rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni so sor nges pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi sa bon yongs su zin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni so sor nges pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi sa bon yongs su zin pa'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of dharmas is the condition that determines the seed of a particular dharma.

original: 'bral ba'i rgyu ni rkyen gzhan mngon du gyur pas rkyen gzhan dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i rgyu ni rkyen gzhan mngon du gyur pas rkyen gzhan dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: The cause of separation is the separation from a condition due to the manifestation of another condition.

original: de la rkyen bsgrub pa la dbang ba ni 'thob pa zhes gdags te /
analyzed: de la rkyen bsgrub pa la dbang ba ni 'thob pa zhes gdags te /
translated: Attainment is designated as the power to obtain a condition.

original: dbang de la brten nas skyes bu gang zag de chos skyes nas @22b 'gags pa gang dang gang mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de bskyed pa'i phyir myur ba myur ba kho nar rkyen sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: dbang de la brten nas skyes bu gang zag de chos skyes nas @22b 'gags pa gang dang gang mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de bskyed pa'i phyir myur ba myur ba kho nar rkyen sgrub par byed de /
translated: The person who has that power quickly, quickly establishes the conditions for generating whatever dharma that has arisen and ceased that he wishes to actualize.

original: de lta bas na de yang 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang 'thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that is also called ‚Äúattainment.‚Äù

original: 'thob pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: That attainment should be understood as threefold in brief:

original: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang ; kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde la re zhig nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i chos ma btsal bar kun tu 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sa bon re zhig zhi gnas kyi nyams pas kyang nyams par ma byas la /
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa dang / dbang dang ldan pa dang ; kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'o // de la re zhig nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i chos ma btsal bar kun tu 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sa bon re zhig zhi gnas kyi nyams pas kyang nyams par ma byas la /
translated: endowed with seeds, endowed with power, and endowed with manifestation.üîΩFirst, the afflicted and neutral and the virtuous dharmas that arise from birth and manifest without being sought are endowed with seeds.üîΩThe virtuous dharmas are also endowed with power, that is, they are not destroyed by the degeneration of shamatha,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis kyang yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / dge ba rnams kyi yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis kyang yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / dge ba rnams kyi yang 'di lta ste /
translated: and they are not destroyed by the arya path.

original: dper na dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bcad pa rnams kyi lhar log par lta bas nyams par ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /üîΩ'di ltar ji srid du de'i sa bon de nyams par ma byas shing yang dag par ma bcom pa de srid du de nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i chos kun du 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: dper na dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du bcad pa rnams kyi lhar log par lta bas nyams par ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon dang ldan pa zhes bya ste / 'di ltar ji srid du de'i sa bon de nyams par ma byas shing yang dag par ma bcom pa de srid du de nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i chos kun du 'byung ba'am /
translated: For example, the root of virtue that is not damaged by the wrong view of the self in regard to gods is said to be endowed with seeds.

original: kun du 'byung ba ma yin pa de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba ma yin pa de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as its seed is not damaged or completely destroyed, it is said to be endowed with those virtuous factors that arise or do not arise due to the presence of afflictions, etc.

original: dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du bya bas bskyed pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa de dag kha cig gi 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis rgyu sa bon yongs su brtas pa yongs su zin pa ni dbang dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du bya bas bskyed pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa de dag kha cig gi 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis rgyu sa bon yongs su brtas pa yongs su zin pa ni dbang dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generation of virtuous factors through the performance of virtuous actions and the possession of those indeterminate factors whose seeds have been nourished by the conditions of their arising are said to be endowed with power.

original: da ltar gyi chos rnams mngon sum gyi dngos pos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'grub pa ni kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi chos rnams mngon sum gyi dngos pos rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'grub pa ni kun du 'byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The establishment of present factors by the power of their own characteristics is said to be endowed with occurrence.

original: de la srog gi dbang po gang zhe na ston gyi las kyis de dang der lus mngon par grub pa gnas pa'i dus nges pa 'phangs pa ni tshe dang srog dang srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la srog gi dbang po gang zhe na ston gyi las kyis de dang der lus mngon par grub pa gnas pa'i dus nges pa 'phangs pa ni tshe dang srog dang srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: What is the faculty of life force? The life force is the duration of the life of beings projected by their karma in the various realms.

original: de yang rab tu dbye na nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / yun thung ba dang / yun ring ba dang / mthar thug pa dang / mthar thug pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de yang rab tu dbye na nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / yun thung ba dang / yun ring ba dang / mthar thug pa dang / mthar thug pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is of various types: definite, indefinite, continuous, non-continuous, short, long, finite, infinite,

original: rang gis dbang bsgyur ba dang / rang gis dbang bsgyur ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis dbang bsgyur ba dang / rang gis dbang bsgyur ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: under one‚Äôs own control, and not under one‚Äôs own control.

original: de la 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi tshe ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i gnas na ni tshe nges @23a * //üîΩpa yin no //üîΩ'di na ni lan 'ga' ni yun ring ste dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de la 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi tshe ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i gnas na ni tshe nges @23a * // pa yin no // 'di na ni lan 'ga' ni yun ring ste dpag tu med do //
translated: Except for humans of Jambudvƒ´pa, the life force in other birth stories is definite.

original: lan 'ga' ni yun thung ngo //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni yun thung ngo //
translated: In this world, sometimes it is long, sometimes it is short.üîΩSometimes it is immeasurable.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni ji ltar tshe so sor nges pa bzhin du gtan du rjes su 'jug ste /üîΩbar mdor 'chi ba'i dus byed pa med pas rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan dag na ni ji ltar tshe so sor nges pa bzhin du gtan du rjes su 'jug ste / bar mdor 'chi ba'i dus byed pa med pas rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In Uttarakuru, life is always of the same duration as the life expectancy indicates.üîΩThere is no premature death there.

analyzed: de las gzhan pa thams cad na ni rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling na mi tshe lo bcu pa rnams kyi tshe ni yun thung ba yin no //
translated: In Jambudvƒ´pa, the life span is not determined: sometimes it is long, sometimes short.

original: dud 'gro kha cig gi yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro kha cig gi yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same for animals and hungry ghosts.

original: 'di ltar dud 'gro kha cig gi tshe ni nyin zhag gcig tu snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dud 'gro kha cig gi tshe ni nyin zhag gcig tu snang la /

original: kha cig gi tshe ni nyin zhag gnyis dang / gsum dang bcu'i bar du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig gi tshe ni nyin zhag gnyis dang / gsum dang bcu'i bar du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The life of others lasts one day and night, but a day and night of the CaturmahƒÅrƒÅjakƒÅyikas gods.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe ni bskal pa chen po brgyad khri thub pas yun ring po yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe ni bskal pa chen po brgyad khri thub pas yun ring po yin no //
translated: The life of the sentient beings born in the BhavƒÅgra lasts 84,000 great kalpas.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa gang dag tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams dang / so so'i skye bo'i srid pa thams gang dag yin pa dag gi tshe ni mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / slob pa gang dag tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams dang / so so'i skye bo'i srid pa thams gang dag yin pa dag gi tshe ni mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: The life faculty of those who are in their final existence, namely, the arhats, those in training, and ordinary persons who are destined to attain nirvana in this very life, is final.

original: de las gzhan pa dag gi mthar thug pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gi mthar thug pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The life faculty of those who are not in their final existence should be understood as not final.

original: dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gang dag tshe'i 'du byed gtong ba dang / spel bar spyod pa dag ni srog gi dbang po la rang gis dbang bsgyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gang dag tshe'i 'du byed gtong ba dang / spel bar spyod pa dag ni srog gi dbang po la rang gis dbang bsgyur ba yin no //
translated: The life faculty of the arhats, the TathƒÅgatas, and the bodhisattvas who are masters of the powers is under their own control, since they can relinquish and prolong their life forces.

original: de las gzhan pa dag ni rang gis dbang bsgyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag ni rang gis dbang bsgyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The life faculty of those who are not like them should be understood as not under their own control.

original: de la rigs mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is homogeneous?

original: mdor bsdu na skye ba'i gnas de dang der sems can khams mtshungs pa dang 'gro ba mtshungs pa dang / skye gnas mtshungs pa rnams kyi rigs dang na tshod dang / rang bzhin dang bod tshod mtshungs pa la sogs pa yan lag de dang des 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni ris mthun pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na skye ba'i gnas de dang der sems can khams mtshungs pa dang 'gro ba mtshungs pa dang / skye gnas mtshungs pa rnams kyi rigs dang na tshod dang / rang bzhin dang bod tshod mtshungs pa la sogs pa yan lag de dang des 'dra ba gang yin pa de ni ris mthun pa ste /

original: 'gro ba ris mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'gro ba ris mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa yang yod de /

original: 'gro ba gcig tu skyes pa gang dag yin pa @23b rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig tu skyes pa gang dag yin pa @23b rnams so //

original: skye gnas mthun pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: skye gnas mthun pa nyid kyis mtshungs pa yang yod de /

original: skye gnas gcig tu mngon par 'grub pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye gnas gcig tu mngon par 'grub pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //

original: rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa yang yod de /
translated: There are also those who are similar due to similarity of type.

analyzed: rigs gcig kho na la brten pa gang dag yin pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are similar due to similarity of type are those who are similar due to being based on the same type.

original: gang dag kha dog dang / chu zheng dang / sgra brjod pa dang / 'tsho ba mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: gang dag kha dog dang / chu zheng dang / sgra brjod pa dang / 'tsho ba mthun pa nyid kyis mthun pa dag kyang yod do //

original: rgyas par yang dag par lta ba rnams yang dag par lta ba dag dang mthun pa'i bar dang / rgyun du zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dag dang mthun pa dang /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa' dag dang mthun pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dag dang mthun pa'o //

original: de la so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /

translated: The transformation of the support should be understood as the power of the arising of supramundane dharmas.

original: // / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: It is also called the antidote to the store consciousness, the non-store consciousness, the realm of the uncontaminated, and the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: de la rnam par rig byed gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed gang zhe na /
translated: What is intimation?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, it is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'o //üîΩde la lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las kyi lam mi dge ba bcu po ma spangs pa kun tu spyod pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba dang ; lung du ma bstan pa'o // de la lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las kyi lam mi dge ba bcu po ma spangs pa kun tu spyod pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: defiled, wholesome, and indeterminate.üîΩHere, the intimation of the path of action of body and speech, which is based on the practice of the ten unwholesome courses of action that have not been abandoned,

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las rnam par rig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las rnam par rig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
translated: is called defiled intimation.

original: de dag nyid yongs su spong ba yang dag par len par byed pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las rnam par rig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //üîΩspyod lam las byung ba'am /
analyzed: de dag nyid yongs su spong ba yang dag par len par byed pa'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las rnam par rig par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i rnam par rig byed ces bya'o // spyod lam las byung ba'am /
translated: The physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.

original: tshig kyang mi smra ba gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshig kyang mi smra ba gang yin pa de ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //
translated: The physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.üîΩThe physical and verbal actions that cause one to take up the complete abandonment of those are called virtuous informative action.

original: de la lus yul nas yul gzhan du 'byung ba tsam dang / de nyid na 'gyur ba 'byung ba tsam ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: de la lus yul nas yul gzhan du 'byung ba tsam dang / de nyid na 'gyur ba 'byung ba tsam ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: The mere arising of the body from one place to another and the mere arising of change in that very place is bodily intimation.

original: ngag tsam ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: ngag tsam ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Speech alone is vocal intimation.

original: @28b de bzhin du sems mngon par 'du byed pa skyes pa'i sems pa tsam ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: @28b de bzhin du sems mngon par 'du byed pa skyes pa'i sems pa tsam ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Similarly, the mere volition that arises from the mental disposition is mental intimation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir yul nas yul gzhan du 'pho bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir yul nas yul gzhan du 'pho bar mi rigs pas /
translated: Because all formations are momentary, it is not reasonable that they move from one place to another.

original: 'du byed 'byung ba tsam ma gtogs par bya ba gzhan ni mig dang rna ba dang / yid kyis kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du byed 'byung ba tsam ma gtogs par bya ba gzhan ni mig dang rna ba dang / yid kyis kyang mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Apart from the mere arising of formations, no action is perceived by the eye, ear, or mind.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rig byed kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rig byed kyang brtags pa'i yod pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that intimation also exists as a designation.

original: de la sdom pa ma yin pa'i rigs su skyes zin pa gang la la 'tsho ba 'dis 'tsho bar bya'o zhes rang gi sems mngon par 'du byed cing /
analyzed: de la sdom pa ma yin pa'i rigs su skyes zin pa gang la la 'tsho ba 'dis 'tsho bar bya'o zhes rang gi sems mngon par 'du byed cing /
translated: When someone who has already been born in the family of non-restraint thinks, ‚ÄúI will live by this livelihood,‚Äù

original: de 'tsho ba de la 'dod pa bzod par byed pa ni de'i tshe na ma bsdams pa yin par brjod par bya'o //üîΩsdom pa ma yin par gtogs pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rab tu dam pos bcom pas sems bsdus pa'i phyir ji srid du /
analyzed: de 'tsho ba de la 'dod pa bzod par byed pa ni de'i tshe na ma bsdams pa yin par brjod par bya'o // sdom pa ma yin par gtogs pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa rab tu dam pos bcom pas sems bsdus pa'i phyir ji srid du /
translated: and he endures and desires that livelihood, then at that time he is said to be unrestrained.

original: srog gcod pa las byung ba'am de las gzhan pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam las byung ba spyod pa de srid du yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las byung ba'am de las gzhan pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam las byung ba spyod pa de srid du yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: As long as he engages in the path of action of killing or other non-virtuous actions, he possesses the extensive roots of non-virtue because his mind is restrained by the power of incorrect attention that is included in non-restraint.

original: gang las dang gang dang ji tsam du spyod par byed pa ni des na de tsam du shas cher mi dge ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las dang gang dang ji tsam du spyod par byed pa ni des na de tsam du shas cher mi dge ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: To the extent that he engages in action and the basis of that action, to that extent he possesses extensive non-virtue.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa'i rigs su skyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du gang su yang rung ba gang dang gang nas 'ongs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa'i rigs su skyes pa ji lta ba bzhin du gang su yang rung ba gang dang gang nas 'ongs kyang rung ste /
translated: Just as one born in the family of non-restraint, so too, whoever comes from anywhere,

original: sems skyed par byed pa yang de bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems skyed par byed pa yang de bzhin du rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: one who generates the thought should be understood in the same way in detail.

original: de ni ji srid du sdom pa ma yin pa'i sems pa spong bar mi byed pa de srid du ma bsdams par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni ji srid du sdom pa ma yin pa'i sems pa spong bar mi byed pa de srid du ma bsdams par brjod par bya ste /
translated: As long as one does not abandon the intention of non-restraint, for that long one should be called unrestrained.

original: de ni nyin gcig bzhin du sems pa de mang du sogs pa dang / las de kun du spyod pas bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'phel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyin gcig bzhin du sems pa de mang du sogs pa dang / las de kun du spyod pas bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par 'phel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that every day, as that intention increases and one engages in that action, non-meritorious karma increases.

original: de'i log par smon pa'i sems pa ma dad pa dang / le lo dang brjod ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang ldan pa las de yang dag par len par byed pa /
analyzed: de'i log par smon pa'i sems pa ma dad pa dang / le lo dang brjod ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba dang ldan pa las de yang dag par len par byed pa /
translated: That wrong aspiration, with its lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and poor understanding, takes up that action.

original: las de kun nas slong bar byed pa de yang ji srid du gtong ba'i rgyu dag gis spong bar mi bya ste /üîΩyongs su gtong bar mi byed kyi bar du de phyin chad kyang sa bon dang kun du spyod pa las rgyud du gtogs pas 'byung ba ni sdom pa ma @29a * //
analyzed: las de kun nas slong bar byed pa de yang ji srid du gtong ba'i rgyu dag gis spong bar mi bya ste / yongs su gtong bar mi byed kyi bar du de phyin chad kyang sa bon dang kun du spyod pa las rgyud du gtogs pas 'byung ba ni sdom pa ma @29a * //
translated: And that which instigates that action is not abandoned as long as the causes of giving it up are not present.

original: yin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde la sdig pa'i las de'i 'bras bu phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba la yid mi ches shing /
analyzed: yin pa zhes bya'o // de la sdig pa'i las de'i 'bras bu phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba la yid mi ches shing /
translated: As long as it is not given up, it is called a non-vow, because it arises in the continuum through the seeds and practice.

original: mos par mi byed la rjes su mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ma dad pa yin no //
analyzed: mos par mi byed la rjes su mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i ma dad pa yin no //
translated: Lack of faith is the lack of conviction, lack of aspiration, and lack of engagement in the undesirable results of that bad action in the future.

original: de la mngon par dga' zhing ci 'dod pa bzhin du 'jug pa de 'dul ba la mi spro ba gang yin pa de ni de'i le lo yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' zhing ci 'dod pa bzhin du 'jug pa de 'dul ba la mi spro ba gang yin pa de ni de'i le lo yin no //
translated: Laziness is the lack of enthusiasm for taming that which is delighted with and engaged in that action as one wishes.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos nyes pa dang ldan pa la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brjed ngas pa yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i chos nyes pa dang ldan pa la kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mi brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brjed ngas pa yin no //
translated: When one does not declare as it truly is that a Dharma with a fault, that is, a transgression, is one with a fault, that is his heedlessness.

original: sems kyi rgyud rnam par 'khrugs pa dang ; nyon mongs pa can dang / mi brtan par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud rnam par 'khrugs pa dang ; nyon mongs pa can dang / mi brtan par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin no //
translated: When his mind is disturbed, defiled, and unstable, that is his distraction.

original: skyon la yon tan du lta ba'i sems kyi rgyud phyin ci log tu 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i shes rab 'chal pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon la yon tan du lta ba'i sems kyi rgyud phyin ci log tu 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i shes rab 'chal pa yin no //
translated: When his mind is perverted, thinking that faults are good qualities, that is his false wisdom.

original: tshul khrims sdig pa can gyi dbang du byas te ;
analyzed: tshul khrims sdig pa can gyi dbang du byas te ;
translated: Morality is considered in terms of sin.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi dge ba de dag dang ldan pa'i sems pa mi dge ba 'byung ba ni de'i tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa mi dge ba de dag dang ldan pa'i sems pa mi dge ba 'byung ba ni de'i tshul khrims 'chal pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a sinful mind arises, endowed with those nonvirtues such as lack of faith, that is his immorality.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdom pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdom pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin par ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is to enter into the vow.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: There is a distinction here.

original: sdom pa yang dag par blang bar 'os pa gang la sdom pa yang dag par len pa de la /
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par blang bar 'os pa gang la sdom pa yang dag par len pa de la /
translated: For whom it is proper to take up the vow, for that one,üîΩthere is the taking up of the vow.

original: de dag las la la ni gzhan las sam rang yang len par byed do //
analyzed: de dag las la la ni gzhan las sam rang yang len par byed do //
translated: Some of them take it up from another, or they take it up by themselves.

original: de dag las la la ni rang kho na las len par byed de dge slong gi sdom pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de dag las la la ni rang kho na las len par byed de dge slong gi sdom pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Some of them take it up by themselves, except for the vow of a bhikshu.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dge slong gi sdom pa ni thams cad kyis yang dag par blang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gi sdom pa ni thams cad kyis yang dag par blang bar 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the vow of a bhikshu is not proper for all to take up.

original: de la gal te dge slong gi sdom pa gzhan las nges par blang ba ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te dge slong gi sdom pa gzhan las nges par blang ba ma yin par gyur na /
translated: If the vow of a bhikshu were not to be taken up from another,

original: de la gang dag rab tu 'byung bar 'os pa dang / gang dag rab tu 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin pa rang la rag lus pa'i rab tu 'byung bas rab tu byung ba de dag thams cad kyis bstan pa brtan par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gang dag rab tu 'byung bar 'os pa dang / gang dag rab tu 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin pa rang la rag lus pa'i rab tu 'byung bas rab tu byung ba de dag thams cad kyis bstan pa brtan par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who are suitable to go forth and those who are not suitable to go forth, all of whom go forth through going forth that depends on oneself, do not stabilize the teaching.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba nyid kyang med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba nyid kyang med par 'gyur bas /
translated: And the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya itself would not exist.

original: de'i phyir dge slong gi sdom pa ni rang la rag lus pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gi sdom pa ni rang la rag lus pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the vows of a fully ordained monk do not depend on oneself alone.

original: gal te dge slong gi sdom pa ma @29b gtogs pa'i sdom pa rang gis yang dag par blang ba yod na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gi sdom pa ma @29b gtogs pa'i sdom pa rang gis yang dag par blang ba yod na /
translated: If there are vows other than the vows of a fully ordained monk that are taken correctly by oneself,

original: ci'i phyir gzhan las yang dag par len par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan las yang dag par len par byed ce na /
translated: why does one take them correctly from another?

original: gnyis pa 'di dag ni tshul khrims 'chal ba spong ba yang dag par blangs ba rjes su bsrung pa'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa 'di dag ni tshul khrims 'chal ba spong ba yang dag par blangs ba rjes su bsrung pa'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The second two are branches of protecting the vow that abandons unethical conduct:

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'o //
translated: shame and embarrassment.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa na gzhan la brten pa dang / bdag nyid la brten te /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa na gzhan la brten pa dang / bdag nyid la brten te /
translated: When one engages in misdeeds, one does so in dependence on others and oneself.üîΩ

original: 'dzem pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'dzem pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur bas /
translated: When one engages in the performance of evil deeds, shame and abashment are present in relation to others and in relation to oneself.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims 'chal pa spong ba yang dag par blang ba rjes su srung ba'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par blang ba byas par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims 'chal pa spong ba yang dag par blang ba rjes su srung ba'i yan lag yongs su rdzogs pas yang dag par blang ba byas par 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, one undertakes the restraint of abandoning immorality by perfecting the branch of undertaking the restraint of abandoning immorality.

original: de'i phyir gzhan las yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan las yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: Therefore, one undertakes it in relation to others.

original: gang la ngo tsha shes pa nye bar gnas pa de la ni khrel yod pa yang nye bar gnas la /
analyzed: gang la ngo tsha shes pa nye bar gnas pa de la ni khrel yod pa yang nye bar gnas la /
translated: For one in whom shame is present, abashment is also present.

original: gang la khrel yod pa nye bar gnas pa de la ni ngo tsha shes pa de yang gdon mi za bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la khrel yod pa nye bar gnas pa de la ni ngo tsha shes pa de yang gdon mi za bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: But for one in whom abashment is present, shame is not necessarily present.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ngo tsha shes pa'i chos 'ba' zhig ches stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ngo tsha shes pa'i chos 'ba' zhig ches stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this context, the quality of shame is the stronger of the two.

original: rang gis yang dag par blangs shing de kho na bzhin du srung bar byed pa gang yin pa de la yang bsod nams mtshungs shing khyad par med pa skye bar rig par bya'o //üîΩde la sems bskyed nas drung du 'gro zhing gsol ba 'debs la gus pas smra ba la sogs pa'i las la brtson zhing tshul dang mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis mdun du 'dug pa dang / tshig gis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don de nyid rjod par byed pa de ni de'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang /
analyzed: rang gis yang dag par blangs shing de kho na bzhin du srung bar byed pa gang yin pa de la yang bsod nams mtshungs shing khyad par med pa skye bar rig par bya'o // de la sems bskyed nas drung du 'gro zhing gsol ba 'debs la gus pas smra ba la sogs pa'i las la brtson zhing tshul dang mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis mdun du 'dug pa dang / tshig gis mngon par 'dus byas pa'i don de nyid rjod par byed pa de ni de'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang /
translated: One should know that the merit of one who has taken up the precepts and observes them in accordance with the precepts is equal and not different.

original: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o //üîΩyid kyi rnam par rig byed ni de gnyis ka'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: ngag gi rnam par rig byed ces bya'o // yid kyi rnam par rig byed ni de gnyis ka'i sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Here, having generated the thought, one approaches the preceptor, requests the precepts, speaks respectfully, and so on, striving in the actions. Sitting in front with proper conduct, one expresses the meaning that has been verbally formulated. This is called the bodily intimation and verbal intimation of that person.üîΩMental intimation precedes both of those.

original: rang gis yang dag par len pa la ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed 'ba' zhig kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gis yang dag par len pa la ni yid kyi rnam par rig byed 'ba' zhig kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: In the case of taking up the precepts oneself, only mental intimation occurs.

original: de la sdom pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa spong pa'i sems pa spong ba de dbang byed pa'i dbang po lnga dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa ma yin pa las bzlog pa spong pa'i sems pa spong ba de dbang byed pa'i dbang po lnga dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of non-restraint is the intention to abandon, and those who possess the five faculties of faith, etc., which are the dominant condition for that abandonment, are called ‚Äúthose who possess restraint.‚Äù

original: sdom pa yang dag par blang ba de yang rnam pa brgyar gtogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par blang ba de yang rnam pa brgyar gtogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: That restraint which is undertaken is to be understood as belonging to one hundred types.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spong ba la brten te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spong ba la brten te /
translated: It is based on the abandonment of the ten nonvirtuous karmic paths.

original: srog gcod pa'i phyogs gcig spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar gyi phyogs gcig spong ba 'di dag ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i phyogs gcig spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar gyi phyogs gcig spong ba 'di dag ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Abandoning one part of taking life up to abandoning one part of wrong view are the ten types.

original: @30a * // srog gcod pa phal cher spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar phal cher spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: @30a * // srog gcod pa phal cher spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar phal cher spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Abandoning most of taking life up to abandoning most of wrong view are another ten types.

original: srog gcod pa thams cad spong ba las log par lta ba'i bar thams cad spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa thams cad spong ba las log par lta ba'i bar thams cad spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Abandoning all of taking life up to abandoning all of wrong view are another ten types.

original: dus yun thung ngu nyin mtshan nam zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: dus yun thung ngu nyin mtshan nam zla ba phyed dam /
translated: For a short time, a day and night, a half month,

original: zla ba'am lor srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //üîΩdus yun ring po lo phan chad nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni ma yin par srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o ;
analyzed: zla ba'am lor srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o // dus yun ring po lo phan chad nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ni ma yin par srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o ;
translated: The ten aspects of the vow to abstain from killing, etc., for a month or a year, are different from the previous ones.üîΩThe ten aspects of the vow to abstain from killing, etc., for a long time, but not for life, are different from the previous ones.

original: / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar sbong  ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //üîΩbdag nyid srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar sbong  ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o // bdag nyid srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the vow to abstain from killing, etc., for life, are different from the previous ones.üîΩThe ten aspects of the vow to abstain from killing, etc., by oneself, are different from the previous ones.

original: gzhan dag de dag nyid yang dag par len du 'jug pa 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag de dag nyid yang dag par len du 'jug pa 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the vow to induce others to abstain from killing, etc., are different from the previous ones.

original: de dag gi bsngags pa rnam grangs du mar rjod par byed pa 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bsngags pa rnam grangs du mar rjod par byed pa 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the vow to praise the abstention from killing, etc., in many ways, are different from the previous ones.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba mthong na yid bde bar 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba skye ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba nas log par lta ba'i bar spong ba mthong na yid bde bar 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba skye ba 'di dag kyang gzhan rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the other are: when one sees the avoidance of taking life up to the avoidance of wrong views, one holds to mental satisfaction, and one generates joy and mental satisfaction.

original: bcu pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gcig tu bsdus nas rnam pa brgyar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcu pa rnam pa bcu po de dag gcig tu bsdus nas rnam pa brgyar 'gyur te /
translated: These ten aspects are combined into one, and there are one hundred aspects.

original: bsod nams skye ba yang de tsam kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams skye ba yang de tsam kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the generation of merit is just that much.

original: sdom pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste kun nas slong ba'i sdom pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pa dang / kun du bsrung pa'i sdom pa dang / phyir len pa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa chung du dang /
analyzed: sdom pa de yang rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste kun nas slong ba'i sdom pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pa dang / kun du bsrung pa'i sdom pa dang / phyir len pa'i sdom pa dang / sdom pa chung du dang /
translated: That restraint should be known as eightfold: restraint of motivation, restraint of possession, restraint of protection, restraint of retaking, lesser restraint,

original: sdom pa 'bring dang / sdom pa chen po dang / yongs su dag pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa 'bring dang / sdom pa chen po dang / yongs su dag pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: middling restraint, greater restraint, and completely pure restraint.

original: de la yang dag par len pa'i snga rol kho nar spong ba yang dag par blang ngo snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i kun nas slong pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dag par len pa'i snga rol kho nar spong ba yang dag par blang ngo snyam du sems mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i kun nas slong pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: The restraint of motivation is the mental formation that thinks, ‚ÄúI will take up the abandonment prior to taking up the correct view.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe spong ba yang dag par len cing yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de ni de'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe spong ba yang dag par len cing yongs su 'dzin par byed pa de ni de'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: The restraint of taking up is the taking up and holding of the abandonment.

original: de de phyin chad spong ba'i sems pa dbang po lngas yongs su zin pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de de phyin chad spong ba'i sems pa dbang po lngas yongs su zin pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: After that, the five faculties completely hold the intention to abandon.

original: rtag tu de'i sa @30b bon dang ldan pa skabs skabs su kun du spyod pa dang ldan pa dbang po ldas yongs su zin pa'i sems pa dge ba sdom pa ji ltar blangs pa kun du srung ba nyid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rtag tu de'i sa @30b bon dang ldan pa skabs skabs su kun du spyod pa dang ldan pa dbang po ldas yongs su zin pa'i sems pa dge ba sdom pa ji ltar blangs pa kun du srung ba nyid 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The virtuous intention that is always endowed with the seed of that abandonment, that is sometimes endowed with practice, and that is completely held by the five faculties arises as the protection of the vows of the restraint that is taken up.

original: des sdig pa'i grogs po dang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: des sdig pa'i grogs po dang phrad pa'am /
translated: Through that, one encounters a virtuous friend.

original: nyon mongs pa mang bas sdig pa kun du spyod pa la 'dun pa byung ngo cog la 'dzem la bdag 'gal bar gyur cing ngan song du 'gro bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas sel bar byed pa de ni de'i kun du srung ba'i sdom pa yin
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang bas sdig pa kun du spyod pa la 'dun pa byung ngo cog la 'dzem la bdag 'gal bar gyur cing ngan song du 'gro bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas sel bar byed pa de ni de'i kun du srung ba'i sdom pa yin
translated: The restraint of abandoning is the avoidance of all occasions of intent to engage in evil deeds due to the presence of many afflictions, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is not right that I should be in conflict with myself and go to the lower realms.‚Äù

original: no // gal te brgya la brjed ngas pas sdig pa kun du spyod pas na myur ba myur ba kho nar dan pa nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: no // gal te brgya la brjed ngas pas sdig pa kun du spyod pas na myur ba myur ba kho nar dan pa nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: If one engages in evil deeds due to forgetfulness, one should quickly apply mindfulness and

original: nyes pa la nyes par 'chags shing mya ngan byas sel bar byed la /
analyzed: nyes pa la nyes par 'chags shing mya ngan byas sel bar byed la /
translated: confess the fault as a fault, and remove it with regret.

original: phyin chad kyang sdom par byed pa ni de'i phyir len pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin chad kyang sdom par byed pa ni de'i phyir len pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: The restraint of taking is the restraint of not engaging in evil deeds again in the future.

original: gal te las kyi lam gyi phyogs gcig pa dang / dus yun thung ngur spong ba dang / bdag nyid spong bar mi byed la /
analyzed: gal te las kyi lam gyi phyogs gcig pa dang / dus yun thung ngur spong ba dang / bdag nyid spong bar mi byed la /
translated: If one does not abandon a part of the path of action, or if one abandons it for a short time, or if one does not abandon it oneself,

original: gzhan ni de yang dag par len du mi 'jug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa yang rnam grangs du mar mi brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar mi 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba mi mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de yang dag par len du mi 'jug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa yang rnam grangs du mar mi brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar mi 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba mi mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa chung ngu yin no //
translated: The other is the weak vow, when one does not cause others to take it, does not praise it in many ways, and does not rejoice when seeing others who are in conformity with it.

original: gal te phal che ba dang / dus yun ring du spong zhing ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma yin pa dang / bdag nyid kyang sdom par byed pa dang / gzhan yang yang dag par len du 'jug la /
analyzed: gal te phal che ba dang / dus yun ring du spong zhing ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma yin pa dang / bdag nyid kyang sdom par byed pa dang / gzhan yang yang dag par len du 'jug la /
translated: The other is the middling vow, when one abandons for the most part, for a long time, but not as long as life lasts, and when one causes oneself to be bound by the vow, and also causes others to take it,

original: spong ba de'i bsngags pa ni rnam grangs du mar mi brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar mi 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba mi mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa 'bring yin no //
analyzed: spong ba de'i bsngags pa ni rnam grangs du mar mi brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar mi 'dzin cing dga' ba dang yid bde ba mi mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa 'bring yin no //
translated: but does not praise the abandonment in many ways, and does not rejoice when seeing others who are in conformity with it.üîΩThe other is the great vow, when one abandons completely, for a long time, as long as life lasts, and causes others to take it, and rejoices when seeing others who are in conformity with it.

original: gal te thams cad dang dus thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyang spong ba dang / gzhan yang yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa yang rnam grangs du mar brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar 'dzin cing dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gal te thams cad dang dus thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyang spong ba dang / gzhan yang yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / de'i bsngags pa yang rnam grangs du mar brjod pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid bde bar 'dzin cing dga' ba dang /
translated: If one abandons everything, at all times, and also oneself, and causes others to take up the precepts, and also praises them in many ways, and when seeing those who are similar to oneself in the precepts, one is pleased and delighted,

original: yid bde ba mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba mang ba de ni de'i sdom pa chen po yin no //
translated: and has much mental satisfaction, that is the great restraint.

original: gal te sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa skyon med pa de nyid la brten nas 'gyod pa med pa'i rgyus bsam gtan dang po'i bar la snyoms par 'jug cing tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sa bon zhig nas kyis nyams par byed pas nyams par byed @31a * //
analyzed: gal te sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa skyon med pa de nyid la brten nas 'gyod pa med pa'i rgyus bsam gtan dang po'i bar la snyoms par 'jug cing tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sa bon zhig nas kyis nyams par byed pas nyams par byed @31a * //
translated: If, based on that very faultless undertaking of restraint, one enters into the first meditative concentration without regret, and destroys the seed of immorality by means of cultivation,

original: pa de ni de'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yin te /
analyzed: pa de ni de'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yin te /
translated: that is the meditative concentration restraint.

original: bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po ji lta ba de bzhin du gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with the first meditative concentration, so it should be understood for the second, third, and fourth meditative concentrations.

original: bye brag ni 'di yod de de tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sa bon thag ring du bya ba de gnyen pos yongs su zin pa'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyis ches shin tu nyams par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag ni 'di yod de de tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sa bon thag ring du bya ba de gnyen pos yongs su zin pa'i zhi gnas kyi lam gyis ches shin tu nyams par byed pa ste /
translated: The difference is that this is the path of serenity that is fully embraced by its antidote, which completely destroys the seed of immorality.

original: de ni yongs su dag pa dang pos de'i sdom pa yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su dag pa dang pos de'i sdom pa yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the purity of the vow of morality through the first purity.

original: gal te tshul khrims kyi sdom pa skyon med pa de nyid dang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa de la yang brten nas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims kyi sdom pa skyon med pa de nyid dang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa de la yang brten nas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par byed cing /
translated: If, based on that very faultless vow of morality and that vow of concentration, one realizes the truths

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yang thob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de'i tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sa bon thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yang thob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de'i tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sa bon thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
translated: and attains the fruit of non-returner, at that time all the seeds of immorality are completely destroyed.

original: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas 'bras bu dang po thob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sa bon yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas 'bras bu dang po thob par byed pa de'i tshe na ni de'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sa bon yang dag par bcom pa yin no //
translated: If he attains the first fruit in dependence on the stage of the unshakable ones, then at that time he has completely destroyed the seed of immorality that would lead to the lower realms.

original: de dag ni de'i 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims yin te /
translated: That is the morality pleasing to the noble ones.

original: yongs su dag pa gnyis pa 'dis de'i sdom pa rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa gnyis pa 'dis de'i sdom pa rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya ste //
translated: By this second purity, his vow is known to be pure.

original: de nyid de'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called his uncontaminated vow.

original: de'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa de yang dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa la ni gnyen po dang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa de yang dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa la ni gnyen po dang rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur bar zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, that uncontaminated vow of his becomes distinguished by the distinction of its antidote and its purity when he attains the state of an arhat.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i khyad par gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba'i khyad par gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not distinguished by the distinction of the abandonment of its opposing factors.

original: de la sdom pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
analyzed: de la sdom pa rnam pa brgyad po de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas /
translated: All of those eight types of vows are included in one vow.

original: sdom pa rnam ba gsum rnam par gzhag ste /üîΩyang dag par len pa'i sdom pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa'i sdom pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa rnam ba gsum rnam par gzhag ste / yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa dang / kun du 'dzin pa'i sdom pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: There are three kinds of morality:üîΩthe morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring good, and the morality of acting for the benefit of beings.üîΩThe first two moralities are the morality of restraint.üîΩThe morality of restraint is twofold: the morality of restraint through accepting vows, and the morality of restraint through guarding.

original: de la sdom pa dang po gnyis ni yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sdom pa dang po gnyis ni yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: The morality of restraint through accepting vows is the morality of the neophyte, and the morality of restraint through guarding is the morality of the experienced.üîΩThe morality of acquiring good and the morality of acting for the benefit of beings are the morality of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe morality of restraint is threefold:üîΩthe morality of restraint through accepting vows, the morality of restraint through guarding, and the morality of restraint through patience.üîΩThe morality of acquiring good is threefold:

original: kun du bsrung ba'i sdom pa dang phyir len pa'i sdom pa de gnyis ni kun du 'dzin pa'i sdom pa yin no //üîΩsdom pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams ni gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i sdom pa dang phyir len pa'i sdom pa de gnyis ni kun du 'dzin pa'i sdom pa yin no // sdom pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams ni gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the morality of acquiring good through the perfections, the morality of acquiring good through the aids to awakening, and the morality of acquiring good through the three knowledges.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is threefold:üîΩthe morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the four social practices, the morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the four means of gathering disciples, and the morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the ten universal virtues.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the morality of the neophyte, the morality of restraint through guarding is the morality of the experienced, and the morality of restraint through patience is the morality of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe morality of acquiring good through the perfections is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.

original: yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pas ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag @31b pa med pa'i sdom pa'i sdom pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par len pa'i sdom pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i sdom pas ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag @31b pa med pa'i sdom pa'i sdom pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The morality of acquiring good through the aids to awakening is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdom pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sdom pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: The morality of acquiring good through the three knowledges is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the four social practices is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the four means of gathering disciples is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings through the ten universal virtues is the morality of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa dang / bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa de dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are the vows of a fully ordained monk, the vows of a male or female layperson, and the vows of one day fasting established?

original: rgyu gsum gyis te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis te /
translated: They are established by three causes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba ni gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par spyod pa dang / 'dod pa las dben par spyod pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba ni gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par spyod pa dang / 'dod pa las dben par spyod pa dag kyang yod /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said that there are those who practice in isolation from negative conduct, but not in isolation from desire.

original: gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par spyod la /
analyzed: gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par spyod la /
translated: There are those who practice in isolation from negative conduct,

original: 'dod pa las dben par mi spyod pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben par mi spyod pa dag kyang yod /
translated: but not in isolation from desire.

original: gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par yang mi spyod la 'dod pa las dben par mi spyod pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang dag nyes par spyod pa las dben par yang mi spyod la 'dod pa las dben par mi spyod pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are those who do not practice in isolation from negative conduct, nor in isolation from desire.üîΩThe first type of discipline is for those who practice in isolation from negative conduct, but not in isolation from desire.üîΩThe second type of discipline is for those who practice in isolation from negative conduct, but not in isolation from desire.üîΩThe third type of discipline is for those who do not practice in isolation from negative conduct, nor in isolation from desire.

original: de la 'dul ba'i rnam pa dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas ni dge slong gi sdom pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la 'dul ba'i rnam pa dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas ni dge slong gi sdom pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The vows of a fully ordained monk are established for the first type of discipline.

original: 'dul ba'i rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ni dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ni dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The vows of a male or female layperson are established for the second type of discipline.

analyzed: rgya cher bsgoms pas ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur la /

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni slob pa yang snyoms par mi 'jug la mi slob pa yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni slob pa yang snyoms par mi 'jug la mi slob pa yang mi 'jug go //
translated: The learner does not enter the attainment of non-perception and the non-learner also does not enter it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la ni shes rab kyi spyod pa med la de'i gong na ches zhi ba'i gnas pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la ni shes rab kyi spyod pa med la de'i gong na ches zhi ba'i gnas pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no activity of wisdom in that attainment and because there is a state of peace higher than it.

original: skye ba de ni dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob par bya ba las slu ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: skye ba de ni dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob par bya ba las slu ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: That birth is a basis for deception in obtaining wholesome dharmas that have not been obtained.

original: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' gang zhe na /
translated: What is space?

original: gzugs med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni nam mkha' yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni nam mkha' yin te /
translated: Space is distinguished by mere non-existence of form.

original: 'di ltar gang la gzugs kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa de la nam mkha'i 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de yang brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'i rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la gzugs kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa de la nam mkha'i 'du shes 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir de yang brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'i rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the notion of space arises in regard to that which is not observed as having the aspect of form, therefore, it should be understood that it also exists as a designation, but not as a substance.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-analytical cessation?

original: de las gzhan pa skye ba'i rkyen mngon du gyur pa na de las gzhan pa skye bas /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa skye ba'i rkyen mngon du gyur pa na de las gzhan pa skye bas /
translated: When the conditions for the arising of something else become manifest, something else arises.

original: de las gzhan pa mi skye zhing nye bar zhi ba'i 'gog pa tsam ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mi skye zhing nye bar zhi ba'i 'gog pa tsam ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mere cessation that is the pacification of that which is not arising due to the absence of other conditions is called non-analytical cessation.

original: gang de'i tshe na ma skyes shing skye ba'i dus las thal ba de ni de'i tshe nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: gang de'i tshe na ma skyes shing skye ba'i dus las thal ba de ni de'i tshe nam yang skye bar mi 'gyur bas ;
translated: That which does not arise at that time and is excluded from the time of arising will never arise at that time.

original: de'i phyir de yang brtags pa'i yod pa yin gyi rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang brtags pa'i yod pa yin gyi rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it also exists as a designation, but not as a substance.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzhan cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzhan cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Its own characteristic is not observed as anything else at all.

original: de yang chos kyi rnam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir dus gzhan gyi tshe rkyen dang phrad na 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma @37b yin pa'i 'gog pa de ni gtan du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi rnam pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir dus gzhan gyi tshe rkyen dang phrad na 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma @37b yin pa'i 'gog pa de ni gtan du ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not free from the aspect of the Dharma, it will occur again when it encounters conditions at another time. Therefore, that non-analytical cessation is not permanent.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong ba de sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan du skye ba dang / 'du shes med pa pa'i sems can du skye ba dang / bud med dang / za ma dang /
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong ba de sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan du skye ba dang / 'du shes med pa pa'i sems can du skye ba dang / bud med dang / za ma dang /
translated: The four learners who see the truths obtain non-analytical cessation that is not permanent, such as birth from eggs, birth from heat and moisture, birth in Uttarakuru, birth as a being without discernment, birth as a woman, a eunuch,

original: ma ning dang / mtshan med dang / mtshan gnyis par skye ba dang / yang 'byung ba'i srid pa la sred cing smon pa dag so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa de ni gtan du ba yin par rig par bya'o //
