analyzed: ma ning dang / mtshan med dang / mtshan gnyis par skye ba dang / yang 'byung ba'i srid pa la sred cing smon pa dag so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa de ni gtan du ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: a neuter, one without sexual organs, or one with two sexual organs, and craving and aspiration for the existence of rebirth.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong ba ni nam yang yang 'byung ba'i srid pa la mngon par 'dod cing smon pa'i kun nas dkris pas yang 'byung ba'i srid pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong ba ni nam yang yang 'byung ba'i srid pa la mngon par 'dod cing smon pa'i kun nas dkris pas yang 'byung ba'i srid pa mngon par sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: The four learners who see the truths never again establish existence through the fetter of desire and aspiration for existence.

original: srid pa'i sa bon lhag ma ma lus par yang dag par ma bcom pa kho na tsam du zad do //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon lhag ma ma lus par yang dag par ma bcom pa kho na tsam du zad do //
translated: They merely do not completely destroy the seed of existence.

original: ci'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems dang mi ldan pa rnams zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called ‚Äúthose without mind‚Äù?

original: de dag ni de dag la ming du btags pas tha snyad 'dogs par zad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag ni de dag la ming du btags pas tha snyad 'dogs par zad pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are designated by that name because they are merely conventionally designated.üîΩThey are also called ‚Äúthose without form‚Äù and ‚Äúthose without both‚Äù in the same way.

original: de dag kyang gzugs can rnams la yang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa rnams la yang gnyi ga ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs can rnams la yang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa rnams la yang gnyi ga ma yin par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: The wise should understand this extensively.

original: mkhas pa drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: There are six types of wise ones:

original: phung po la mkhas pa nas dbang po la mkhas pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa'i mkhas pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa nas dbang po la mkhas pa'i bar du gang gsungs pa'i mkhas pa de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the expertise in the aggregates, etc. that is taught in the sutras?

original: sdom ni / ngo bo nyid dang don rnams dbye //
analyzed: sdom ni / ngo bo nyid dang don rnams dbye //
translated: The summary: Nature, objects, order,

original: go rims dang ni bsdu dang brten //
analyzed: go rims dang ni bsdu dang brten //
translated: inclusion, support,

original: de la gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is form?

original: de ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as elevenfold:

original: mig la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi skye mched bcu dang / chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: the ten bases from eye to tangibility, and the form included in the sense base of ideas.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: In brief, it is the primary and secondary characteristics.

original: thams cad kyang gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: All are characterized by resistance.

original: tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is feeling?

original: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ba ste /
translated: It should be seen as sixfold:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from contact through the coming together of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are three types of contact and two types of contact.üîΩContact is of three types: contact that is painful, contact that is pleasant, and contact that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: Contact is of two types: contact that is bodily and contact that is mental.

original: de la gzugs can la brten pa ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs can la brten pa ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Bodily contact is based on the material sense faculties.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa la brten pa ni sems kyi'o //üîΩde ci'i @38a * //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa la brten pa ni sems kyi'o // de ci'i @38a * //
translated: Mental contact is based on the mental faculty.

original: phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gal te dbang po lnga po dag ni gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te dbang po lnga po dag ni gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five sense faculties are material.

original: gal te dbang po lnga po dag gzugs can yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can rnams la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de lus kyi yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po lnga po dag gzugs can yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa dbang po gzugs can rnams la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de lus kyi yin par gyur na /
translated: If the feeling that is based on the material sense faculties, such as the eyes, is bodily feeling because the five sense faculties are material,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag lus kyi mtshan nyid kho na yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po de dag lus kyi mtshan nyid kho na yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then why are the material sense faculties, such as the eyes, not exclusively characteristics of the body?

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar de dag ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar de dag ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We reply: Because their characteristics are different.üîΩThe sense faculties are different from the body because their characteristics are different.

original: gal te mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir yin na mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir yin na mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir lus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pas /
translated: If you say that it is because their characteristics are different, then since the characteristics of the body are different, the body is not the characteristics of the body.üîΩ

original: des na de la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang rgyu de gnyis kyis na lus kyi ma yin par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: des na de la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang rgyu de gnyis kyis na lus kyi ma yin par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If you say that feeling is not bodily because it has a different characteristic, then since it does not have the characteristic of body, how could the feeling that is based on it be bodily?

original: smras pa / de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams ni lus las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de la nye bar gdags pa la nyes pa med do //üîΩgal te tha mi dad pas nyes pa med na de lta na yid kyang lus las tha mi dad par 'byung bas des na yid la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang lus kyi yin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba kho nar 'gyur
analyzed: smras pa / de las gzhan pa'i dbang po gzugs can rnams ni lus las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de la nye bar gdags pa la nyes pa med do // gal te tha mi dad pas nyes pa med na de lta na yid kyang lus las tha mi dad par 'byung bas des na yid la brten pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang lus kyi yin par 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus kyi tshor ba kho nar 'gyur
translated: We reply: There is no fault in designating the other physical faculties as bodily because they are not distinct from the body.

original: gyi sems kyi ni ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gyi sems kyi ni ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na smras pa /
translated: If you say there is no fault because they are not distinct, then since the mental faculty also arises as not distinct from the body, any feeling that is based on the mental faculty would also be bodily. Therefore feeling would be only bodily and not mental.

original: lus ni dbang po gzugs can rnams las gtan tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lus ni dbang po gzugs can rnams las gtan tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: We reply: The body is not absolutely distinct from the physical faculties.

original: yid ni de lta ma yin pas nyes pa med de /
analyzed: yid ni de lta ma yin pas nyes pa med de /
translated: But the mental faculty is not like that, so there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can rnams la lus las tha dad pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi kho na zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can rnams la lus las tha dad pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir dbang po lnga dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni lus kyi kho na zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, the mental consciousness that is different from the body arises in sentient beings who are born in the formless realm. Therefore, feeling that is associated with the five sense faculties is called bodily feeling,

original: yid kyi 'ba' zhig sems kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'ba' zhig sems kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: and feeling that is associated with the mental faculty alone is called mental feeling.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: Thus, in brief, feeling is

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi yin la thams cad kyang myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi yin la thams cad kyang myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: bodily and mental, and all of it has the characteristic of experience.

original: 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is ideation?

original: de yang snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de yang snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug go //
translated: It is also of six types, as before.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: It is also like this:üîΩIdeation with signs, ideation without signs,üîΩideation of limited extent, ideation of infinite extent,

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dang / chung ngu'i 'du shes dang / chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / tshad med pa'i 'du shes dang / ci yang med pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes dang / chung ngu'i 'du shes dang / chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes dang / tshad med pa'i 'du shes dang / ci yang med pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: ideation of the sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation, and ideation of the cessation of ideation and feeling.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa'i dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na 'jig rten pa'i dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: In brief, they are mundane and supramundane.

original: de @38b la chung ngu'i 'du shes ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: de @38b la chung ngu'i 'du shes ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i'o //
translated: The notion of limited extent pertains to the realm of desire.

original: chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes ni gzugs na spyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa'i 'du shes ni gzugs na spyod pa'i'o //
translated: The notion of extensive extent pertains to the realm of form.

original: tshad med pa'i 'du shes ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na spyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i 'du shes ni nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na spyod pa'i'o //
translated: The notion of infinite extent pertains to the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched na spyod pa'i ste /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched na spyod pa'i ste /
translated: The notion of no-form pertains to the sphere of nothingness.

original: de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes yin no //
translated: All of these are notions with signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i thams cad de thams cad kyang kun du shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'du shes ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'du shes gang yin pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i thams cad de thams cad kyang kun du shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The notion of signlessness pertains to the peak of cyclic existence and to all supramundane states of the learner and the accomplished one.

original: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the formative forces?

original: de dag kyang snga ma kho na bzhin du rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de dag kyang snga ma kho na bzhin du rnam pa drug go //
translated: They are also of six kinds, as before.

original: de yang 'di lta ste yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par bya ba dang / de dang bral bar bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kun du blang bar bya ba dang / sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste yul dang mthun par byed pa dang / de dang phrad par bya ba dang / de dang bral bar bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kun du blang bar bya ba dang / sems kyis dbang bsgyur bar bya ba'i phyir sems mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be seen as fivefold: in order to make the mind conform to the object, in order to meet with or avoid the object, in order to purify the defilements, in order to take up action, and in order to subjugate the mind.

original: 'du byed rnams ni mdor bsdu na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag ste thams cad kyang mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni mdor bsdu na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag ste thams cad kyang mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: In brief, formations are wholesome, unwholesome, or non-defined. All of them have the characteristic of formation.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is consciousness?

original: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste ;
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste ;
translated: It is to be seen as sixfold:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te /
translated: eye-consciousness,

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of the nature of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is to be seen as threefold:

original: myong ba'i dbye ba dang dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i dbye ba dang dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification of experience, the classification of the apprehension of signs in the objective realm, and the classification of states.

original: de la myong ba'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la myong ba'i dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The classification of experience is threefold.

original: dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: The classification of the apprehension of signs in the objective realm is sixfold.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The classification of states is threefold.

original: dbye ba de dag gcig tu bsdus na rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbye ba de dag gcig tu bsdus na rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: When these classifications are combined, there are eighteen kinds of consciousness.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the aggregates.

original: de la phung po'i don ni gang ci'i phyir na phung po rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan ce na /üîΩgzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la phung po'i don ni gang ci'i phyir na phung po rnam par gzhag pa yongs su bstan ce na / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: What is the meaning of aggregate? Why are the aggregates taught?

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba nas thag ring ba dang / nye ba'i bar dang / @39a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba nas thag ring ba dang / nye ba'i bar dang / @39a * //
translated: Any kind of form, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or excellent, far or near.

original: gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as with form, so it is with feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam pa thams cad du bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam pa thams cad du bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúcollection,‚Äù because the collection of all of them is included in the aggregates.

original: yang phung po de dag ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po yin pa'i phyir 'du byed tsam ste /
analyzed: yang phung po de dag ni bdag nyid sna tshogs mang po yin pa'i phyir 'du byed tsam ste /
translated: Moreover, the aggregates are mere conditioning forces, because they are many and various in nature.

original: de las don gzhan pa'i bdag med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las don gzhan pa'i bdag med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir phung po rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The aggregates should be understood as being established in order to demonstrate that there is no self that is separate from them.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the form aggregate?

original: de ni rnam par drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of six types:

original: dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa las dben pa dang mi dben pa dang / 'du shes kyi spyod yul dang mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa las dben pa dang mi dben pa dang / 'du shes kyi spyod yul dang mtha'o //
translated: as substance, as characteristic, as the basis and non-basis of consciousness, as the separation and non-separation of consciousness, and as the domain and limit of perception.

original: de la gzugs kyi dngos po ni gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi dngos po ni gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: As substance: whatever is form is a substance.

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o ;
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o ;
translated: All of these are derived from the four great elements and are composed of the four great elements.

original: / de la gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na dang ba dang / dang ba'i gzung ba dang / yid kyi gzung ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: / de la gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdor bsdu na dang ba dang / dang ba'i gzung ba dang / yid kyi gzung ba'i gzugs so //
translated: The specific characteristic of form is, in brief, clarity, the clarity of form, and the form that is the object of mind.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is the characteristic of being suitable as form.üîΩThe form that is the basis of consciousness and that which is not the basis of consciousness is the form that is grasped.üîΩThat which is grasped by consciousness is called the basis of consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang mi gnas pa ni zin pa'i gzugs gang yin bde ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang mi gnas pa ni zin pa'i gzugs gang yin bde ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is grasped by consciousness is the form that is grasped by consciousness.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rnams skye ba'i don du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa dang 'dres pa grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i don gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa dang / tshor ba rnams skye ba'i don du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma zin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma zin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is grasped by mind is the form that is the object of mind.üîΩThat which is

original: de la rnam par shes pa las dben pa dang mi dben pa ni rnam par shes pa las mi dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ste /üîΩrnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par don la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa las dben pa dang mi dben pa ni rnam par shes pa las mi dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ste / rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par don la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The form that is not separate from consciousness is called similar to consciousness because it engages its object in a manner similar to consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste rang gi rgyud dang mtshungs par rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las dben pa'i gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ste rang gi rgyud dang mtshungs par rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The form that is separate from consciousness is called similar to that because it is similar to the continuum of consciousness.

original: de la 'du shes kyi spyod yul ni 'du shes gsum po 'di dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'du shes kyi spyod yul ni 'du shes gsum po 'di dag ni gzugs la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The domain of ideation refers to the three types of ideation that have form as their object.

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes dang / thogs pa'i 'du shes dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The ideation of form, the ideation of obstruction, and the ideation of variety.

original: gzugs kyang mtshan nyid @39b gsum ste snang ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul gnod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyas par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs kyang mtshan nyid @39b gsum ste snang ba dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yul gnod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyas par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Form also has three characteristics: the characteristic of appearance, the characteristic of harm to the object, and the characteristic of extensive abiding.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du 'du shes gsum po de dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du 'du shes gsum po de dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These three types of perception should be understood as the objects of these three types of perception, respectively.

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzin par byed pa ni gzugs kyi 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzin par byed pa ni gzugs kyi 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of form is the perception of the color of form, such as blue, etc.

original: 'gro ba thogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni thogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba thogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni thogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: The perception of obstruction is the perception of the obstruction of the path of an approaching object.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khang khyim dang / zhing la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes te /
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khang khyim dang / zhing la sogs par nye bar 'dogs pa 'dzin par byed pa ni sna tshogs kyi 'du shes te /
translated: The perception of variety is the perception of the designation of a woman, a man, a house, a field, etc.

original: de ni 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'du shes kyi spyod yul gyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the objects of perception.

original: de la gzugs kyi mtha' ni mdor bsdu na gzugs rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi mtha' ni mdor bsdu na gzugs rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The limit of form is, in brief, twofold:

original: khams 'og ma dang khams bar mar gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: khams 'og ma dang khams bar mar gtogs pa ste /
translated: form belonging to the lower realm and form belonging to the intermediate realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: The form belonging to the lower realm is the form belonging to the realm of desire.üîΩThe form belonging to the intermediate realm is the form belonging to the realm of form.

original: de la gzugs med pa rnams na ni las kyi dbang gis grub pa nyid la brten nas gzugs med pa zhes bya bar zad de /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa rnams na ni las kyi dbang gis grub pa nyid la brten nas gzugs med pa zhes bya bar zad de /
translated: In the formless realm, form is established by the power of karma, and it is called formless only in dependence on that.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang la brten nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang la brten nas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not in dependence on the power of meditative attainment.

original: 'di ltar de la snyoms par 'jug pas mngon par 'du bya ba mngon du gyur pa las thams cad na gzugs kyi rnam pa la dbang ba dmigs pa'i phyir te de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs cha phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la snyoms par 'jug pas mngon par 'du bya ba mngon du gyur pa las thams cad na gzugs kyi rnam pa la dbang ba dmigs pa'i phyir te de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs cha phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because in that realm, the meditative attainment of the formless realm is manifest karma, and in all realms, the subtle aspect of form is observed by the power of meditative attainment.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of feeling?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as fivefold:

original: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba dang nye bar brtags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba dang nye bar brtags pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: as substance, as characteristic, as arising, as designation, and as liberation.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i dngos po ni myong ba nyid dang / myong ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i dngos po ni myong ba nyid dang / myong ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The substance of the aggregate of feeling is the experience of the object and the dharmas that are favorable to the experience of the object.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The specific characteristics of feeling are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i phung po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The general characteristic of the aggregate of feeling is that pleasant feeling is suffering due to the suffering of change, unpleasant feeling is suffering due to the suffering of suffering, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling is suffering due to the suffering of conditioned states.üîΩWith reference to that, the Buddha said:

original: gang ci tshor ba yang rung ste de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o //üîΩ@40a * // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang ci tshor ba yang rung ste de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o // @40a * // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering here.

original: de la rab tu skye ba ni reg pa bcu drug las tshor ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu skye ba ni reg pa bcu drug las tshor ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The arising of feeling is the arising of feelings from the sixteen contacts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
translated: The contact of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, the contact of obstruction, the contact of designation, the contact concordant with the feeling of pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang ; khong khro ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang ; khong khro ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang /
translated: the contact concordant with the feeling of pain, the contact concordant with the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, the contact of attachment, the contact of aversion,

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las so //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las so //
translated: the contact of discernment, the contact of non-discernment, and the contact that is neither discernment nor non-discernment.

original: de la yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid la brten nas ni 'dus te reg pa drug po rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid la brten nas ni 'dus te reg pa drug po rnams dang / thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The sixfold contact is established on the basis of the grasping of the object, and the contact with obstruction is also established on the basis of the grasping of the object.

original: yul la rnam par rtog pa nyid la brten nas ni tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rtog pa nyid la brten nas ni tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa gcig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The contact with designation is established as one on the basis of the discrimination of the object.

original: yul myong bar byed pa nyid la brten nas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa gsum rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yul myong bar byed pa nyid la brten nas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i 'dus te reg pa gsum rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The three kinds of contact that are favorable to the experience of pleasure, etc., are established on the basis of the experience of the object.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid la brten nas ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / rig pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid la brten nas ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa rnams dang / rig pa dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The contact that is accompanied by passion, the contact that is accompanied by animosity, the contact that is accompanied by ignorance, the contact that is accompanied by knowledge, and the contact that is accompanied by neither knowledge nor ignorance should be understood as established on the basis of the defilement and the purification.

original: de ni tshor ba rnams kyi rab tu skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba'i rab tu dge ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba rnams kyi rab tu skye ba'i rab tu dbye ba'i rab tu dge ba yin no //
translated: This is the most excellent of the distinctions of the arising of feelings.üîΩA s≈´tra says,

original: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig dben par gshegs te /
analyzed: mdo las de nas bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig dben par gshegs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThen the Bhagavat went alone to a secluded place and

original: nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa na /
translated: stayed in meditative seclusion.

original: thugs la thugs kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: thugs la thugs kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu byung ste /
translated: He thought this with his mind:

original: tshor ba ni gang tshor ba kun 'byung ba ni gang tshor ba 'gog pa ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gang tshor ba kun 'byung ba ni gang tshor ba 'gog pa ni gang /
translated: ‚ÄòWhat is feeling? What is the origin of feeling? What is the cessation of feeling?

original: tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
translated: What is the path that leads to the origin of feeling?

original: tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
translated: What is the path that leads to the cessation of feeling?

original: tshor ba ro myang ba ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba ro myang ba ni gang /
translated: What is the enjoyment of feeling?

original: nyes dmigs ni gang /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni gang /
translated: What is the danger?üîΩWhat is the escape?‚Äô

original: nges par 'byung ba ni gang yin snyam nas de 'di snyam du @40b dgongs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni gang yin snyam nas de 'di snyam du @40b dgongs te /
translated: He thought this:

original: tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: ‚ÄòThere are three feelings:

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: reg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The origin of feeling is the origin of contact.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag go //
translated: When contact ceases, feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags shing gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags shing gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The path to the origination of feeling is the delight in feeling, the expression of feeling, the attachment to feeling, and the abiding in the attachment to feeling.

original: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / mngon par mi brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / mngon par mi brjod pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags shing mi gnas pa gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The path to the cessation of feeling is the non-delight in feeling, the non-expression of feeling, the non-attachment to feeling, and the non-abiding in the attachment to feeling.

original: tshor ba la brten te /
analyzed: tshor ba la brten te /
translated: In dependence on feeling,

original: bde ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba skye ba dang / yid bde ba skye ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i ro myang ba yin no //
translated: the arising of pleasure and the arising of mental satisfaction is the enjoyment of feeling.

original: tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos can gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba'i nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: The impermanence of feeling, the suffering of feeling, and the change of feeling is the danger in feeling.

original: tshor ba la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de la nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis rnam par bshad de
analyzed: tshor ba la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba gang yin pa 'di ni tshor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de la nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis rnam par bshad de
translated: This is explained by the words:

original: / de la nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba rnam pa brgyad po dag la tshor ba nye bar brtag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad las byung la 'di lta ste tshor ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: / de la nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni tshor ba rnam pa brgyad po dag la tshor ba nye bar brtag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad las byung la 'di lta ste tshor ba rnams ni du /
translated: The analysis of investigation is the investigation of the eight types of feeling that arise from all Buddhas, namely:üîΩWhat are feelings?

original: tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung ba ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung ba ni gang /
translated: What is the origin of feelings?

original: tshor ba rnams kyi 'gog pa ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi 'gog pa ni gang /
translated: What is the cessation of feelings?

original: tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
translated: What is the path that leads to the origin of feelings?

original: tshor ba rnams 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni gang /
translated: What is the path that leads to the cessation of feelings?

original: tshor ba rnams kyi ro myang ba ni gang /
analyzed: tshor ba rnams kyi ro myang ba ni gang /
translated: What is the enjoyment of feelings?

original: nyes dmigs ni gang /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni gang /
translated: What is the danger?

original: nges par 'byung ba ni gang zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ni gang zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: What is the escape?üîΩWhen one examines in this way, one understands the three feelings as they truly are.

original: de la de ltar nyes bar rtog pa na yang dag par rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin no //üîΩreg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par ji skad mdo las gsungs pa bzhin rnam par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar nyes bar rtog pa na yang dag par rtogs pa'i tshor ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin no // reg pa kun 'byung bas tshor ba kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par ji skad mdo las gsungs pa bzhin rnam par dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The origin of feelings is the origin of contact.üîΩThe cessation of feelings is the cessation of contact.üîΩThe practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is precisely the practice that leads to the cessation of contact.

original: tshor ba nye bar brtag pa rnam pa brgyad po de @41a * //
analyzed: tshor ba nye bar brtag pa rnam pa brgyad po de @41a * //
translated: The eight kinds of examination of feelings

original: dag kyang rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de 'gog par nye bar brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de 'gog pa la nye bar brtag pa dang /
analyzed: dag kyang rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de 'gog par nye bar brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de 'gog pa la nye bar brtag pa dang /
translated: are the examination of their intrinsic natures, the examination of the causes that produce them in this life, the examination of their cessation, the examination of the causes that produce them in future lives, the examination of their cessation, the examination of their benefits, the examination of their drawbacks, and the examination of the escape from them.

original: de gnyi ga la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de gnyi ga la 'byung ba 'gog pa nye bar brtag pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar brtag pa yongs su bstan par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la 'byung ba'i rgyu nye bar brtag pa dang / de gnyi ga la 'byung ba 'gog pa nye bar brtag pa dang / rnam par byang ba nye bar brtag pa yongs su bstan par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The first is the investigation of the cause of their occurrence. The second is the investigation of the cessation of their occurrence. The third is the investigation of purification.

original: de ni mdo bsdu na nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdo bsdu na nye bar brtag pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the summary of the investigation of the distinctions.

original: de la tshor ba rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The deliverance of the feelings is as follows:

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The first meditation is the deliverance from the faculty of sorrow.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second meditation is the deliverance from the faculty of pain.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'o //
translated: The third meditation is the deliverance from the faculty of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is the deliverance from the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po las nges par 'byung ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The sphere of the signless is the deliverance from the faculty of equanimity.

original: de ni tshor ba'i phung po'i nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshor ba'i phung po'i nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the aggregate of feeling in terms of its liberation.

original: de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analysis of the aggregate of perception?

original: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:

original: dngos po dang ; mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang ; mtshan nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: as substance, as characteristic, as error, as non-error, and as function.

original: de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i dngos po ni dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'du shes kyi phung po'i dngos po ni dmigs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams so //
translated: The substance of the aggregate of perception is the apprehension of the sign of the object and those things which are like its basis.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya'o//
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni snga ma bzhin du rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya'o//
translated: The own-characteristic should be regarded as sixfold, as previously.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kun du shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni kun du shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The universal characteristic is the characteristic of complete knowledge.

original: de ni mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the aggregate of perception in terms of its characteristics.üîΩAs error, it is the perception of what is impermanent as permanent, etc.

original: de la phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa mi mkhas pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa mi mkhas pa ma rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa /
translated: The classification of error is as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: The classification of errors is as follows: for the ignorant, the unwise, the uninstructed many-folk, there is the occurrence of the apprehension of signs, the apprehension of the impermanent as permanent.

original: de ni de'i 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
translated: This is the error of their perception.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi sdug pa la sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu mtshan mar 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the impermanent is apprehended as permanent, so also is the painful as pleasant, the impure as pure, and the insubstantial as substantial.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log de yang khyim pa rnams @41b la ni sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log de yang khyim pa rnams @41b la ni sems phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: This error of perception is an error of mind for the householders,

original: rab tu byung ba de dag kha cig la ni lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba de dag kha cig la ni lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: but for some of the renunciates it is an error of view.

original: de ltar na de ni phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni phyin ci log gi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of errors.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log rnams kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang dngos po bzhi po de dag la log par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log rnams kyi rnam grangs gzhan yang dngos po bzhi po de dag la log par mtshan mar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin no //
translated: The perversion of ideation is the apprehension of the four things as signs in a perverted way.

original: yul de la de ltar kun tu shes pa'i kun tu 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni sems phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: yul de la de ltar kun tu shes pa'i kun tu 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni sems phyin ci log yin no //
translated: The perversion of thought is the passion which is the complete knowledge and desire for that object in that way.

original: phyin ci log gi dngos po de nyid la de ltar kun tu shes shing de ltar lhag par chags pa'i mngon par zhen pa dang / 'dod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnams par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba phyin ci log yin no /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi dngos po de nyid la de ltar kun tu shes shing de ltar lhag par chags pa'i mngon par zhen pa dang / 'dod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnams par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni lta ba phyin ci log yin no /
translated: The perversion of view is the adherence, desire, teaching, and establishment of that object in that way, through complete knowledge and excessive attachment.

original: de la phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de la phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of the non-perverted is as follows:

original: mdzangs pa mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dmigs pa mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa la sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa la mi sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag med do zhes yang dag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa la 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mdzangs pa mkhas pa rig pa dang ldan pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dmigs pa mi rtag pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa la sdug bsngal ba dang / mi sdug pa la mi sdug pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag med do zhes yang dag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa la 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the wise, the learned, the ones who have knowledge, who correctly reflect on the impermanence of the object, on the suffering of the object, on the repulsiveness of the object, on the selflessness of the object, and who correctly apprehend the sign of the object.

original: de ni de'i 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa dang / sems phyin ci ma log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i 'du shes phyin ci ma log pa dang / sems phyin ci ma log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa yang yin te /
translated: This is their undistorted perception, undistorted thought, and undistorted view.

original: de ltar na de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of undistortion.

original: de la yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni lnga po 'di dag ni 'du shes kyi yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni lnga po 'di dag ni 'du shes kyi yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: The classification of determination is as follows: These five are the determinations of perception.

original: yul yongs su gcod pa dang / myong ba yongs su gcod pa dang / brda yongs su gcod pa dang / log par yongs su gcod pa dang / bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: yul yongs su gcod pa dang / myong ba yongs su gcod pa dang / brda yongs su gcod pa dang / log par yongs su gcod pa dang / bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: The determination of the object, the determination of experience, the determination of convention, the determination of error, and the determination of the meaning of reality.

original: de la yul la mtshan ma dang ; mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni yul yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yul la mtshan ma dang ; mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni yul yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: The determination of the object is the apprehension of the object as a sign and as a symbol.

original: yul las nges par 'byung ba'i tshor ba 'dzin pa ni myong ba yongs su gcod pa yin no //üîΩbdag gam gzhan dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: yul las nges par 'byung ba'i tshor ba 'dzin pa ni myong ba yongs su gcod pa yin no // bdag gam gzhan dag la ming ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: The determination of experience is the apprehension of feeling that arises from the object.üîΩThe determination of convention is the apprehension of the convention that refers to a self or another, such as ‚ÄúThis one is named so-and-so,üîΩof such-and-such a family,

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'dzin pa ni brda yongs su gcod pa yin no //üîΩyul la phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni log par yongs su gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'dzin pa ni brda yongs su gcod pa yin no // yul la phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni log par yongs su gcod pa yin no //
translated: of such-and-such a caste,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe determination of error is the apprehension of the object in a distorted way.

original: yul la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: yul la phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa ni bden pa'i don yongs su gcod pa yin te /
translated: The determination of the meaning of reality is the apprehension of the object in an undistorted way.

original: de ltar na de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'i yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu @42a * //üîΩdbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'i yongs su gcod pa'i rab tu @42a * // dbye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the analysis of the discrimination aggregate.

original: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the analysis of the formation aggregate?

original: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:

original: yul dang / gnas skabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang / gnas skabs dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: as object, as state, as defilement, as purification, and as formation.

original: de la yul ni sems pa'i tshogs drug po rnams 'du byed nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yul ni sems pa'i tshogs drug po rnams 'du byed nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: As object, the six collections of volition are established as formations.

original: de la gnas skabs ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs ni skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: As state, the formations not associated with mind, such as birth, aging, etc., are established.

original: de ni gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is distinguished by state.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The defilement is the establishment of the defilement-producing defilements and secondary defilements.

original: de la rnam par byang ba ni dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang bar byed pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par byang ba ni dad pa la sogs pa rnam par byang bar byed pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The purification is the establishment of the factors of purification such as faith, etc.

original: de la mngon par 'du byed pa ni yul dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par 'du byed pa ni yul dang mthun par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The instigation is the five kinds of instigation, such as that which is favorable to the object, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as before.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aggregate of consciousness?

original: de yang rnam pa ldar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa ldar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of five kinds:

original: kun tu zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnas dang / gnas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: kun tu zhen pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnas dang / gnas pa dang / rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: addiction, defilement, basis, state, and variety.

original: de la kun tu zhen pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod pa can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la kun tu zhen pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod pa can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Complete attachment is the consciousness of those in the desire realm who are attached to desire realm objects.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las gzugs la kun tu zhen pa kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las gzugs la kun tu zhen pa kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment to that is attachment to form, because consciousness in the desire realm of those who have desires is attached to external form.

original: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las de gnyi ga la kun tu zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na rnam par dag pa'i lha rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa las de gnyi ga la kun tu zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Attachment to both is attachment to both form and the formless, because consciousness in the form realm of pure gods is attached to internal name-and-form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming la mngon par zhen pa las ming la kun tu zhen pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa ni nang gi ming la mngon par zhen pa las ming la kun tu zhen pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Attachment to name is attachment to name alone, because consciousness in the formless realm is attached to internal name.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i kun tu zhen pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i kun tu zhen pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the classification of attachment to consciousness.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgo gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa ni sgo gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: The classification of defilement is that the consciousness of fools is defiled by two doors.

original: tshe 'di la yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo dang / tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi sgo ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i sgo dang / tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi sgo ste /
translated: The door of the experience of objects in this life and the door of the experience of birth, aging, etc., in the next life.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes @42b pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes @42b pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the defilement of consciousness.

original: de la gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa rjes su 'jug pa'i gnas ni drug po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa rjes su 'jug pa'i gnas ni drug po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The analysis of the basis is the six bases that are the support of the consciousnesses that follow.

original: 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa skye mched drug po dag la brten nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa skye mched drug po dag la brten nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the six sense-spheres, eye, etc.

original: de dag kyang phub ma dang / shing dang / lci ba dang bur ma'i me bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang phub ma dang / shing dang / lci ba dang bur ma'i me bzhin te /
translated: They are like a winnowing basket, wood, a scale-pan, or a fire of dried cow-dung.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the basis of consciousness.

original: de la gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The analysis of the abode is the four abodes of consciousness.

original: de dag kyang mdo las bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i rgyu dang len pa dang dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo las bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i rgyu dang len pa dang dmigs pa yin te /
translated: These four are the causes, appropriators, and focal objects of the consciousness that abides.

original: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / gzugs la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par nga ni rnam par shes pa 'di dag ni shar phyogs na gnas pa dang / phyogs mtshams kyi bar na gnas par yang mi smra ste /
analyzed: gzugs la nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa gnas pa dang / gzugs la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par nga ni rnam par shes pa 'di dag ni shar phyogs na gnas pa dang / phyogs mtshams kyi bar na gnas par yang mi smra ste /
translated: Consciousness that abides in form and focuses on form and so on extensively up to I do not say that these consciousnesses abide in the east or in the intermediate directions.

original: tshe 'di nyid la grib ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang bsil bar gyur pa dang tshangs par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la grib ma med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang bsil bar gyur pa dang tshangs par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: In this life they are free of shadows, free of sorrow, peaceful, cool, and brahma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sdes yongs su bsdus pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sdes yongs su bsdus pa de dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag yin no //
translated: The consciousnesses that abide in these states subsumed by the s≈´tras spoken by the TathƒÅgata are the abodes of consciousness.

original: 'di man chad ni de'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni de'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: From here on the different characteristics of the abodes of consciousness will be explained.

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa'i mtha' dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa'i rab tu zhi ba de dag kyang yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa'i mtha' dang / rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa'i rab tu zhi ba de dag kyang yongs su bstan to //
translated: In brief, the basis, the cause, the end of the cause, and the pacification of the cause of abiding have been taught.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i gzhi gang yin pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i gzhi gang yin pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The basis of the afflictions and the afflictions that are related to it are called the cause and the grasping.

original: de gnyi ga yang dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Both of them are called the objective support.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the object of perception and the perceiver.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i rgyu sred pas lhag par chags pa las ni dngos po la nye bar song ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i rgyu sred pas lhag par chags pa las ni dngos po la nye bar song ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: From the cause of the afflictions, which is craving, there is the attachment to things.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa las kyi rgyu'i mdud pa bzhis ni dngos po la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa las kyi rgyu'i mdud pa bzhis ni dngos po la dmigs par byed do //
translated: From the four knots of the cause of action, which are covetousness and so on, there is the perception of things.

original: de gnyi ga'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i bag la nyal dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The thing that possesses the latent impressions of both of them is called the basis.

original: de la gang zag so so'i skye bo dga' ba'i gnyen po yid @43a * //
analyzed: de la gang zag so so'i skye bo dga' ba'i gnyen po yid @43a * //
translated: The cause of the arising of the body in the future is the moisture of consciousness, which is the result of the absence of the counteragent to the delight of the ordinary man.üîΩThe moisture of consciousness is the cause of the arising of the body in the future, because it is the support of the body in the future, and because it is the cause of the completion of the body in the future.

original: byung ba ma thob pa des rnam par shes pa mngon par brlan pa ni phyi ma la lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang phyar zhing 'byung ba ste /üîΩde la so so'i skye bo'i lus ma spangs na /üîΩyongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung ba ma thob pa des rnam par shes pa mngon par brlan pa ni phyi ma la lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang phyar zhing 'byung ba ste / de la so so'i skye bo'i lus ma spangs na / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The moisture of consciousness is the cause of the arising of the body in the future, because it is the support of the body in the future, and because it is the cause of the completion of the body in the future.

original: de la lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / de la rgyun 'jug par nges pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / de la rgyun 'jug par nges pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The support and completion of the body in the future is called the abiding of the body in the future.

original: lhag ma sngar bshad pa ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma sngar bshad pa ni gnas pa'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The remaining causes of the arising of the body in the future should be understood as the causes of the abiding of the body in the future.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pas ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pas ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the body in the future, together with its causes, is called the abiding of the body in the future.

original: gzugs can gyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the realm of form, the arising of the body in the future should be understood as the arising of consciousness.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar zad de de gnyi g-yang tshe zad kyi bar du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar zad de de gnyi g-yang tshe zad kyi bar du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The non-material ones are merely death and rebirth, and both of these last as long as life does.

original: de gnyi ga'i rgyas pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yangs pa'i don kyang snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i rgyas pa dang / 'phel ba dang / yangs pa'i don kyang snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the increase and growth of both of these should be understood as before.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i mtha' dang / gnas pa'i mtha'i rgyu ni de tsam du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa'i mtha' dang / gnas pa'i mtha'i rgyu ni de tsam du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The limit of the realm of the consciousnesses and the cause of the limit of the realm should be understood as just this.

original: gzhan du 'dogs par byed pa la ni yi ge tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan du 'dogs par byed pa la ni yi ge tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba kho nar zad kyi /
translated: If one were to designate them differently, there would be only a difference in the letters,

original: don tha dad pa nyid ni med de /
analyzed: don tha dad pa nyid ni med de /
translated: but not a difference in the meaning.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don ni yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don ni yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other object than that.

original: gzhan dag gis legs par brgal zhing brtags na yang de las gzhan pa'i don gyi yul med pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi shes pas cung zad kyang lan 'debs par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis legs par brgal zhing brtags na yang de las gzhan pa'i don gyi yul med pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi shes pas cung zad kyang lan 'debs par mi byed do //
translated: When others have thoroughly examined and questioned him, he does not know how to reply because there is no other object than that.

original: phyis bdag nyid tshul bzhin du nye bar rtog pa na bdag rmongs pas de bstan to zhes bdag nyid kyi rmongs pa de rmongs pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir mkhas pa ni gzugs rnam pa thams cad nas 'du byed kyi bar la sred pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa spong ba las bral bar 'gyur gyi bag la nyal las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis bdag nyid tshul bzhin du nye bar rtog pa na bdag rmongs pas de bstan to zhes bdag nyid kyi rmongs pa de rmongs pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir mkhas pa ni gzugs rnam pa thams cad nas 'du byed kyi bar la sred pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa spong ba las bral bar 'gyur gyi bag la nyal las ni ma yin no //
translated: Later, when one properly examines oneself, one realizes that one‚Äôs own delusion is delusion, saying, ‚ÄúI was taught that by delusion.‚ÄùüîΩFor the wise are free from the entanglement of craving, which is the attachment included in the aggregates, up to the entanglements of the formations, but not from the latent dispositions.

original: de'i mdud pa nyon mongs pa'i char gdogs  pa las kun nas slong bar byed pa dag kyang kun nas dkris pa kho na las spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mdud pa nyon mongs pa'i char gdogs  pa las kun nas slong bar byed pa dag kyang kun nas dkris pa kho na las spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the entanglements that are the motivating forces of the actions that are classified as the afflictions are abandoned only by the path of cultivation, not by the path of insight.

original: 'di ltar khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dag ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems kyi mdud pa dag gis yul la rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / @43b sems can la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dag ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems kyi mdud pa dag gis yul la rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / @43b sems can la gnod pa byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed do //
translated: Thus, those who are based in the householder‚Äôs life are motivated by actions that arise from the cause of grasping objects with the knots of covetousness and ill will, and by actions that arise from the cause of harming sentient beings.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa dag ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i mdud pa dag gis las kun nas slong bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa dag ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i mdud pa dag gis las kun nas slong bar byed do //
translated: Those who are based in the life of renunciation are motivated by actions that arise from the knots of grasping at the superiority of moral discipline and ascetic practices and of grasping at the superiority of the conviction that ‚Äúthis is the truth.‚Äù

original: de dag gi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni brnab sems kyi gnas lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni brnab sems kyi gnas lta bu yin la /
translated: Their grasping at the superiority of moral discipline and ascetic practices is similar to the basis of covetousness.

original: 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gnod sems kyi gnas lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di bden no snyam du mngon par zhen pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gnod sems kyi gnas lta bu yin te /
translated: Their grasping at the superiority of the conviction that ‚Äúthis is the truth‚Äù is similar to the basis of ill will.

original: des na mtho ris kyi 'jig rten ni 'dod par byed la /
analyzed: des na mtho ris kyi 'jig rten ni 'dod par byed la /
translated: Therefore, they strive for the world of the gods.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni skur ba 'debs par byed de mdud pa de dag kyang yid kyis rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni skur ba 'debs par byed de mdud pa de dag kyang yid kyis rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: He deprecates nirvana, and these bonds should be seen as being motivated by mental conceptualization.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyen po shas cher bsten pas 'dod chags dang mdud pa de gnyis kyi bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyen po shas cher bsten pas 'dod chags dang mdud pa de gnyis kyi bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, by relying on the antidote to a great degree, the latent dispositions of those two bonds of attachment are eliminated.
