original: de spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang gis gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i dmigs pa de gtan du bral bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gang gis gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa la dmigs par byed pa'i dmigs pa de gtan du bral bas rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are eliminated, the afflictions that cause one to focus on form, feeling, etc., are interrupted because their objects are forever abandoned.

original: de rgyun chad pas bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa de gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gnas pa de dag la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rgyun chad pas bag la nyal dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags pa de gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa gnas pa de dag la mi gnas te /
translated: Because they are interrupted, the consciousness that is associated with the latent dispositions ceases. That consciousness does not dwell in those abodes of consciousness, form, feeling, etc.

original: de'i gnyen po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousness that is the antidote to those is purified.

original: de ltar na de ni gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar zhi ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gnas pa'i rgyu nye bar zhi ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the cause of abiding is pacified.

original: rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir phyi ma la lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rgyun 'jug pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir phyi ma la lus yongs su 'dzin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / rgyun 'jug pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the cause has ceased, the body is not grasped in the future, is not perfected, and does not continue.

original: de ltar na de ni gnas pa nye bar zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gnas pa nye bar zhi ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the pacification of abiding.

original: de'i gnyen por gtogs pa rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gtogs pa rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The consciousness that is included in its antidote is called ‚Äúnon-abiding.‚Äù

original: de yang rgyu las mngon par rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu las mngon par rgyas par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It does not increase from a cause.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin no //üîΩrnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir chog shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin no // rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir chog shes pa yin no //
translated: It is not produced through action because of cultivating the emptiness gate of liberation.üîΩIt is contentment because of cultivating the signless gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is abiding because of cultivating the wishless gate of liberation.

original: de ltar mngon par @44a * //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par @44a * //
translated: Thus, it is the pacification of abiding.

original: rgyas pa med pa nas gnas pa'i bar gyi phyir shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa med pa nas gnas pa'i bar gyi phyir shin tu rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: He is ‚Äúcompletely liberated‚Äù because he is free from the increase, etc. of the passions.

original: rgyu bar gyur pa na yang bdag dang bdag gir cung zad kyang mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgyu bar gyur pa na yang bdag dang bdag gir cung zad kyang mi 'dzin to //
translated: Even when he is active, he does not grasp at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine. ‚Äù

original: des na de gzugs la sogs par gyur kyang yongs su yi chad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de gzugs la sogs par gyur kyang yongs su yi chad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even when he is in the form realm, he is not discouraged.

original: rtags des na de rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: rtags des na de rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid du snang ngo //
translated: By this sign, he appears as one who is pure.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par rang gi ngang kho nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par rang gi ngang kho nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: That consciousness, because it is pure, ceases by itself, without depending on another cause.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i rgyun rgyun chad pa'i phyar phyogs bcur 'jug pa yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i rgyun rgyun chad pa'i phyar phyogs bcur 'jug pa yang med do //
translated: The stream of that consciousness is not interrupted, and he does not enter into the ten directions.

original: 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa ni grib ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la mngon par dga' ba med pa ni grib ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is ‚Äúwithout shadow‚Äù because he is not attached to life and death.

original: yang na tshor ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa shing ljon pa lta bu de'i grib ma lta bu yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshor ba rnams ni rnam par shes pa shing ljon pa lta bu de'i grib ma lta bu yin te /
translated: Or else, the feelings are like the shadow of the consciousness-tree.

original: de dag de'i tshe na mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: de dag de'i tshe na mi 'byung bas /
translated: Since they do not occur at that time,

original: de'i phyir yang de ni grib ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ni grib ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore it is called ‚Äúwithout shadow.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //üîΩzag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rim gyis slob pa'i rnam par grol bas zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa yin no // zag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni rim gyis slob pa'i rnam par grol bas zhi ba yin no //
translated: That which is contaminated is peace in this life.üîΩThat which is uncontaminated is peace through the gradual liberation of the trainee.

original: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol bas ni bsil bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rnam par grol bas ni bsil bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: That which is the liberation of the non-trainee is coolness.

original: phung po 'gag pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po 'gag pa'i phyir tshangs par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cessation of the aggregates is the brahma state.

original: rnam par shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness is not naturally defiled.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúIt is naturally luminous.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyon las gtan du rnam par ma dag na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon las gtan du rnam par ma dag na ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to the afflictions such as attachment if it is not completely purified from faults.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'ba' zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'ba' zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the cause of the defilement of form, feeling, etc.,

original: 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na la ni su yang sred par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig kho na la ni su yang sred par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: because no one craves consciousness alone, as they do with form, etc.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore consciousness is not the basis of consciousness.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //üîΩde la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa @44b dang ; zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sems rnam par ma grol ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i gnas pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no // de la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba ni mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa @44b dang ; zhe sdang dang bral ba zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sems rnam par ma grol ba dang /
translated: This is the analysis of the basis of the aggregate of consciousness.üîΩThe analysis of the various types of consciousness is as stated in the sutra:

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar du ji skad du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Lord said, ‚ÄúThe mind is sometimes with attachment, sometimes without attachment, sometimes with hatred, sometimes without hatred, and so on, up to the mind sometimes being liberated, sometimes not liberated.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba gcig yin no //
translated: Thus, this is one classification of the various types of minds.

original: yang khams kyi rab tu dbye ba las ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams la ni sems bzhi yod de /
analyzed: yang khams kyi rab tu dbye ba las ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams la ni sems bzhi yod de /
translated: In terms of the classification of realms, there are four types of minds in the desire realm:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: virtuous, nonvirtuous, obscured neutral, and unobscured neutral.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams la ni gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams la ni gsum yod de /
translated: There are three types of minds in the form realm:

original: mi dge ba ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: excluding the nonvirtuous.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la yang gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams la yang gsum kho na ste /
translated: There are also three types of minds in the formless realm:

original: mi dge ba ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: excluding the nonvirtuous.

original: zag pa med pa'i ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems so //
translated: The uncontaminated minds are the learner and nonlearner minds.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The virtuous minds in the desire realm are of two types:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dang skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dang skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: those obtained from birth and those derived from preparation.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The unobscured neutral minds are of four types:

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang sbrul pa byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang sbrul pa byed pa'i sems so //
translated: the mind born of retribution, the mind born of deportment, the mind born of skill in arts and crafts, and the mind creating fictive beings.

original: skyes nas thob pa de yang 'di lta ste lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa ste bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa de yang 'di lta ste lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin la sogs pa ste bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The innate mind is also of this type, namely, the mind of the gods, nagas, yakshas, etc., because the result of meditation does not exist for them.

original: gzugs na spyod pa la ni bzo'i gnas las byung ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa la ni bzo'i gnas las byung ba med do //
translated: In the realm of form, the mind born of skill in arts and crafts does not exist.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang med do //
translated: In the formless realm, it also does not exist.

original: dge ba ni 'og ma la ji lta ba de bzhin du gong ma thams cad la yod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni 'og ma la ji lta ba de bzhin du gong ma thams cad la yod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wholesome should be understood as existing in all the higher stages in the same way as in the lower stages.

original: sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang 'dod pa na spyod pa la ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yod do //
analyzed: sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang 'dod pa na spyod pa la ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yod do //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are the ten types of minds: the mind to be abandoned by seeing the truth of unsatisfactoriness, the mind to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the mind to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, the mind to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, and the mind to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod do //
translated: As in the case of the realm of desire, there are five types of thought in the realm of finemateriality.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang rnam pa lnga yod do //
translated: There are also five types of thought in the realm of immateriality.

original: zag pa med pa'i ni sems bcu drug pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ni sems bcu drug pa yin no //
translated: The sixteenth thought is pure thought.

original: de la sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: The classification of the various types of thought will now be explained.

original: phyogs ni gsum po 'di dag yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyogs ni gsum po 'di dag yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three categories of thought:üîΩ1. thought not concentrated in absorption, but agitated;

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ma bskyod pa rnams dang / bskyod pa ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa rnams dang / ting @45a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phyir ma bskyod pa rnams dang / bskyod pa ting nge 'dzin ma thob pa rnams dang / ting @45a * //
translated: 2. thought concentrated in absorption, but not acquired;

original: nge 'dzin thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: nge 'dzin thob pa rnams so //
translated: 3. thought concentrated in absorption and acquired.üîΩThese three categories are, respectively,üîΩ1. very impure;

original: de dag kyang shin tu rnam par ma dag pa rnams dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang shin tu rnam par ma dag pa rnams dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams so //
translated: 2. impure and pure;üîΩ3. very pure.

original: de la phyogs dang po ni sems nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni sems nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa'i sems te /
translated: The first category is the thought of those who are defiled by attachment, etc.

original: lan 'ga' ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes they are endowed with virtuous or neutral minds, and they are free from the entanglements of attachment and so on.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ni lan 'ga' nang du zhi ba la sems gtod par yang byed la /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ni lan 'ga' nang du zhi ba la sems gtod par yang byed la /
translated: The second position is that sometimes they direct their minds inwardly to tranquility,

original: lan 'ga' ni brjed ngas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rjes su 'dug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni brjed ngas pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rjes su 'dug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: but sometimes they are forgetful and remain attached to the five sense pleasures.

original: lan 'ga' ni shin tu zhi ba'i phyir rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi kun nas dkris par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni shin tu zhi ba'i phyir rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi kun nas dkris par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes they are entangled in lethargy and sleepiness because of excessive tranquility.

original: lan 'ga' ni de spang ba'i phyir dang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa la gtod par yang byed do //üîΩlan 'ga' ni de la yang legs par ma gtad pas rgod par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni de spang ba'i phyir dang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa la gtod par yang byed do // lan 'ga' ni de la yang legs par ma gtad pas rgod par yang 'gyur la /
translated: Sometimes they direct their minds to a delightful object in order to eliminate that.üîΩSometimes they are agitated because they do not direct their minds well to that.

original: lan 'ga' ni legs par gtad pas rgod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni legs par gtad pas rgod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes they are not agitated because they do direct their minds well to that.

original: lan 'ga' ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang nye bar ma zhi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i sgrib pa ma spangs pas phyogs gnyi ga la yang nye bar ma zhi bar 'gyur la /
translated: Sometimes, because the obscurations of slackness and excitedness have not been abandoned, it is not tranquil in both ways.

original: spangs pas ni nye bar zhi bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pas ni nye bar zhi bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But when they have been abandoned, it is tranquil.

original: yid la byed pa dang / dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang / dngos gzhi bsam gtan thob pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is concentrated when the attention and the meditative concentration of the main practice have been attained.

original: ma thob pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is not concentrated when they have not been attained.

original: lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa yin no //
translated: It is well cultivated when it has reached the culmination of the path.

original: spong ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par gro la pa yin no //
analyzed: spong ba'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par gro la pa yin no //
translated: It is well liberated when it has reached the culmination of the abandonment of the defilements.

original: de las bzlog pa ni shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni shin tu bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of these is not well cultivated and not well liberated.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa yan chad ni phyogs gsum pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa yan chad ni phyogs gsum pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The third category is to be understood as the opposite of these.

original: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the various aspects of consciousness.

original: de la phung po rnams kyi go rims bstan pa'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams kyi go rims bstan pa'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the order of the aggregates?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being fivefold:

original: skye ba las gyur pa dang / gnyen po las gyur pa dang / 'jug pa las gyur pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa'o //üîΩde la skye ba las gyur @45b pa ni mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid dang chos rnams la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bar de la ni dang por gzugs kyi phung po bstan la /
analyzed: skye ba las gyur pa dang / gnyen po las gyur pa dang / 'jug pa las gyur pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa'o // de la skye ba las gyur @45b pa ni mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid dang chos rnams la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i bar de la ni dang por gzugs kyi phung po bstan la /
translated: order of arising, order of the antidote, order of the gross, order of the inferior, and order of the sequential teaching.üîΩThe order of arising is that the eye and form are the basis for the arising of eye consciousness, and so on up to the mental faculty and phenomena are the basis for the arising of mental consciousness.üîΩThe order of the antidote is that the antidote to attachment to the internal is form, and the antidote to attachment to the external is feeling.

original: de'i 'og tu sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan to //
translated: The order of the gross is that form is the grossest of the five aggregates, for it is the object of the eye consciousness of other species, and it is the object of the eye consciousness of other sentient beings, and it is the object of the eye consciousness of other individuals.üîΩThe order of the inferior is that the inferior of the five aggregates is form, for it is the object of the eye consciousness of other species, and it is the object of the eye consciousness of other sentient beings, and it is the object of the eye consciousness of other individuals.üîΩThe order of the sequential teaching is that the Buddha first taught the aggregate of form to those who had attachment to form, in order to establish them in the teaching.üîΩAfter that, he taught the aggregate of consciousness, which is the basis for the mental factors.

original: de'i 'og tu ni de la brten pa sems las byung ba'i chos tshor ba la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni de la brten pa sems las byung ba'i chos tshor ba la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: After that, he taught the mental factors such as feeling, which are based on that consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum 'dus pa las reg pa 'byung la /
translated: Thus contact arises from the union of the three.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes mjug thogs su smos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la sogs pa'o zhes mjug thogs su smos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Contact is the condition for feeling, etc.

original: de ltar na de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba las gyur pa'i go rims bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba las gyur pa'i go rims bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the order of the aggregates is taught according to their arising.

original: de la gnyen po las gyur pa ni phyin ci log bzhi po mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log dang / mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log dag gi gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan pa de dag la dang por gzugs kyi phung po bstan la /
analyzed: de la gnyen po las gyur pa ni phyin ci log bzhi po mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log dang / mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log dag gi gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bstan pa de dag la dang por gzugs kyi phung po bstan la /
translated: The order of the four foundations of mindfulness is taught as the antidote to the four errors: the error of purity with regard to the impure, the error of pleasure with regard to suffering, the error of permanence with regard to the impermanent, and the error of self with regard to nonself.üîΩThe form aggregate is taught first among the five aggregates.

original: de'i 'og tu ni tshor ba'i phung po /üîΩde'i 'og tu ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni tshor ba'i phung po / de'i 'og tu ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po /
translated: The feeling aggregate is taught next.üîΩThe consciousness aggregate is taught next.

original: de'i 'og tu ni 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po bstan te /
translated: The perception and formation aggregates are taught last.

original: de ltar na de ni gnyen po las gyur pa'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gnyen po las gyur pa'i go rims yin no //
translated: Thus, the order of the aggregates is taught according to their antidotes.

original: de la 'jug pa las gyur pa na dbang po dang / yul la brten nas phung po gnyis te yul so sor myong bar byed pa dang / yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa las gyur pa na dbang po dang / yul la brten nas phung po gnyis te yul so sor myong bar byed pa dang / yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The next two are the aggregates of feeling and perception, which experience the objects and grasp their signs.

original: de'i 'og tu gcig gis ni tshe 'di la yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pas /üîΩtshe phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gcig gis ni tshe 'di la yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pas / tshe phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The next one is the aggregate of formations, which is the defilement of the enjoyment of objects in this life and the performance of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.üîΩThe last one is the aggregate of consciousness, which is the defilement of birth in the next life and so on.

original: gcig ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa yin pas de ni thams cad kyi tha mar bstan to //
analyzed: gcig ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa yin pas de ni thams cad kyi tha mar bstan to //
translated: The last one is the aggregate of consciousness, which is the defilement of birth in the next life and so on.

original: de la gnas pa las gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i go rims dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa las gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i go rims dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The order of the four stations of consciousness and consciousness is as follows.üîΩThis is the order of the stations.

original: de ltar na de ni gnas pa las gyur pa'i go rims yin no //üîΩde la rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni gnas pa las gyur pa'i go rims yin no //üîΩde la rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa ni /
translated: The order of the presentation is as follows.

original: dang por gang zag mthong nas gzugs kyis so sor ngo shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang por gang zag mthong nas gzugs kyis so sor ngo shes par 'gyur te /
translated: First, one sees the person and recognizes him or her by the form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po rnam par gzhag go //üîΩde'i 'og tu tshor ba'i @46a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po rnam par gzhag go // de'i 'og tu tshor ba'i @46a * //
translated: Therefore, the form aggregate is established.

original: phung pos ni 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do //üîΩde'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung pos ni ming ni 'di zhes bya rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: phung pos ni 'byor ba dang / rgud pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'o zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do // de'i 'og tu 'du shes kyi phung pos ni ming ni 'di zhes bya rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: After that, by the feeling aggregate, one establishes that he or she is prosperous or in decline, happy or miserable.

original: rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byed do //üîΩde'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung pos ni de lta bu ni byis pa'o //
analyzed: rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par byed do // de'i 'og tu 'du byed kyi phung pos ni de lta bu ni byis pa'o //
translated: After that, by the perception aggregate, one establishes that his or her name is such and such, his or her family is such and such, his or her caste is such and such, and so on.

original: de lta bu ni mkhas pa'o zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni mkhas pa'o zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: After that, by the formation aggregate, one establishes that such and such a person is a child, such and such a person is an adult, such and such a person is wise, and so on.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pas ni nang gi bdag rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pas ni nang gi bdag rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: After that, by consciousness, one establishes the inner self.

original: de phung po de dag la so sor rtog par byed pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: de phung po de dag la so sor rtog par byed pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa'am /
translated: One examines those aggregates and establishes that he or she is happy or miserable.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa dang / byis pa'am mkhas par shes par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pas de ltar na de ni phung po rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa bstan pa yin no //üîΩyang bdag gis nye bar spyad pa'i dngos po dang / bdag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas go rims gzhan blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa dang / byis pa'am mkhas par shes par byed pa dang / rnam par 'jog par byed pas de ltar na de ni phung po rnams kyi go rims rnam par gzhag pa las gyur pa bstan pa yin no // yang bdag gis nye bar spyad pa'i dngos po dang / bdag gi dngos po'i dbang du byas nas go rims gzhan blta bar bya ste /
translated: and they are the basis for the designation of the self, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing suffering, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing pleasure, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing happiness, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing suffering, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing a name, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing skill in some craft, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing ignorance, the basis for the designation of the self as possessing knowledge, the basis for the designation of the self as a child, the basis for the designation of the self as an adult, the basis for the designation of the self as old, the basis for the designation of the self as healthy, the basis for the designation of the self as sick, the basis for the designation of the self as dead, the basis for the designation of the self as liberated, and the basis for the designation of the self as not liberated.üîΩThe order of the aggregates is also established on the basis of their coarseness.

original: de la bdag gi lus la brten pa dang / yul las bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag la ni ming ni 'di zhes bya rigs ni 'di zhes bya rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs par rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa dang /üîΩde gnyis la brten nas chos dang chos ma yin pa nye bar sogs par byed de /
analyzed: de la bdag gi lus la brten pa dang / yul las bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag la ni ming ni 'di zhes bya rigs ni 'di zhes bya rus ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba la sogs par rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa dang /üîΩde gnyis la brten nas chos dang chos ma yin pa nye bar sogs par byed de /
translated: The order of the elements is established on the basis of their coarseness and the order of the sense spheres is established on the basis of the faculties and objects.üîΩThe order of the faculties is established on the basis of their coarseness and the order of the dependent origination is established on the basis of the order of the stages of birth.

original: de ltar na de ni bdag gi nye bar spyod pa'i dngos po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni bdag gi nye bar spyod pa'i dngos po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that this is the basis of the self's experience.

original: phung po tham ni bdag gi dngos po nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po tham ni bdag gi dngos po nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates should be viewed as the basis of the self.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po du dag dang / khams du dag dang / skye mched du dag dang / srid pa'i yan lag du dag dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa du dag dang / dbang po du dag gis bsdus /üîΩgzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar yang du dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po du dag dang / khams du dag dang / skye mched du dag dang / srid pa'i yan lag du dag dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa du dag dang / dbang po du dag gis bsdus / gzugs kyi phung po ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i bar yang du dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By how many aggregates, elements, sense-fields, limbs of existence, kinds of bases and supernormal powers are the form aggregate, etc.üîΩincluded?üîΩThe form aggregate is included by one aggregate, ten elements, ten sense-fields, one part of the element and sense-field of mental objects, six limbs of existence, one part of the bases and supernormal powers, and seven faculties.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang khams dang skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag drug gi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po @46b bdun gyis bsdus so //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang khams dang skye mched bcu dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag drug gi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po @46b bdun gyis bsdus so //
translated: The feeling aggregate is included by one aggregate, one element and one sense-field.üîΩThe perception aggregate is included by one aggregate, one element and one sense-field.üîΩThe formations aggregate is included by one aggregate, one element and one sense-field.üîΩThe consciousness aggregate is included by one aggregate, seven elements and seven sense-fields.

original: tshor ba'i phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po lnga dang ;
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po lnga dang ;
translated: The feeling aggregate is included in one aggregate, one element, one sense base, one link of dependent origination, three links of dependent origination in part, one part of the proper and improper, and five faculties.

original: dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus so //
translated: It is not included in any of the powers.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang srid pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus la /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang srid pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig gis bsdus la /
translated: The perception aggregate is included in one aggregate, one element, one sense base, three links of dependent origination in part, one part of the proper and improper, and it is not included in any of the faculties.

original: dbang po ni gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
analyzed: dbang po ni gang gis kyang ma bsdus so //
translated: It is not included in any of the powers.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag bzhi dang / srid pa'i yan lag lnga'i phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po drug dang dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams dang skye mched gcig gi phyogs dang / srid pa'i yan lag bzhi dang / srid pa'i yan lag lnga'i phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang / dbang po drug dang dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus so //
translated: The formation aggregate is included in one aggregate, one element and sense sphere, four branches of existence, one part of five branches of existence, one part of the possible and impossible, six faculties and three faculties.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams bdun dang / skye mched gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag bzhi'i phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang ; dbang po gcig dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni phung po gcig kho na dang / khams bdun dang / skye mched gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag gcig dang / srid pa'i yan lag bzhi'i phyogs dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i phyogs gcig dang ; dbang po gcig dang /
translated: The consciousness aggregate is included in one aggregate, seven elements, one sense sphere, one branch of existence, one part of four branches of existence, one part of the possible and impossible, one faculty and

original: dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: dbang po gsum gyi phyogs kyis bsdus te /
translated: three faculties.

original: de ltar na bsdu ba drug po phung pos bsdus pa nas dbang pos bsdus pa'i bar gyi bsdu ba'i tshul de nyid kyis gcig gis gcig bsdus par ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bsdu ba drug po phung pos bsdus pa nas dbang pos bsdus pa'i bar gyi bsdu ba'i tshul de nyid kyis gcig gis gcig bsdus par ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the six modes of inclusion, from the inclusion by the aggregates up to the inclusion by the faculties, should be understood as they are in reality, in terms of the mutual inclusion of the aggregates, etc.

original: gzhan yang bsdu ba bcu yod par blta bar bya'o//üîΩ'di lta ste khams kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang gi sa bon gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩmtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsdu ba bcu yod par blta bar bya'o// 'di lta ste khams kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang gi sa bon gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o // mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, ten kinds of inclusion should be understood.üîΩInclusion by the elements is the inclusion of the aggregates, etc. by their own seeds.üîΩInclusion by characteristics is the inclusion of the aggregates, etc. by their own and general characteristics.

original: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang gi rigs zad par gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rang gi rigs zad par gyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Inclusion by species is the inclusion of the aggregates, etc. by their own species.

original: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩtha mi dad pas bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de @47a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o // tha mi dad pas bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de @47a * //
translated: That which is included by state is that which is included by the states of those aggregates, etc. themselves, such as the state of pleasant feeling, etc.

original: dag nyid kyi chos re re la yang phung po la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dag nyid kyi chos re re la yang phung po la sogs pa 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is included by non-difference is that which is included by each of those aggregates, etc. themselves, by all the aggregates, etc. together with their retinue.

original: dus kyis bsdus pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid de nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyis bsdus pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid de nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is included by time is that which is included by those very past, future, and present aggregates, etc. themselves.

original: yul gyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa yul gang du 'jug pa dang / gnas gang nas 'byung ba de dag nyid de nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa yul gang du 'jug pa dang / gnas gang nas 'byung ba de dag nyid de nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is included by place is that which is included by those very aggregates, etc. themselves, in whatever place they occur and arise.

original: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid lnga nyid la sogs pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩphyogs gcig gis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: mtha' dag gis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid lnga nyid la sogs pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o // phyogs gcig gis bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid rnam par phye ste /
translated: The inclusion of all is that which is included by the five aggregates, etc. themselves, by the fivefold, etc.

original: ma tshang bas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma tshang bas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The inclusion of a part is that which is included by the aggregates, etc. themselves, by a division which is not complete.

original: don dam pas bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pas bsdus pa ni phung po la sogs pa de dag nyid de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The inclusion of the ultimate is that which is included by the aggregates, etc. themselves, by the characteristic of reality.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: If all of these are combined into one,

original: phung po rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam pa bcu drug yod de /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi bsdu ba rnam pa bcu drug yod de /
translated: there are sixteen kinds of inclusion of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi bar la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi bar la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the aggregates, so it is with the sense-fields and elements.

original: gzhan yang chos gsum gyis chos thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos gsum gyis chos thams cad bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, all things are included in three things:

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi skye mched kyis so ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi skye mched kyis so ;
translated: the form aggregate, the phenomena element, and the mind sense-field.

original: / de la gzugs kyi phung po ni gnas du dag la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: / de la gzugs kyi phung po ni gnas du dag la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: The form aggregate is based on how many bases?

original: ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi po dag ni gnas su dag la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩgzugs kyi phung po ni gnas drug la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi po dag ni gnas su dag la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur zhe na / gzugs kyi phung po ni gnas drug la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The four aggregates that are included in name are based on how many bases?üîΩThe form aggregate is based on six bases:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: 1. the base of the physical faculties,üîΩ2. the base of contact,üîΩ3. the base of the physical basis,üîΩ4. the base of the faculties,üîΩ5. the base of the support of the faculties,

original: rten gyi gnas dang / gnas kyi gnas dang / yo byad kyi gnas dang / dbang po'i gnas dang / dbang po'i rten gyi gnas dang / mthu las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gnas la'o //
analyzed: rten gyi gnas dang / gnas kyi gnas dang / yo byad kyi gnas dang / dbang po'i gnas dang / dbang po'i rten gyi gnas dang / mthu las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gnas la'o //
translated: 6. the base of the domain of concentration that arises from power.

original: de la ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi ni gnas bdun la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ming gis bsdus pa'i phung po bzhi ni gnas bdun la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The four aggregates that are included in name are based on seven bases:üîΩ1. desire,üîΩ2. hope,üîΩ3. object,üîΩ4. discrimination,

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa dang / re ba dang / yul dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag par shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang / dag pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa dang / re ba dang / yul dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag par shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang / dag pa la'o //
translated: 5. right knowledge,üîΩ6. right application,üîΩ7. purity.

original: de la 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi gnas skabs ni bzhi'o //üîΩsdom pa la gnas @47b pa'i sdom brtson par rnams kyi ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi gnas skabs ni bzhi'o // sdom pa la gnas @47b pa'i sdom brtson par rnams kyi ni gcig pa'o //
translated: There are four states of those who enjoy sense pleasures.üîΩThere is one state of those who are zealous in the vows.

original: nyer bsngogs thob ba mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi yang gcig go //
analyzed: nyer bsngogs thob ba mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyi yang gcig go //
translated: There is one state of those who have attained the stages of access and are in equipoise.

original: dngos gzhi la gnas pa rnams kyi yang gcig ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la gnas pa rnams kyi yang gcig ste /
translated: There is one state of those who abide in the actual meditative absorption.

original: de ltar na gnas bdun po de dag ni gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: de ltar na gnas bdun po de dag ni gnas skabs bzhir 'gyur ro / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: Thus, these seven states are the four states.

original: 'di man chad ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba ji bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gzugs kyi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba ji bshad par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the classification of the form aggregate will be explained.

original: de'i 'og tu ni ming gi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni ming gi phung po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: After that, the classification of the name aggregate will be explained.

original: de la gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi rab tu dbye ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Regarding that, beginning with the classification of form,üîΩthe summary is:üîΩSubstance, atom, birth,üîΩshape, continuum, action, moment,üîΩunmixed, and object,

original: sdom ni / rdzas dang rdul dang skye ba dang // dbyibs rgyun las dang skad cig dang // ma 'dres pa dang spyod yul dang ; / de bzhin phan tshun 'dres pa yin //
analyzed: sdom ni / rdzas dang rdul dang skye ba dang // dbyibs rgyun las dang skad cig dang // ma 'dres pa dang spyod yul dang ; / de bzhin phan tshun 'dres pa yin //
translated: and likewise, mutually mixed.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i mig la rdzas du yod ce na /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i mig la rdzas du yod ce na /
translated: How many substances are included in the eye that is included in the form aggregate?

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ni gcig ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ni gcig ste /
translated: It is said: The substance included by its characteristics is one,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: because it is the clear form that is the basis of eye consciousness.

original: tha mi dad pas bsdus pa'i rdzas ni bdun te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pas bsdus pa'i rdzas ni bdun te /
translated: The substance included by its non-difference is seven,

original: mig de nyid dang / lus dang ; sa dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: mig de nyid dang / lus dang ; sa dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
translated: because it is the eye itself, the body, and the four primary elements of earth, form, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de gnyi ga'i khams kyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i khams kyis bsdus pa'i rdzas ni bcu ste /
translated: The substance included by both of those elements is ten,

original: khams las rdzas bdun po de dag nyid dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: khams las rdzas bdun po de dag nyid dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: because it is the seven substances of the elements themselves, and the elements of water, fire, and wind.

original: mig ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ear, nose, and tongue should be viewed in the same way as the eye.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /üîΩrna ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de / rna ba ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: But there is this difference.üîΩThe ear is the clear form that is the basis of ear consciousness.

original: sna ni sna'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: sna ni sna'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: The nose is the clear form that is the basis of nose consciousness.

original: lce ni lce'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba ste /
analyzed: lce ni lce'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba ste /
translated: The tongue is the clear form that is the basis of the tongue consciousness.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: lus la ni mig la sogs pa bzhi po dag dbri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus la ni mig la sogs pa bzhi po dag dbri bar bya'o //
translated: In the body, the four beginning with the eye are subtracted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag med kyang de 'ba' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag med kyang de 'ba' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is perceived even when they do not exist.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi gzugs dang ba yin no //
translated: Its characteristic is the clear form that is the basis of the body consciousness.

original: de dag gi spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi gzugs dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la ni dbang po thams cad dbri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul gyi mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi gzugs dang ; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la ni dbang po thams cad dbri bar bya ste /
translated: In the objects of those, external form, smell, taste, and tangible objects, all the faculties are subtracted.

original: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the rest is to be understood just as before.

original: sgra dang sgra'i khams ni mi bstan pa yin pa'i phyir logs shig kho nar ston par byed de /
analyzed: sgra dang sgra'i khams ni mi bstan pa yin pa'i phyir logs shig kho nar ston par byed de /
translated: Sound and the sound element are taught separately because they are not indicated in the verse.

original: de la thams cad la yang gang la sgra yod pa @48a * //
analyzed: de la thams cad la yang gang la sgra yod pa @48a * //
translated: In that regard, sound exists in all the elements.

original: de la de yang lhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la de yang lhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as an additional element in each case.

original: sgra'i khams kyang thams cad la lhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i khams kyang thams cad la lhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The element of sound should be understood in the same way, as being predominant in all.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification of the objects such as form, etc.

original: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: is as taught in the Abhidharma.

original: 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa mdangs bzang ba'i mthar thug pa reg bya'i skye mched du gang bstan pa ni rgyur byas ba'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa mdangs bzang ba'i mthar thug pa reg bya'i skye mched du gang bstan pa ni rgyur byas ba'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The tangible object that is taught as the final stage of the good appearance, such as softness, etc.

original: de ni 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid la rnam par gzhag cing de dag nyid la gdags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid la rnam par gzhag cing de dag nyid la gdags par rig par bya'o //
translated: is derivative form, and should be understood as being established in and imputed to those great elements.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po dang ba nyid la brten nas ni 'dam pa nyid gdags so //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po dang ba nyid la brten nas ni 'dam pa nyid gdags so //
translated: Among them, softness is imputed in dependence upon the fluidity of the great elements.

original: 'dus mkhregs nyid la brten nas ni lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus mkhregs nyid la brten nas ni lci ba nyid do //
translated: Weight is imputed in dependence upon the solidity of the great elements.

original: dang ba ma yin pa dang 'dus mkhregs ma yin pa nyid la brten nas ni rtsub pa nyid dang yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: dang ba ma yin pa dang 'dus mkhregs ma yin pa nyid la brten nas ni rtsub pa nyid dang yang ba nyid do //
translated: Roughness and lightness are imputed in dependence upon the non-fluidity and non-solidity of the great elements.

original: mnyen zhing snyi ba nyid la brten nas ni nem ne ma po nyid do //
analyzed: mnyen zhing snyi ba nyid la brten nas ni nem ne ma po nyid do //
translated: Warmth is imputed in dependence upon the heat of the great elements.

original: chu dang rlung 'dres pa las byung ba nyid la brten nas ni grang ba nyid do ;
analyzed: chu dang rlung 'dres pa las byung ba nyid la brten nas ni grang ba nyid do ;
translated: Coldness is due to the combination of water and wind.

original: / nye bar ston pa ma tshang bas mi mnyam pa nyid la brten nas ni bkres pa dang skom pa'o //
analyzed: / nye bar ston pa ma tshang bas mi mnyam pa nyid la brten nas ni bkres pa dang skom pa'o //
translated: Hunger and thirst are due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the deficiency of the teaching.

original: nyam chung ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyam chung ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Weakness is also like this.

original: de ma tshang ba med pas mi mnyam pa med pa la brten nas ni nyams stobs dang tshim pa'o //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med pas mi mnyam pa med pa la brten nas ni nyams stobs dang tshim pa'o //
translated: Strength and satisfaction are due to the equality of the elements, which is due to the non-deficiency of the teaching.

original: legs pa ma zhu bas 'khrugs pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni nad do ;
analyzed: legs pa ma zhu bas 'khrugs pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni nad do ;
translated: Sickness is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the disturbance of the well-digested elements.

original: / na tshod gyur pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: / na tshod gyur pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni rga ba'o //
translated: Aging is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the change in the faculties.

original: srog gi dbang po gyur pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gyur pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the change in the life faculty.

original: khrag la kun tu gnod pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni g-ya' ba'o //
analyzed: khrag la kun tu gnod pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni g-ya' ba'o //
translated: Itching is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the universal harm to the blood.

original: nyes par bzod pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni brgyal ba'o //
analyzed: nyes par bzod pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni brgyal ba'o //
translated: Fainting is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the bad digestion.

original: sa dang chu 'dres pa la brten nas ni 'gred pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu 'dres pa la brten nas ni 'gred pa'o //
translated: Swooning is due to the inequality of the elements, which is due to the combination of earth and water.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang brtsal ba dang 'bad pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni ngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang brtsal ba dang 'bad pa'i mi mnyam pa la brten nas ni ngal ba'o //
translated: The difference between coming and going, seeking and striving is called ‚Äúweariness.‚Äù

original: de dang bral ba'i mnyam pa la brten nas ni ngal sos ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i mnyam pa la brten nas ni ngal sos ba'o //
translated: The equality that is free from that is called ‚Äúrest.‚Äù

original: dri ma la sogs pa bsal zhing yongs su zhum pa dang bral ba la brten nas ni mdangs bzang ba gdags te /
analyzed: dri ma la sogs pa bsal zhing yongs su zhum pa dang bral ba la brten nas ni mdangs bzang ba gdags te /
translated: The removal of stains and so on, and being free from complete exhaustion, is called ‚Äúgood complexion.‚Äù

original: de dag thams cad bsdus na 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas skabs drug kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdus na 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas skabs drug kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: All of these are included in the six states of the great elements.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dang ba nyid dang dang ba ma yin pa nyid lhan cig pa dang / 'dus mkhregs pa nyid dang 'dus mkhregs pa ma yin pa nyid lhan cig pa dang / snyi ba nyid dang / @48b 'dres pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //üîΩde ltar na gnas skabs drug po de dag yod na brgyad du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang ba nyid dang dang ba ma yin pa nyid lhan cig pa dang / 'dus mkhregs pa nyid dang 'dus mkhregs pa ma yin pa nyid lhan cig pa dang / snyi ba nyid dang / @48b 'dres pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o // de ltar na gnas skabs drug po de dag yod na brgyad du 'gyur la /
translated: clarity and lack of clarity together, solidity and lack of solidity together, wetness, fluidity, and equality of the unequal.üîΩThus, if those six states exist, there are eight.

original: brgyad yod na yang drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyad yod na yang drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are eight, there are six.

original: gzugs la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa reg bya'i mthar thug pa de dag thams cad ni rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis rnam par shes par bya ba dag yin te /
translated: All of these, from visible form to the tangible, are cognized by two consciousnesses.

original: rang rang gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba dang yid kyi rnam par shes pas cig car ram /
analyzed: rang rang gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba dang yid kyi rnam par shes pas cig car ram /
translated: They are cognized by their own consciousnesses and by the mental consciousness.

original: rim gyis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis rnam par shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: They are cognized either simultaneously or successively.

original: mig la sogs pa lnga ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pus shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lnga ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pus shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The five beginning with the eye are cognized by the mental consciousness alone.

original: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro ni med la de dag gi khams ni yod do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro ni med la de dag gi khams ni yod do //
translated: In the realm of form, there is no odor or taste, but there is the element of odor and the element of taste.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de gnyis ni kham gyi zas kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni kham gyi zas kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these two are included in the food of contact.

original: de dag med pas sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang med de /
analyzed: de dag med pas sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa yang med de /
translated: Since they do not exist there, there is no olfactory consciousness or gustatory consciousness.

original: kun tu 'byung ba kho nar med kyi khams las ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba kho nar med kyi khams las ni ma yin no ;
translated: They do not exist there at all, not just in terms of the elements.

original: / de la gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i gzugs thams cad las rnam pa dgu ni rdzas su yod do //
analyzed: / de la gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i gzugs thams cad las rnam pa dgu ni rdzas su yod do //
translated: Among all the forms included in the aggregate of form, nine are substantial.

original: reg byas bsdus pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: reg byas bsdus pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: Among those forms included in the category of tangibility, the four great elements are substantial.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood as nominally existent.

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The form included in the sense-field of mental objects is twofold:

original: rdzas su yong pa dang brtags pa'i yong pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas su yong pa dang brtags pa'i yong pa'o //
translated: substantial and nominal.

original: mthu las byung ba ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sprul pa lta bu de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i yul dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mthu las byung ba ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sprul pa lta bu de'i 'bras bu dang / de'i yul dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin no //
translated: That which is the result of the supernormal powers, the object of concentration, like a magical creation, and the object of consciousness associated with it, is substantial.

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin par gtogs pa ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin par gtogs pa ni brtags pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: That which is included in the vows and the transgressions of vows is nominal.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs de yang ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gad dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag nyid dang de yang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs de yang ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba chen po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gad dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag nyid dang de yang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: The form that is the domain of concentration is form derived from the great elements that are the cause of the arising of concentration.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
translated: It arises in dependence on mundane concentration, whether it is contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not arise from supramundane concentration,

original: de ni spros pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i nyid nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems mnyam par gzhag @49a * //
analyzed: de ni spros pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa'i nyid nge 'dzin gyi rgyu las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // sems mnyam par gzhag @49a * //
translated: because it arises from concentration that is associated with conceptual proliferation.

original: pa thams cad la ni gang gzugs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i nus pa de med kyi /
analyzed: pa thams cad la ni gang gzugs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i nus pa de med kyi /
translated: All minds in equipoise do not have the ability to create form.

original: de dag las la la la yod de /
analyzed: de dag las la la la yod de /
translated: But some minds do have that ability.

original: sprul pa 'byung bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa 'byung bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the ability to create emanations.

original: rnam par ma brtags par sngon gyi yid la byed pa'i shugs kyis mun pa dang bral ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod par snang bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags par sngon gyi yid la byed pa'i shugs kyis mun pa dang bral ba shin tu rnam par dag pa mngon par brjod par snang bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which appears as the illumination of the very pure, free from darkness, by the power of previous mental attention without examination, should be seen as arisen.

original: rnam par brtags shing rnam par brtags shing mos pa'i dbang gis snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags shing rnam par brtags shing mos pa'i dbang gis snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma skyes pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That which appears by the power of belief when examined and examined should be seen as unarisen.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul ma yin yang la la de'i dbang gis byung ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul ma yin yang la la de'i dbang gis byung ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Although it is not the domain of supramundane concentration, it should be seen as arisen by the power of that.

original: de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: And that is inconceivable.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the form of the desire realm and the form of the form realm that exist as substances?

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni mchog tu 'od nges par 'byin pa'i phyir gsal ba dang / 'og ma'i dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba dang / de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang mi ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i gzugs ni mchog tu 'od nges par 'byin pa'i phyir gsal ba dang / 'og ma'i dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir cha phra ba dang / de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang mi ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: The form of the form realm is clear because it definitely emits supreme light. It is subtle because it is not the domain of the sense faculties of lower realms. It is not associated with suffering because there is no feeling of suffering in its body.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin pas /
translated: The form of the desire realm is not like that.

original: de ltar na de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the difference between the two.

original: yang mdor bsdu na gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdu na gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the characteristics of the form aggregate should be known as sixfold:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dang / cha phra ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / gnas dang / gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dang / cha phra ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of its own nature, the characteristic of its general nature, the characteristic of its abode, the characteristic of its connection as an abode, the characteristic of its utilization, the characteristic of its function, and the characteristic of its subtlety.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sa la sogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i so so'i dbang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sa la sogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i so so'i dbang ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The specific characteristic is the characteristic of solidity, etc., of earth, etc., and the characteristic of the eye, etc., of the eye, etc.

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs thams cad ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o //üîΩde la gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba chen po rnams ni gnas yin la /
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs thams cad ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'o // de la gnas dang gnas par 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba chen po rnams ni gnas yin la /
translated: The universal characteristic is that all form is characterized by resistance.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams ni gnas pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of the relation of container and contained is that the great elements are the container and form derived from the elements is the contained.

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi gzugs can rnams so sor 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i mtshan nyid ni nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi gzugs can rnams so sor 'byung ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of experience is that external form arises from the experience of the internal physical sense spheres.

original: nang gi skye mched @49b kyi nye bar spyod pa dang mthun pa nyid du gzugs 'dus pa la la ni sra ba kho nar 'byung la /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched @49b kyi nye bar spyod pa dang mthun pa nyid du gzugs 'dus pa la la ni sra ba kho nar 'byung la /
translated: Some collections of form arise as only solid, in accordance with the experience of the internal sense spheres.

original: la la ni gsher ba kho nar /
analyzed: la la ni gsher ba kho nar /
translated: Some arise as only liquid,

original: la la ni dro ba kho nar /üîΩla la ni gyo ba kho nar /
analyzed: la la ni dro ba kho nar / la la ni gyo ba kho nar /
translated: Some arise only as heat.üîΩSome arise only as movement.

original: la la ni 'dres pa kho nar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: la la ni 'dres pa kho nar 'byung ba'o //
translated: Some arise only as a mixture.

original: de la las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of action is as follows:üîΩThe characteristic of the great elements such as earth is support,

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi brten pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: cohesion, ripening, and movement.

original: de las gzhan yang 'og nas rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang 'og nas rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it will be taught in detail later.

original: de la cha phra ba'i mtshan nyid ni rdul phra rab kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la cha phra ba'i mtshan nyid ni rdul phra rab kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of subtlety is the characteristic of the most subtle particle.

original: yang cha phra ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang cha phra ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, subtlety is threefold:

original: 'bri ba cha phra ba nyid dang / rang bzhin cha phra ba nyid dang / sems kyi dbang bsgyur ba cha phra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bri ba cha phra ba nyid dang / rang bzhin cha phra ba nyid dang / sems kyi dbang bsgyur ba cha phra ba nyid do //
translated: subtlety of decrease, subtlety of nature, and subtlety of mental control.

original: de la 'bri ba cha phra ba nyid kyis ni rdul phra rab cha phra ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'bri ba cha phra ba nyid kyis ni rdul phra rab cha phra ba bstan to //
translated: By the subtlety of decrease, the most subtle particle is taught.

original: de la rang bzhin cha phra ba nyid kyis ni rlung la sogs pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs cha phra ba bstan to //
