analyzed: de la gzugs kyi rdul phra rab rnam pa dus rnam par gzhag par rig par bya zhen ;
translated: How many types of subtle atoms of form are there?

original: smras pa / rgya cher ni sa'i dngos gzhir rnam par gzhag par byas zin to //
analyzed: smras pa / rgya cher ni sa'i dngos gzhir rnam par gzhag par byas zin to //
translated: Reply: They are explained in detail in the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: mdor bsdu na ni rnam pa lnga ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni rnam pa lnga ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, there are five types:

original: yongs su gcod pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / lhan cig pa dang / cha shas med pas so //
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / lhan cig pa dang / cha shas med pas so //
translated: They are distinguished by their complete determination, their division, their nonmixture, their simultaneity, and their partlessness.

original: de la yongs su gcod pa las rnam par gzhag pa na gzugs dbri ba'i mtha' blos yongs su dpyad pa las rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par zad kyi /
analyzed: de la yongs su gcod pa las rnam par gzhag pa na gzugs dbri ba'i mtha' blos yongs su dpyad pa las rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag par zad kyi /
translated: If they are distinguished by their complete determination, then subtle atoms are posited by the mind that analyzes the ultimate limit of the reduction of form.

original: lus gzugs las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus gzugs las ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not posited by the body.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab kyi skye bar yang mi 'gyur /üîΩ'gag par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab kyi skye bar yang mi 'gyur / 'gag par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore subtle atoms do not arise and do not cease.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa gzugs 'dus pa yang ma yin @50a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa gzugs 'dus pa yang ma yin @50a * //
translated: The collection of subtle atoms is not form.

original: no ; / di la rnam par dbye ba las rnam par gzhag pa ni mdor bsdu na rdul phra rab ni rnam pa bco lnga yod de mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnam pa lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rdul phra rab rnam pa lnga dang sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi rdul phra rab rnam pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: no ; / di la rnam par dbye ba las rnam par gzhag pa ni mdor bsdu na rdul phra rab ni rnam pa bco lnga yod de mig la sogs pa dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnam pa lnga dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rdul phra rab rnam pa lnga dang sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyi rdul phra rab rnam pa bzhi dang /
translated: In brief, there are fifteen types of subtle particles: five types of subtle particles of the sense faculties such as the eye, five types of subtle particles of the objects such as form, four types of subtle particles of the primary elements such as earth,

original: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched du gtogs pa'i gzugs rdzas su yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnam pa gcig go //
translated: and one type of subtle particle that is substantially existent and included in the form of the phenomena element.

original: de la ma 'dres pa las rnam par gzhag pa ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las so //
analyzed: de la ma 'dres pa las rnam par gzhag pa ni rdzas kyi rdul phra rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa las so //
translated: Among them, the classification by way of unmixed is from the point of view of the definition of the substantial subtle particle.

original: de la lhan cig pa las rnam par gzhag pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ste /
analyzed: de la lhan cig pa las rnam par gzhag pa ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ste /
translated: Among them, the classification by way of simultaneous is from the point of view of the aggregation of subtle particles.

original: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs gcig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi phyogs gcig na /
translated: Thus, in one direction of the subtle particles of earth and so on,

original: de las gzhan pa dag phyogs gcig dang / tha mi dad pas rdul phra rab 'dus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag phyogs gcig dang / tha mi dad pas rdul phra rab 'dus par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The others are established as being part of it and as being an aggregation of subtle particles, because they are not different from it.

original: de la ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams phyogs gcig na tha mi dad par gnas pa dang / thogs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams phyogs gcig na tha mi dad par gnas pa dang / thogs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the phenomena that possess resistance were to exist in one place without being different from each other, they would not possess resistance.

original: de mngon par 'grub pa ni 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i lus kyi dbang las de ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub pa ni 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i lus kyi dbang las de ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because its manifestation is in accordance with its activity, it manifests in that way from the predominance of the body.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs 'dus pa thams cad ni dbang po thams cad kyi yongs su longs spyod pa thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa thams cad ni dbang po thams cad kyi yongs su longs spyod pa thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the aggregations of form are the common enjoyment of all the faculties.

original: de lta ma yin du zin na gal te 'dus pa thams cad la sa la la sogs pa thams cad tha mi dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni de lta na 'dus pa mtha' dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin par 'gyur
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na gal te 'dus pa thams cad la sa la la sogs pa thams cad tha mi dad pa ma yin par gyur na ni de lta na 'dus pa mtha' dag mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin par 'gyur
translated: If that were not so, if all the collections of earth, etc. were not different, then the entire collection would not be the object of eye consciousness, etc.

original: te / de'i phyir de dag gis yongs su longs spyod par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: te / de'i phyir de dag gis yongs su longs spyod par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, they would not be enjoyed.

original: de lta bas na tha mi dad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha mi dad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be understood as not different.

original: gzugs gang la lar thogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs gang la lar thogs par 'gyur la /
translated: There is a form that is obstructed in one place

original: la lar thogs par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: la lar thogs par mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: and not obstructed in another.

original: 'di lta ste dper na bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag thogs pa med pa bzhin du 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag thogs pa med pa bzhin du 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: For example, like the form, etc. of the intermediate existence, which is unobstructed. This should be understood in the same way.

original: de la cha shas med pa las rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa lnga ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yod na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas yin gyi /
analyzed: de la cha shas med pa las rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa lnga ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yod na ni rdul phra rab rnams cha shas yin gyi /
translated: There are five ways of positing the most subtle particle, which is partless. If there is a collection of most subtle particles, the most subtle particles have parts.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas gzhan med de /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni 'dus pa ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas gzhan med de /
translated: Since atoms are not composites, they have no parts.

original: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de nyid @50b kyi phyogs yin gyi cha shas kyis rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi phyogs gang yin pa de ni de nyid @50b kyi phyogs yin gyi cha shas kyis rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The part of an atom is the atom itself, not a part distinguished by a portion.

original: de la rdul phra rab ji skad bstan pa ni mig lnga'i phyir rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab ji skad bstan pa ni mig lnga'i phyir rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The atom is taught in five ways according to the five kinds of eyes:

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go / rdul phra rab du zhig /
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go / rdul phra rab du zhig /
translated: the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the Dharma eye, and the eye of the Buddha.üîΩHow many atoms are there?

original: mig du zhig gi spyod yul dang yul yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mig du zhig gi spyod yul dang yul yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How many eyes are there?

original: rdul phra rab thams cad ni sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mig rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab thams cad ni sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mig rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: All atoms are the domain and object of all eyes, except for the fleshly eye and the divine eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar lha'i mig ni gzugs 'dus pa nang dang phyi rol dang / 'og dang / steng dang / mdun dang / rgyab dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang bcas pa kho na 'dzin par zad kyi rdul phra rab rab tu 'byed par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha'i mig ni gzugs 'dus pa nang dang phyi rol dang / 'og dang / steng dang / mdun dang / rgyab dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang bcas pa kho na 'dzin par zad kyi rdul phra rab rab tu 'byed par mi byed de /
translated: Thus, the divine eye merely apprehends form that is internal and external, below and above, in front and behind, and with light and darkness. It does not distinguish the most subtle atom.

original: rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes rab kyis yongs su bcad cing rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo nyid ni shes rab kyis yongs su bcad cing rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the nature of the most subtle atom is determined and established by wisdom.

original: de la ci'i phyir na rdul phra rab ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir na rdul phra rab ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that the most subtle atom is neither produced nor destroyed?

original: smras pa / dang por mtha' dag 'dus te 'byung ba'i phyir dang / tha mar yang rdul phra rab kyi gnas skabs su ma gyur gyi bar du nye bar sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / dang por mtha' dag 'dus te 'byung ba'i phyir dang / tha mar yang rdul phra rab kyi gnas skabs su ma gyur gyi bar du nye bar sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it is because it is produced at the beginning as a whole and because it is applied until the end, when it becomes the state of the most subtle atom.

original: chu'i thigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chu'i thigs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a drop of water.

original: de la rnam pa lngas rdul phra rab la sems pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lngas rdul phra rab la sems pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the consideration of the most subtle atom in five ways should be known as improper.

original: gzugs 'dus pa la rdul phra rab rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'dzin pa ni rdul phra rab la sems pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa la rdul phra rab rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'dzin pa ni rdul phra rab la sems pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The conception of the atom as a self-existence of the aggregation of form is to be known as the improper thought of the atom.

original: rdul phra rab skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur bar 'dzin pa dang / rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra rab pa dang / bral bar 'dzin pa dang / gzugs 'dus pa ni rdul phra rab tsam gyi gnas skabs yin par 'dzin pa sdang / rdul phra rab rnams tshogs nas gzugs 'dus pa don gzhan du gyur pa bskyed par 'dzin pa yang rdul phra rab la sems pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur bar 'dzin pa dang / rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra rab pa dang / bral bar 'dzin pa dang / gzugs 'dus pa ni rdul phra rab tsam gyi gnas skabs yin par 'dzin pa sdang / rdul phra rab rnams tshogs nas gzugs 'dus pa don gzhan du gyur pa bskyed par 'dzin pa yang rdul phra rab la sems pa tshul bzhin ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The conception of the atom as arising and ceasing, the conception of the atom as a collection of atoms, the conception of the atom as a separation from atoms, the conception of the aggregation of form as a state of mere atoms, and the conception of the production of the aggregation of form by the collection of atoms as a different object‚Äîthese are to be known as the improper thought of the atom.

original: de la tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pas ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa lnga po de dag spangs te rdul phra rab bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pas ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa rnam pa lnga po de dag spangs te rdul phra rab bsam par bya'o //
translated: The one who is intent on the proper should abandon these five improper conceptions and think of the atom.

original: de la rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa las phan yon rnam pa lnga yod de ril po rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pas ni rnal 'byor ba @51a * //
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa las phan yon rnam pa lnga yod de ril po rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pas ni rnal 'byor ba @51a * //
translated: There are five benefits from the establishment of atoms:

original: rnams kyi dmigs pa la gsal ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur te de ni phan yon dang po yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi dmigs pa la gsal ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur te de ni phan yon dang po yin no //
translated: The first benefit is that the cause for the clarity of the object of meditation of yogins and yoginƒ´s is created by the establishment of the differentiation of wholes.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second benefit is that the cause for the abandonment of the view of the transitory collection is created.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nga rgyal spong ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du nga rgyal spong ba'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon gsum pa'o //
translated: The third benefit is that the cause for the abandonment of pride is created in the same way that the view of the transitory collection is abandoned.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth benefit is that the cause for the suppression of the afflictions is created.

original: myur du mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon lnga pa ste /
analyzed: myur du mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu byas par 'gyur ba ni phan yon lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth benefit is that the cause for the swift destruction of signs is created.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni rdul phra rab bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni rdul phra rab bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the way to reflect on atoms.

original: de la gzugs can gyi rdzas rnams kyi skye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi rdzas rnams kyi skye ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of material substances should be seen in brief as fivefold:

original: gnas las skye ba dang / sa bon las skye ba dang / 'phen pa las skye ba dang / phan 'dogs pa las skye ba dang / gnod pa byed pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: gnas las skye ba dang / sa bon las skye ba dang / 'phen pa las skye ba dang / phan 'dogs pa las skye ba dang / gnod pa byed pa las skye ba'o //
translated: arising from a place, arising from a seed, arising from impulsion, arising from benefit, and arising from harm.

original: de la gnas las skye ba ni 'byung ba chen po la brten nas 'byung ba chen po'i phyogs su de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnas las skye ba ni 'byung ba chen po la brten nas 'byung ba chen po'i phyogs su de las gzhan pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Arising from a place is the arising of derivative form from the side of the great elements that are its cause, on the basis of the great elements.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is said that derivative form is based on the four great elements,

original: phyogs gcig las nye bar blangs bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig las nye bar blangs bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is derived from one part of them.

original: de la gzugs 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid las dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni de la yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs 'dus pa gang las 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rang gi mtshan nyid las dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni de la yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising of derivative form from the collection of form and the observation of the characteristics of the great elements that are its cause should be understood as existing in it.

original: de gang la gang mi dmigs pa de ni de la med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de gang la gang mi dmigs pa de ni de la med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Whatever is not apprehended in regard to something should be known as not existing in that.

original: de ltar na de ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is a brief presentation of the characteristics of existence and non-existence.

original: gal te gang la gang mi dmigs pa de yang de la ji ltar dmigs pa de bzhin du yod par gyur na /üîΩde de dang rdzas mtshungs pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te gang la gang mi dmigs pa de yang de la ji ltar dmigs pa de bzhin du yod par gyur na / de de dang rdzas mtshungs pa zhig gam /
translated: If whatever is not apprehended in regard to something were to exist in that just as it is apprehended,

original: rdzas mi mtshungs pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rdzas mi mtshungs pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: would it be the same substantial entity as that or a different substantial entity?

original: gal te rdzas mtshungs zhes byar ni mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rdzas mtshungs zhes byar ni mi dmigs pas mi rung ngo //
translated: If it were the same substantial entity, it would not be tenable that it is not apprehended.

original: gal te rdzas mi mtshungs pa zhig yin na yang /üîΩrdzas mi mtshungs pa de de tsam zhig gam /
analyzed: gal te rdzas mi mtshungs pa zhig yin na yang / rdzas mi mtshungs pa de de tsam zhig gam /
translated: If it were a different substantial entity,

original: mthu las yin grang na /
analyzed: mthu las yin grang na /
translated: would that different substantial entity be just that or would it be due to power?

original: gal te de tsam zhig las zhes byar ni /
analyzed: gal te de tsam zhig las zhes byar ni /
translated: If it were just that,

original: des na cung zad kyang dmigs su med pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na cung zad kyang dmigs su med pas mi rung ngo //
translated: then it would not be tenable that it is not apprehended at all.

original: gal te mthu las zhes byar ni /
analyzed: gal te mthu las zhes byar ni /
translated: If it were due to power,

original: des na mtshan @51b nyid las tha dad pa'i mthu gzhan mi dmigs pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na mtshan @51b nyid las tha dad pa'i mthu gzhan mi dmigs pas mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, since another power different from the characteristics is not observed, it is not tenable.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gnas las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni gnas las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is similar to that should be known as arising from a basis.

original: de la sa bon las skye ba ni rang gi sa bon las 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sa bon las skye ba ni rang gi sa bon las 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Arising from seeds is that which occurs from its own seed.üîΩFor example, a combination that is solid sometimes becomes soft when conditions come together, and the soft sometimes becomes solid.

original: 'di lta ste dper na 'dus pa sra ba ni lan 'ga' ni rkyen nye bar gyur ba na sla bar gyur la sla ba yang lan 'ga' ni sra bar 'gyur ba dang / grang ba yang dro bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na 'dus pa sra ba ni lan 'ga' ni rkyen nye bar gyur ba na sla bar gyur la sla ba yang lan 'ga' ni sra bar 'gyur ba dang / grang ba yang dro bar 'gyur la /
translated: Cold becomes warm,üîΩand warm becomes cold.

original: dro ba yang grang bar 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba yang g-yo bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dro ba yang grang bar 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo ba yang g-yo bar 'gyur la /
translated: The unmoving becomes moving,üîΩand the moving becomes unmoving.

original: g-yo ba yang mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba yang mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba yang rig par bya ste /
translated: The good color and bad color, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang /
translated: Thus, even though the characteristics do not exist,

original: khams yod na 'dus pa de dang de las chos gzugs can bye brag can de dang de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams yod na 'dus pa de dang de las chos gzugs can bye brag can de dang de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the elements are present, the various kinds of material things arise from the combination of the elements.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni sa bon las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni sa bon las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the way in which one should understand the arising of things from seeds.

original: de la 'phen pa las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'phen pa las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Arising from impulsion is as follows:

original: nang gi dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po brtan pa rnams 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nang gi dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po brtan pa rnams 'byung ba ste /
translated: The external, stable things arise by the power of the internal, material faculties.

original: 'di lta ste snod kyi 'jig rten rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste snod kyi 'jig rten rnams so //
translated: For example, the world of the environment arises from the impulsion of the karma of sentient beings.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams kyang sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: The internal sense spheres arise from the impulsion of previous karma.

original: de la 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa'i lha rnams dang / 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i mi rnams kyi yo byad rnams ni yang dang yang 'phen pa'i skye ba las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa'i lha rnams dang / 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i mi rnams kyi yo byad rnams ni yang dang yang 'phen pa'i skye ba las 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The things of the gods who enjoy material things and the things of the humans of Uttarakuru should be understood as arising from the impulsion of karma that is repeatedly projected.

original: mi rnams kyi ni snod bstan pa dag las te /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni snod bstan pa dag las te /
translated: The things of humans arise from the impulsion of karma that is not repeatedly projected.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni 'phen pa las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni 'phen pa las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the arising from impulsion is like this and similar.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa las skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising from assistance is as follows:

original: chos gzugs can de dang de dag phan 'dogs pa'i rkyen de dang de dag la brten nas ches brtas pa dang / shin tu brtas pa dang / shin tu mchog dang / shin tu khyad par du 'phags par skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chos gzugs can de dang de dag phan 'dogs pa'i rkyen de dang de dag la brten nas ches brtas pa dang / shin tu brtas pa dang / shin tu mchog dang / shin tu khyad par du 'phags par skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Those entities that have form arise in a way that is more and more enhanced, more and more refined, and more and more distinguished, in dependence upon the assistance of this or that condition.

original: 'di lta ste dper na chu la sogs pas brlan pa rnams kyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na chu la sogs pas brlan pa rnams kyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, this is like the arising of a sprout, etc.,

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni phan 'dogs pa las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni phan 'dogs pa las skye ba yin no //
translated: One should understand that the arising from assistance is like this and similar.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gnod pa byed pa las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gnod pa byed pa las skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising from harm should be understood in the opposite way.

original: de la 'dus pa skye ba nas rdzas sna tshogs mchig la btags te chu dang sbyar ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du skye ba la bya'i @52a * //
analyzed: de la 'dus pa skye ba nas rdzas sna tshogs mchig la btags te chu dang sbyar ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du skye ba la bya'i @52a * //
translated: The arising from a collection is like the arising of a pot from a lump of clay, etc.,

original: til dang sran chung dang / mon sran gre'u la sogs pa'i phung po rnam par gzhag pa lta bu la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: til dang sran chung dang / mon sran gre'u la sogs pa'i phung po rnam par gzhag pa lta bu la ni mi bya'o //
translated: It is not like the heaps of sesame seeds, beans, or peas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bya ba byed pa'i phyir de ltar skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i phyir de ltar skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises in order to perform a function.

original: de ltar de'i skye ba'i rgyu ni dbang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i skye ba'i rgyu ni dbang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cause of its arising is the faculty.

original: gang gi tshe 'du byed thams cad rang gi sa bon las skye ba'i tshe ci'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'du byed thams cad rang gi sa bon las skye ba'i tshe ci'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyur byas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: When all formations arise from their own seeds, why is it that primary matter is said to be the cause of derivative matter?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / de dag 'gyur bas 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag 'gyur bas 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it changes, it is the cause of change,üîΩand because it is the cause of support and retention.

original: de la rgyu gsum gyis na 'byung ba chen po gyur pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste ;
analyzed: de la rgyu gsum gyis na 'byung ba chen po gyur pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste ;
translated: In this regard, derivative matter arises from the transformation of the primary elements because of three causes:

original: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / las dang / snyoms par 'jug pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / las dang / snyoms par 'jug pas so //
translated: the activity of a person, action, and meditative development.

original: de la skyes bu'i byed pa ni sa'i mngon par gnod pa'i bye brag dang / snod kyi bye brag dang / zhing gi bye brag las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de 'gyur bar snang ba dang / chu'i mngon par brlan pa la sogs pa dang / me'i yongs su smin pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: de la skyes bu'i byed pa ni sa'i mngon par gnod pa'i bye brag dang / snod kyi bye brag dang / zhing gi bye brag las rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de 'gyur bar snang ba dang / chu'i mngon par brlan pa la sogs pa dang / me'i yongs su smin pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: The transformation of form derived from the specific activity of water, such as moistening, and the specific activity of fire, such as ripening, and

original: rlung gi yongs su skam pa la sogs pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: rlung gi yongs su skam pa la sogs pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur bar snang ba ste /
translated: the specific activity of wind, such as drying, is also seen.

original: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brten te rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba skyes bu'i byed pas byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brten te rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba skyes bu'i byed pas byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the transformation of form derived from the four great elements should be seen as the activity of beings.

original: de la las ni las dang mthun par dang por 'byung ba chen po 'byung la /
analyzed: de la las ni las dang mthun par dang por 'byung ba chen po 'byung la /
translated: In this regard, karma is the initial arising of the great elements in accordance with karma.

original: de'i 'og tu de dang mthun pa de las byung ba'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dang mthun pa de las byung ba'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ste /
translated: Subsequently, the transformation of form derived from that arises in accordance with that.

original: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brten te rgyur byas ba'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba las kyis byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brten te rgyur byas ba'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba las kyis byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be seen that the transformation of form derived from the great elements is caused by action.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'byung ba chen po sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa yang 'byung ba chen po sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: The meditative attainment is also the transformation of form derived from the great elements, since the great elements precede it.

original: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brtan te rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba snyoms par 'jug pas byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'byung ba chen po rnams la brtan te rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba 'byung ba snyoms par 'jug pas byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be seen that the transformation of form derived from the great elements is caused by meditative attainment.

original: de la mdor bsdu na rgyu lngas ni 'byung ba chen po 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa las 'bras bu gzhan 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na rgyu lngas ni 'byung ba chen po 'bras bu gzhan du gyur pa las 'bras bu gzhan 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, the transformation of the great elements into another effect is accomplished by five causes.

original: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po'i stobs dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i stobs dang / rig sngags kyi stobs dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / las kyi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'byung ba chen po'i stobs dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i stobs dang / rig sngags kyi stobs dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / las kyi stobs kyis so //
translated: namely, the power of the great elements, the power of the person‚Äôs action, the power of the incantation, the power of the supernormal being, and the power of karma.

original: 'di nas shi @52b 'phos shing shi ba'i dus byas pa'i bar mdo'i srid pa'i gzugs 'dus pa gang yin pa de rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'di nas shi @52b 'phos shing shi ba'i dus byas pa'i bar mdo'i srid pa'i gzugs 'dus pa gang yin pa de rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis 'byung zhe na /
translated: What are the causes and conditions for the arising of the form of the intermediate existence of one who has died and passed on from here?

original: smras pa / rang gi sa bon ni rgyu yin la de skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ni rkyen yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rang gi sa bon ni rgyu yin la de skye bar 'gyur ba'i las ni rkyen yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the cause is the seed and the condition is the karma that produces it.

original: bar mdo'i srid pa yod par rgyu gang gis khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bar mdo'i srid pa yod par rgyu gang gis khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: By what cause is the existence of the intermediate state known?

original: smras pa / shi 'phos nas sems dang sems las byung ba gnas med pa rnams yul gzhan du phyin mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rnam par 'phrul pa tsam yin pas brag ca lta bur yang mi rung ba dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan lta bur yang mi rung ba dang /
analyzed: smras pa / shi 'phos nas sems dang sems las byung ba gnas med pa rnams yul gzhan du phyin mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rnam par 'phrul pa tsam yin pas brag ca lta bur yang mi rung ba dang / ma 'gags pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan lta bur yang mi rung ba dang /
translated: It is said: Because it is impossible for minds and mental factors that have died and transmigrated to go to another place without a basis and because they are merely emanations, they are not like an echo. Because they are not blocked, they are not like a reflection.

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa 'dzin pa lta bur yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dmigs pa 'dzin pa lta bur yang mi rung ste /
translated: Because they do not go, they are not like the apprehension of an object.

original: gang gi phyir dpe de dag mi rung pa de'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe de dag mi rung pa de'i phyir bar mdo'i srid pa yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Because those examples are not suitable, intermediate existence should be known to exist.
